column1: Fix re-calculation of BDF when Customer has updated parent
column30:
Check comment in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6411|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6411|smart-link]  related to BDF PC-2024-100008975

Steps to Reproduce the issue:

# Ensure that “Co-Op Percentage” of Group Customer “IND” = $0.00
# Create a new BDF with the following properties:
## Customer = Customer which has Group = “IND“ (Customer.Parent (Sub).Parent (Rollup).Parent (Group) = “IND”
## Calculated Fund Type = “Group”
## Prior Year Net Purchases = $204,117.72
# After BDF has calculated fields updated, observe that BDF has “Funds Allocated” = $0.00. This is because Group Customer “IND” has “Co-Op Percentage” = 0%
# Update Customer from step 2 and assign a different Parent to it, so that it will have “Group“ with “Co-Op Percentage” = 1%

Expected:

* BDF’s field “Funds Allocated“ should be updated with value $2,041.18 ($204,117.72 = 1%) because after step 4 “Customer“ has a new “Group“ with “Co-Op Percentage” = 1%

Actual:

* BDF’s field “Funds Allocated“ is not updated and remains $0.00

*Before the implementation of this task:*

The re-calculation of “BDF“ fields is triggered in the next cases:

* BDF is created
* BDF has one of the next fields updated: “Prior Year Net Purchases“, “Fund Year“, “Customer“, “Calculated Fund Type“
* Co-Op Request created
* Co-Op Request has one of the next fields updated: “Amount Requested“, “Fund Year“, “Customer“, “Amount Approved“, “Status“
* Customer has field “Co-Op Percentage“ updated

*After the implementation of this task:*

The re-calculation of “BDF“ fields is triggered in the next cases:

* BDF is created
* BDF has one of the next fields updated: “Prior Year Net Purchases“, “Fund Year“, “Customer“, “Calculated Fund Type“
* Co-Op Request created
* Co-Op Request has one of the next fields updated: “Amount Requested“, “Fund Year“, “Customer“, “Amount Approved“, “Status“
* {color:#36b37e}*Customer has one of the next fields updated: “Co-Op Percentage“, “Parent“*{color}

column1: [BACKEND] Support correct display of attribute in group "Documents" automatically
column30:
The current implementation added in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-4991|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-4991|smart-link] has hard-coded logic:

* Display the next attributes as document links if they are added in group “Documents“:
** dt_installation_instructions
** dt_installation_instructions_2
** dt_installation_instructions_3
** dt_technical_data_sheet
** dt_tds
** dt_tds_2
** dt_safety_data_sheet
** dt_sds
** dt_sds_2
** dt_sds_3
** dt_sds_4
** dt_sds_5
** dt_sds_6
** dt_sds_7
** dt_infographic_01
** dt_infographic_02
** dt_infographic_03
** dt_drawings

This implementation requires maintenance and changes in the code every time the business needs to add a new attribute to this group.

The suggested approach is to refactor the implementation to automatically display any attribute in the group “Documents “ using a proper format: an icon that refers to a link from the attribute value. In this way, a business can add any new attributes in the group “Documents“, and it will appear using the expected format automatically, so there will be no development/qa time needed to be spent.

column1: Create Over Reciept Limit in JDE to mimic JDA 10% over receipt threshold
column30:
during go live - JDE received a transaction to receive several skus at a multiple greater than 2X of what was open on the inbound order.  In JDA we have allowed for a 10% above PO qty receipt, but we need to mimic this limitation in JDE.



we have fixed the JDA issue that sent a bad receipt qty.  This will be an extra layer to protect from over receipts across the company

column1: CPOV - Update Customer Flow - Dummy Acct
column30:
h2. Ask:

# Update the informatica flow (that identifies customer) to validate the customer by EDI Ship To ID before the Trading Partner ID validation.
# Create Individual (SOFT Error) for Trading Partner ID to push to ORO if no Trading Partner can be validated.



h2. Use Case:

* Customer sends order via EDI or Conexiom and their account is missing trading partner ID → Informatica flags the account as a “Dummy Account” and customer pricing cannot validate. 
** Users can currently see the EDI Ship To ID and update the account by typing the EDI Ship To number provided into the Ship To Customer field to locate the customer.

column1: Disappearing code from landing pages. Part 2
column30:
This issue was created based on a report from [~accountid:61112cb10b454a006861bd0b] on today’s call. The issue is similar to [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5244|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5244|smart-link] .

*Steps to reproduce the issue:*

# Open Landing Page with name Thermostats and Controls (ID = 120)  
# Using the “Import” button in WYSWIG, copy the full content of the Landing Page
# Create a new Landing Page and using the “Import” button in WYSWIG, paste the content to the Landing Page
## This Landing Page created on UAT here - [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/cms/page/view/127|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/cms/page/view/127]
# Open edit page of the created Landing Page, and observe that it shows empty content + JS errors
## [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/cms/page/update/127|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/cms/page/update/127]
## !image-20240223-010435.png|width=1843,height=1045!

Sanitized DB dump from UAT can be found at [https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/15-IGWlCjDiJbyy5go0Q_Wb4xJjqFxKfV|https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/15-IGWlCjDiJbyy5go0Q_Wb4xJjqFxKfV|smart-link] ({{ocom-diversitech-uat5-2024-02-14-0500.sql.gz}}).
column166:
22/Feb/24 8:07 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:61112cb10b454a006861bd0b], can you please review the ticket description and add additional/missing details?

Also, considering that [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] mentioned that the content of the DEVCO Landing Page looks modified on the view page compared to the original Landing Page that you used to copy, does it mean that after step 2 you made some changes to the content? If so, can you share more details about what changes you do? If this is easier for you, please try to replicate the issue and record a screen-sharing that shows the whole process.
column167: 22/Feb/24 8:15 PM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] - after step 2, you can still make changes to original landing page. In step 3 after page save, you cannot edit and content window is blank.
column168:
23/Feb/24 8:49 AM;61112cb10b454a006861bd0b;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] the only edit I did was delete the top image. I follow the same process for every landing page I create. I used code from a currently functioning page, in this case: [https://d2.diversitech.com/thermostats-and-controls|https://d2.diversitech.com/thermostats-and-controls]. I did create this page from scratch to ensure that there would be no potential error brought from a previously created page.

I copy the code into notepad. I used this code as the basis to create the 5 level 2 pages in the thermostats category, IDs 121-125. When I paste the code I would just update the images and copy where needed, save, and move on. All of these pages look to be functioning fine and show content in the WYSIWYG.

I did the same to the DEVCO landing page, but this page lost the content in the WYSIWYG, like the Heating Products page. 

I standardized my approach, and there isn’t any deviation in how I create pages. If there is an issue in how I copy and edit pages, then almost every page would have this issue, as a majority of them used the same code I copied over to each of them.
column169:
23/Feb/24 11:48 AM;557058:9faed481-f20c-4b44-b2a4-6d509e95e185;[~accountid:61112cb10b454a006861bd0b] , did you remove the part that is in a grey or a blue rectangle?


!Create-Landing-Page-Landing-Pages-Marketing.png|thumbnail!
column170: 23/Feb/24 2:32 PM;61112cb10b454a006861bd0b;[~accountid:557058:9faed481-f20c-4b44-b2a4-6d509e95e185] on the Devco page? I believe I did remove what was in grey on the Devco page.
column171: 23/Feb/24 2:56 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:61112cb10b454a006861bd0b] The issue arises when "" is removed from "" in the WYSIWYG in ORO. Currently, this results in a malfunction, breaking the WYSIWYG functionality. Previously, a bug was fixed where a similar problem occurred when users dragged and dropped images from the WYSIWYG UI ([https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5244|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5244|smart-link] ). However, there is currently no preventive mechanism in place to ensure the WYSIWYG functions without a JavaScript error if the user manually removes from using the HTML editor. Consequently, when a user deletes from , the WYSIWYG fails with a JavaScript error, leading to blank content on the edit page. Two suggested options are as follows: Option 1: Advise users not to delete from . If the image needs to be removed, the entire element should be deleted. Pros: * No development required Cons: * Users may inadvertently break the page by accidentally removing Option 2: Implement a hot-fix solution to prevent JS errors when is invalid and does not contain . Pros: * Users can input invalid HTML (invalid elements), and the WYSIWYG will continue to function without JS errors. Cons: * Requires development time, potentially an 8-hour task or more. I assume we need the Option 2, correct? cc [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1]
column172: 23/Feb/24 2:59 PM;61112cb10b454a006861bd0b;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] for clarification, I did not remove anything from the HTML editor. I copied the code through the HTML editor, but the image removal was done in the WYSIWYG - if that makes a difference. I selected the image with my cursor and deleted it.
column173: 23/Feb/24 3:09 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:61112cb10b454a006861bd0b], this changes things. I was able to reproduce the same issue. Looks as if the current version of the WYSIWYG does not process image deletion correctly. We will be working on a fix, and hopefully deliver it to the master/UAT on Tuesday/Wednesday next week.
column174: 26/Feb/24 7:15 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;The fix was merged to master in [https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/pull/1288|https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/pull/1288|smart-link]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Add automatic health-check in ORO that validates consistency of Product primary UOM in ORO vs primary UOM in JDE
* If validation failed, as any other health check the application should send email notification admin users, so that the team can be notified and take action to resolve the problem

Example of the issue - [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2301|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2301|smart-link]

For example, the product with SKU = “VAX-3“ should have primary UOM = “PK“.

We need to know SQL to build an automatic health check on the ORO end, to validate consistency of primary UOM in ORO vs JDE.

* Today morning before the shift started BY team deployed the fix to PROD.

column1: DTC P4 - Need to modify the costing logic of the jde_costing_logic view
column30:
--NOTE 2/21/2024 Jesse requested that the Each restriction be removed from the jde costing view. The goal here is to send a zero cost for an item that has multiple costs for the same supplier-branch combo or
--supplier-NO_branch combo regardless of the UOM on the Supplier?price Item REviesion screen. Example FLYASH-F-FL has a supplier-branch combo cost for both EA and TN so this would send a 0 for the supplier-w-branch cost and the defualt coast would
--go to the no branch supplier cost of the uom LB.
--other examples are ITM - 123588	litem - ACB-42  which has  two PK costs. This should send a zero if there are two of them and the correct PK cost if there is only 1
--other example is 347784	CEMENT-FL where there is only 1 supplier to branch cost for supplier 70494 to branch 11700 for UOM TN.

--The way the pricing works is that it first look to see if there is a cost for a sku for that specific supplier and specific branch - F41061 table
--if no
--Then it looks to see if there is a cost for the sku for that specific supplier (without a branch) - F41061 table
--if no
--Then it looks to the Item Cost Revision screen to see if it has a Cost method 08 and P are for Puchasing-Base Cost No Adds - F4105
--if no
--Then it looks to the Item Cost Revision screen to see if it has a Cost method 02 and I are for Weighted Average Cost - F4105
--if no
--Then it looks to see if the supplier listed is actually a diversitech facility. If it is then it looks to see if the there is a cost for the item at the branch that is listed as a supplier
--if no
--Then it searches for any active cost for this item and chooses the highest one.

column173:
26/Feb/24 1:43 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1],

{quote}If we create new groups, we will have to assign users to those groups and then ALSO adjust permissions as well yes{quote}

In default ORO implementation:

* The User Group can be used in notification rules and filters.
* The User Group does not have a relation with Roles.
* So assigning the Group to the User will have no impact on User’s permissions and you will still have to use Roles to manage permissions.

Technically, we can check and implement customization that will cover the next user stories:

* As an Administrator, I want to assign one or multiple Roles to a User Group (the same as I can do it for a User)
* As an Administrator, I want the User to obtain permissions based on the Roles of the assigned User Groups

On a high level, the LOE is going to be around 30-60 hours.

column168:
20/Feb/24 2:37 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5f31179632360700383d0325], the updating of the field YTD works based on the logic implemented in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-1407|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-1407|smart-link] 

This logic has next query for updating YTD of X/B customers:

{noformat}-- Step 2.3. Update balances for parent Customer (type X and B)
UPDATE oro_customer
SET dt_sales_total_ytd        = ytd,
    dt_sales_total_py         = py,
    dt_sales_total_pytd       = pytd,
    dt_sales_total_pct_change =
        CASE
            WHEN pytd IS NULL OR pytd = 0 THEN 0
            ELSE ROUND((COALESCE(ytd, 0) - pytd) / pytd, 4)
            END,
    updated_at                = NOW()
FROM dt_parent_balances_work cb
WHERE TRIM(dt_jde_id) = TRIM(cb.parent)
  AND dt_billing_type_id IN ('X', 'B')
  AND dt_entity_type_id = 'customer';{noformat}

There are no records in {{dt_parent_balances_work}} that match the customer you are referring to:

{noformat}orodb=> select * from dt_parent_balances_work where parent = '9099';
 parent | ytd | py | pytd | updated_at 
--------+-----+----+------+------------
(0 rows){noformat}

Please check with your team who maintains the data in table {{dt_parent_balances_work}} and other tables used in this logic

The full script with documentation comments can be found in [https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/blob/master/src/DT/Bundle/AccountPlanBundle/Feature/CalculatedFields/Schedule/Resources/queries.sql|https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/blob/master/src/DT/Bundle/AccountPlanBundle/Feature/CalculatedFields/Schedule/Resources/queries.sql]

{noformat}-- Step 2.3. Update balances for parent Customer (type X and B)
UPDATE oro_customer
SET dt_sales_total_ytd        = ytd,
    dt_sales_total_py         = py,
    dt_sales_total_pytd       = pytd,
    dt_sales_total_pct_change =
        CASE
            WHEN pytd IS NULL OR pytd = 0 THEN 0
            ELSE ROUND((COALESCE(ytd, 0) - pytd) / pytd, 4)
            END,
    updated_at                = NOW()
FROM dt_parent_balances_work cb
WHERE TRIM(dt_jde_id) = TRIM(cb.parent)
  AND dt_billing_type_id IN ('X', 'B')
  AND dt_entity_type_id = 'customer';{noformat}

If we need to change the logic, need to discuss the new requirements.

column1: filter entityordererrorcases not working for get tasks API in ORO
column30:
While fetching the tasks where context is saved as a particular error case number, it returns all tasks present in the ORO. for example below two API’s returns same number of records even though the filter passed to them in URL are different error cases.

[https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/api/tasks?fields[entityordererrorcases]=56650&page[number]=1&page[size]=10&sort=id|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/api/tasks?fields[entityordererrorcases]=56650&page[number]=1&page[size]=10&sort=id]


[https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/api/tasks?fields[entityordererrorcases]=1&page[number]=1&page[size]=10&sort=id|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/api/tasks?fields[entityordererrorcases]=1&page[number]=1&page[size]=10&sort=id]
column166: 20/Feb/24 7:53 AM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;[~accountid:557058:70b21438-d9ea-4804-8924-80b2d963d3a8] - what is the exact ask here?
column167:
20/Feb/24 5:57 PM;557058:70b21438-d9ea-4804-8924-80b2d963d3a8;Hi [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] 
There is a bug in ORO API (get tasks) which I have mentioned above in description. When we filter tasks for order error case then it always returns 400k records (which is the count of all tasks in the ORO) instead of returning only the tasks created within that order error case.
column168:
21/Feb/24 9:32 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:557058:70b21438-d9ea-4804-8924-80b2d963d3a8],

Check [http://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/api/doc|http://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/api/doc] and scroll down to “GET /admin/api/tasks“.

There is a filter that you need:

!image-20240222-022823.png|width=1638,height=218!

The parameter “fields” that you are using has a different purpose:

!image-20240222-022914.png|width=1638,height=218!

So, to filter tasks that are related to Order Error Cases, try to use the next kind of request:

{noformat}{{base_url}}/admin/api/tasks?filter[activityTargets][entityordererrorcases]=55285&page[number]=1&page[size]=10&sort=id{noformat}
column170:

How can I fetch UniqueName of the errorcase using below API ? I tried using below it didn’t return uniqueName for errorcase
{{/admin/api/tasks?filter[activityTargets][entityordererrorcases]=56650&fields[entityordererrorcases]=uniqueName&page[number]=1&page[size]=10&sort=id}}

is it possible to select specific feilds for activitytargets?

column1: Streamlining Informatica Job Migration: Development to Staging
column30: Currently, Informatica dev is functioning as our production environment. The mapping was developed without following the formal transition process to the stage and production environments. To rectify this, we'll move the mapping to the stage and then, in due course, to the production environment, ensuring all dependencies are handled correctly. This will align with the intended use of these three environments.

column30:
h2. Specification

Check the next documentation:

[^DEV-3033_attributes_report_prod_2024-02-20.xlsx]

The report is generated based on PROD data on Feb 15th.

Description of the columns:

* *label*
Label of the attribute in the Salsify/Catsy file
* *field_name*
Name of the field in ORO (note, we are going to update only “dt_“ attributes, they are already filtered in the file)
* *Change Required*
Calculated field, TRUE if the storage type of data type is changed
* *Old Storage Type*
The current storage type of the attribute (“column in the table” vs “serialized field”)
* *New Storage Type*
The expected storage type of the attribute (“column in the table” vs “serialized field”)
* *Old Data Type*
The current date type of the attribute (enum, float, string, text, boolean, integer)
* *Data Type Based On Data*
Attempt to guess the attribute type based on the real values in PROD
* *New Data Type*
The new expected date type of the attribute (enum, float, string, text, boolean, integer)
* *Type From Catsy*
Type of the attribute based on information from Catsy
* *Type Confirmed by DT*
Please use this field to confirm/approve the attribute type. Some attributes already have TRUE in this column, since they appeared in the list provided in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|smart-link] 
* *Review Comments*
Any comments and notes

h2. How will this specification be used?

Our team will use this specification to update types of all “dt_“ attributes created previously by Salsify/Catsy import.

h2. Scope of this task:

* Please review this document, and confirm the expected data type in column “New Data Type“ is correct. You can use the column “Type Confirmed by DT“ to add your approval for each case.
* Do not change columns from “A” to “Y”.
* Provide an updated file with the filled-in column “Type Confirmed by DT“, or provide approval in any other convenient form.
* Answer questions

h2. Questions:

# Some attributes contain values that could be converted to a boolean type. For example “YES“, “NO“, “N/A“. What is your preference:
## Convert such attributes to boolean type in ORO
### Pros
#### Easier to use in reports/grids
#### Impossible to add incorrect values that are not valid booleans
### Cons
#### If the attribute obtains a new value in the future, e.g. “ABC“, it will be converted to “YES“/TRUE
## Convert such attributes to string type in ORO
### Pros
#### The attribute can keep any value, even if the value will be not simply “YES“/”NO” in the future.
### Cons
#### UX is worse, e.g. if this attribute is used in grid/report/form, the user will see the field as a string with variable text to enter, instead of a drop-down with “YES“/”NO” options

{color:#4c9aff}        *For the “Yes”,”No”,”N/A” values I think converting them to string would help us expedite our imports.* {color}

# A lot of attributes with the type “PICKLIST“ on Salsify contain the value “N/A“. Can we assume that “N/A“ simply means NULL?
{color:#4c9aff}*In this instance ‘N/A’ refers to Not Applicable.* {color}

20/Feb/24 4:13 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:621cf583a124500068860e4d], the updated version of the document was uploaded. See file {{DEV-3033_attributes_report_prod_2024-02-20.xlsx}} in the description.

The type in “New Data Type“ is set based on the next logic:

* Keep the current/old type if the field is used anywhere in the business logic of the application, reports, segments, etc.
* Keep enum types for the fields you mentioned in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033]
* Use type text for values that have long length
* Use money type for price fields
* Use integer type for Catsy integers
* Use float type for Catsy decimals
* Use string type for Catsy strings and assets
* Use string type for Catsy picklists

We need either your approval for the whole document, or you can approve each row one by one using column “Type Confirmed by DT“.

PS. Please do not use file {{DEV-3033_attributes_report_prod_2024-02-15_v2.xlsx}}. It is outdated.

column1: MVP+ CPOV - Multiple Lines Containing Same SKU
column30:
h2. Case Scenario 

* Customer sends a PO with 2 or more lines containing the same sku
** The price validation will returns the price for one line with the duplicated sku, but will return N/A for the second line with the duplicated sku
** This is also reflected on the Failure Notification Emails to the customer → [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6237|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6237|smart-link] 

h2. Example Order: 

* PROD: ORO Order #953930 / PO #6289183
* SKU: ISO-18 → Appears on Lines 14 & 32
** Line 14 → Shows N/A in the DT Price Column
** Line 32 → Shows Prices in the DT Price Column

!SKU Dupe - Line 14.png|width=845,height=173!

!SKU Dupe - Line 32.png|width=834,height=211!

h2. Proposed Solution: 

Develop a way for ORO to detect when a SKU is present on more than one line and present the correct pricing in the DT Price field for all lines containing the same SKU

column30:
The business needs a way for users to be notified of Duplicate PO’s entered.

Currently there are multiple scenarios where PO’s can be duplicated without notice:

* 2 or more users entering the same PO into ORO at the same time
** Customer’s send PO’s more than once
** Customer’s send revised PO’s
** Customer’s send PO’s via multiple methods
** PO assignment mix up from email

h2. Acceptance Criteria

The business is requesting to have users notified that they’re potentially entering a duplicate PO with a Banner Error message

# Notify users with a live validation (before saving the form) once they’ve entered the duplicate value into the PO Number field 
# Notify users upon Save & Close of an order to account for 2 users entering a duplicate PO at the same time 

h2. Validation Properties

Orders in ORO with the same PO Number & Ship To location entered

* Level: Non-Critical (soft error)
* Error Code: duplicate_po
* Consolidated Message: “Duplicate PO”
* Detailed Message: “The PO Number is a potential duplicate for this Ship To”
* Customer Visibility: FALSE
* Bucket: XXX

15/Feb/24 2:37 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], please check this task. I’m unsure that disabling 19K products with Website=NO is the correct solution. This is 2/3 of all our products in the DB, and some seem to be used in the orders. Such a massive update will affect B2B, and most likely we will break the creation of new orders by CSRs or customer users on the portal since they will not be able to add disabled products.

Let’s re-iterate again what is the problem we are trying to solve, and evaluate all available options to resolve it.

If the end goal is to hide those products from [www.diversitech.com|http://www.diversitech.com], then:

* Those products already return 404 if the user tries to open PDP
* Once the issue with Hawksearch will be resolved, those products won’t show up in Web Level 3 pages

column30:
h2. Use Case

* If I am manually entering an order OR orders come in from Informatica and it has the same PO for the same ship to in the past XX months, then a soft error should show as a duplicate PO

Currently there are multiple scenarios where PO’s can be duplicated without notice:

* 2 or more users entering the same PO into ORO at the same time
** Customer’s send PO’s more than once
** Customer’s send revised PO’s
** Customer’s send PO’s via multiple methods
** PO assignment mix up from email

h2. Acceptance Criteria

The business is requesting to have users notified that they’re potentially entering a duplicate PO with a 

# Notify users with a live validation (before saving the form) once they’ve entered the duplicate value into the PO Number field *_(FIELD ERROR MESSAGE)_*
# Notify users upon Save & Close of an order to account for 2 users entering a duplicate PO at the same time *_(BANNER ERROR MESSAGE)_*

h2. Validation Properties

Orders in ORO with the same PO Number & Ship To location entered

* Level: Non-Critical (soft error)
* Error Code: duplicate_po
* Consolidated Message: “Duplicate PO”
* Detailed Message: “The PO is a potential duplicate for this Ship To”
* Customer Visibility: FALSE
* Bucket: Order

h2. Bucketing Criteria

15/Feb/24 3:31 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], see list of questions

Q1.

I assume that the same PO number could be used by different customers. So the validation will check the usage of the given PO Number value only in the scope of the current customer selected in the Order.

The question is, do you want to run the search of duplicates in the scope of Ship To or Bill To the customer of the Order?

If the answer is Bill To, does the search of duplicated orders with the same PO Number should also check all orders related to all Ship Tos of the Bill To?

Q2. In the requirements it is mentioned:

{quote}Level: Critical (soft error){quote}

It is not clear, whether should it be a critical (hard/red) or non-critical (soft/yellow) error.

Q3. What should be the bucket of the error?

Q4. Check the next mockup of error shown in the PO Number field once the user has entered the value in this field and the application found a duplicate:

!image-20240215-204813.png|width=688,height=617!

Does it look as expected?

*Q1.*

I assume that the same PO number could be used by different customers. So the validation will check the usage of the given PO Number value only in the scope of the current customer selected in the Order.

The question is, do you want to run the search of duplicates in the scope of Ship To or Bill To the customer of the Order?

If the answer is Bill To, does the search of duplicated orders with the same PO Number should also check all orders related to all Ship Tos of the Bill To?

* *A1 - Ship To* 

*Q2.* In the requirements it is mentioned:

{quote}Level: Critical (soft error){quote}

It is not clear, whether should it be a critical (hard/red) or non-critical (soft/yellow) error.

* *A2 - See Updated Description → Non-Critical (Soft Error)*

Q3. What should be the bucket of the error?

* *A3 - See Updated Description → Order Bucket*
** Failure Section = Header
** Failure Family = Order

*Q4.* Check the next mockup of error shown in the PO Number field once the user has entered the value in this field and the application found a duplicate:

* *A4* - Yes, for the live validation prior to save & close
* For the secondary validation after Save & Close, we agreed that the banner message is necessary
column169:
16/Feb/24 12:53 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] 

{quote}For the secondary validation after Save & Close, we agreed that the banner message is necessary{quote}

The banner/message was proposed for the 3rd option when the application checks duplicate in real-time allowing to show error flash message on the create/edit page when another user has entered the same PO.

For the selected  2nd option, I assumed that we would simply add a validation error to the order header level, like any other validation error we have.

Do we need to show an additional flash message that will duplicate the validation error shown in the order header level? If this is required, please check the next mockup and confirm it will work:

!image-20240216-180007.png|width=2486,height=858!
column170:
16/Feb/24 1:30 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] 

Yes, the mock-up appears to be what is needed. As you can see in the screenshot the header level errors are located where the user would need to scroll down in order to see it. This would also group this error in with the rest of the soft errors making it less noticeable. It is important that this validation specifically is clear to the user. 

There have been discussions on the relocation of header level errors to be visible without the need to scroll. However, no decision has been made yet and the team agreed to hold off on the UI layout changes until we are closer to the finished CPOV product.
column171: 22/Feb/24 3:05 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], do we need to ignore canceled orders when we check for duplicates?
column172: 26/Feb/24 9:08 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], we are assuming that the duplicate check should ignore the orders with canceled status. Please note, since no specific requirements were provided, the check will fail if the application finds any other order with the same “PO Number” and same “Ship To“. Even if such a duplicate order was created a couple of years ago and was already closed. If you need to have more sophisticated logic of the check that finds duplicates, please provide more detailed requirements.
column173: 27/Feb/24 9:58 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] we are good to start with the requirements we have. If we find that more is needed, we will create another ticket for more sophisticated logic. For now, this is the business ask.

column1: Design Option #2: Standalone PIM data sync integration without abstract framework
column30:
h2. Introduction

The purpose of this design document is to outline an alternative approach for implementing the new PIM integration without extracting an abstract framework. This approach aims to save initial development time by creating a standalone integration. Additionally, it explores the re-use of the existing file import functionality to automate the import of PIM data from the staging DB.

See the alternative option in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6463|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6463|smart-link] 

h2. Design Diagram

!image-20240214-202827.png|width=763,height=668!

h2. Summary

In this approach, we will implement a separate PIM integration without extracting an abstract framework. This standalone integration will utilize existing file import functionality to save development time. The new integration will automatically read data from the staging DB, convert it into import files, and schedule the import of various data types without requiring user actions.

h2. Key Components

 *PIM Data Sync Integration:*

* Independent Implementation: Develop a new integration specifically for PIM data sync without extracting abstract components.
* Utilize Existing Import Functionality: Reuse existing file import functionality to generate import files from PIM data in the staging DB.
* Automation: Implement automated processes for reading data from the staging DB, converting to import files, and scheduling imports for different data types.

h2. Pros and Cons

*Pros*

* Saves Initial Development Time: By opting for a standalone integration approach, the initial development time is reduced as there's no need to extract and implement an abstract framework. This can lead to faster delivery of the PIM integration.
* Utilizes Existing Functionality: The design leverages existing file import functionality for generating import files from PIM data, potentially reducing the effort required for creating new import processes.

*Cons*

* Reduced Reusability: The standalone nature of the PIM data sync integration reduces reusability compared to the abstract framework approach. This could result in increased maintenance costs for managing separate integrations for JDE and PIM.
* Higher Maintenance Costs: As noted in the additional notes, maintaining separate integrations for JDE and PIM may result in higher maintenance costs compared to a solution using an abstract data sync integration as a core framework.
* Limited Future Reusability: The design doesn't emphasize the reusability of the PIM integration for potential future integrations with other systems, potentially limiting its adaptability for upcoming projects.
* Dependency on Existing Functionality: Relying on existing file import functionality may introduce dependencies, and any changes to this functionality could impact the PIM integration.

h2. *High-level Breakdown and Estimates*

||*#*||*Name*||*Type*||*Estimate (hours)*||
|1|Implement core data sync integration logic|Must Have|91-181|
|2|Implement import of Attributes and Products|Must Have|38-77|
|3|Add automated tests coverage and technical documentation|Should Have|34-57|
|4|Implement import of Attribute Family and Groups|Should Have|17-32|
|5|Implement import of Product Categories|Could Have|17-32|
|6|Implement import of Product Images|Could Have|30-50|
| |Total| |197-379|

h2. *Exclusions*

* Cleanup of old Salsify/Catsy product attributes is a scope of the separate task - [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|smart-link] 
* Remove of old Salsify/Catsy manual import is not included in the scope. After the new PIM integration is implemented, the deprecated Salsify import should be removed.
* Adding UI to check sync status is not included in the scope. The application will provide CLI commands and email notifications. Adding simple UI would take additional time (8-13 hours)
* Moving additional websites (Asurity, Ductless, Pumphouse) and their products to a single organization is not included in the scope. See [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2333|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2333|smart-link].
* Automatic restore of stuck integration sync is not included in the scope. Stale integration sync will trigger a health-check alert, and manual intervention of the admin user will be required.

h2. *Additional Notes*

* Estimates include risks, estimate accuracy errors and code review.
* Delivery of the MVP on UAT/PROD may include only the development of items 1 and 2 (129-258 hours).
* Sync of Product Images requires improvements and more development time, no matter which design option will be selected. The main problem - there is no mechanism for syncing only updated images, and the full sync may take 3-7 hours, depending on the total image count and size. This can be discussed separately. Potential option:
*# Continue using the existing Salsify manual import in ORO to sync images until the next steps below are finished
*# Move images to a dedicated CDN server that can compress images on the fly using URL parameters
*# Show images in ORO using URLs from CDN with different URL parameters depending on the location (image on PLP, gallery image on PDP, main image on PDP, zoomed image on PDP)

column1: Design Option #1: Abstract Data Sync Integration as a framework for JDE and PIM data sync integration
column30:
h2. *Introduction*

The goal of this design document is to outline the approach for implementing an Abstract Data Sync Integration to handle both existing JDE data sync over FTP and a new PIM (Catsy) data sync from a staging DB. The proposed solution involves building a core logic and components that can be extended and re-used for specific integrations.

See the alternative option in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6464|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6464|smart-link] 

h2. Design Diagram

!image-20240214-202936.png|width=844,height=880!

h2. *Summary*

The proposed solution is to create an abstract data sync integration framework with core functionalities and components. This framework will serve as a foundation for both the existing JDE data sync and the new PIM data sync. The existing JDE data integration sync over FTP will be refactored to extend the abstract part, and a new PIM integration will be implemented using the abstract framework.

h2. *Key Components*

*Abstract Data Sync Integration:*

* Core Logic: Implement generic data sync logic, entities, error handling, logging, notifications, health checks, import processors, data translators, etc.
* FTP Connection Module: Include modules for handling FTP connections and data transfer.
* Database Module: Include modules for connecting to the staging DB for PIM data.
* Configurability: Make the integration configurable to handle different data sources and destinations.

*JDE file FTP Integration (Refactored):*

* Extend from the abstract data sync integration.
* Leverage the core logic running the sync flow, error handling, notifications, logging, UI, etc.
* Implements custom logic specific to FTP data sync integration.

*PIM Data Sync Integration:*

* Extend from the abstract data sync integration.
* Leverage the core logic running the sync flow, error handling, notifications, logging, UI, etc.
* Implements custom logic specific to staging DB data sync integration.

h2. Pros and Cons

*Pros*

* Reusability: The abstract data sync integration provides a reusable framework, reducing redundancy in development.
* Maintenance: Updates or improvements to the core logic can be applied universally, benefiting all integrations.
* Consistency: Ensures a consistent approach to data sync across different integrations, reducing maintenance costs, and enhancing UX.
* Unified Core Logic: By leveraging a common core logic for both JDE and PIM integrations, there is consistency in error handling, notifications, logging, and other essential features. This can simplify maintenance and reduce the likelihood of errors.
* Future-Proof Framework: The abstract data sync integration framework can be reused for future integrations with different systems, such as Customer Master sync with JDE over API or other third-party systems, making it a versatile and future-proof solution.

*Cons*

* Initial Development Cost: Building the abstract framework may incur additional upfront development costs.

h2. *High-level Breakdown and Estimates*

||*#*||*Name*||*Type*||*Estimate (hours)*||
|1|Implement Abstract Data Sync Integration and refactor existing JDE data sync Integration|Must Have|103-177|
|2|Add support multi-step sync in Abstract Data Sync Integration|Must Have|65-107|
|3|Implement new PIM Integration to sync Attributes and Products|Must Have|86-149|
|4|Add automated tests coverage and technical documentation|Should Have|34-57|
|5|Add sync of Attribute Family and Groups using PIM Integration|Should Have|21-39|
|6|Add sync of Product Categories using PIM Integration|Could Have|21-39|
|7|Add sync of Product Images using PIM Integration|Could Have|30-53|
| |Total| |360-621|

h2. *Exclusions*

* Cleanup of old Salsify/Catsy product attributes is a scope of the separate task - [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|smart-link] 
* Remove of old Salsify/Catsy manual import is not included in the scope. After the new PIM integration is implemented, the deprecated Salsify import should be removed.
* Moving additional websites (Asurity, Ductless, Pumphouse) and their products to a single organization is not included in the scope. See [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2333|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2333|smart-link].
* Automatic restore of stuck integration sync is not included in the scope. Stale integration sync will trigger a health-check alert, and manual intervention of the admin user will be required.

h2. *Additional Notes*

* Estimates include risks, estimate accuracy errors and code review.
* Delivery of the MVP on UAT/PROD may include only the development of items 1, 2, and 3 (254-433 hours).
* Sync of Product Images requires improvements and more development time, no matter which design option will be selected. The main problem - there is no mechanism for syncing only updated images, and the full sync may take 3-7 hours, depending on the total image count and size. This can be discussed separately. Potential option:
*# Continue using the existing Salsify manual import in ORO to sync images until the next steps below are finished
*# Move images to a dedicated CDN server that can compress images on the fly using URL parameters
*# Show images in ORO using URLs from CDN with different URL parameters depending on the location (image on PLP, gallery image on PDP, main image on PDP, zoomed image on PDP)
* The abstract data sync integration framework can be re-used for future cases, for example:
** A new version of Customer Master syncs with JDE over API
** Other data sync integrations with third-party systems using FTP, API, staging DB, etc.

column1: Catsy API PowerBI for Validation (Dev Snowflake)
Buford 3.0 - Create WINSPC connection in INFORMATICA-PROD
column30:
Steps

# there is file WinSCP-6.1.2-Automation.zip on Informatica server within Downloads forlder (using Informatica user to log in)

It needs to be installed (unziped) to C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\ (so you will have subfolder WinSCP-6.1.2-Automation in there)

 

# Create JDA subfolder within Donwloads folder (c:\Users\informatica\Downloads\JDA)

 

# Copy two bat scripts from C:\Scripts to same folder on PROD. Those are downloadJDAfilesViaSFTP.bat & getListOfJDASFTPfiles.bat

 

# Now, we will need to do modification of first bat script (downloadJDAfilesViaSFTP.bat).

We will need to change line (all double quotes and ^ at the end are mandatory:

"open sftp://divwmseusprdv2:%%28Exz%%21d%%2BPXnF%%24%%24aKS@PRODB2BGWNA1.jdadelivers.com/ -hostkey=""ssh-rsa 2048 ZSdpS5B168DLimz54gEDA5jMqnckUfqX18P3OughciE""" ^

 

with following process:

4a. go to folder C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\WinSCP-6.1.2-Automation

4b. Doubleclick on WinSCP.exe

4c. Log to BY server using following info

* hostname: [PRODB2BGWNA1.jdadelivers.com|http://PRODB2BGWNA1.jdadelivers.com]
* username: divwmseusprdv2
* pwd: (Exz!d+PXnF$$aKS

!image-20240213-181320.png|width=631,height=419!

4d. When you are logged select option from menu Tabs->Generate Session URL/Code (see screenshot)

!image-20240213-181345.png|width=1031,height=658!

4e. From new popup select tab Script and under Format dropdown select *Batch file* (screenshot) and copy (full) line which starts with "open sftp://divwmseusprdv2 . This will copy newly encripted password on that Informatica-PROD server + it will bring correct hostkey

 

!image-20240213-181419.png|width=972,height=610!



this will allow us to do SFTP and have encripted pwd and hostkey in our script downloadJDAfilesViaSFTP.bat which we use to download files from JDA/BY
column166: 13/Feb/24 2:21 PM;614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4;Mark and I installed WINSCP in Informatica Stage and Prod, we are in standby until Tomi provides JDA Production information later today.

column30: Currently our Ecomm partners do not get live inventory availability feeds for ourhost system.  Goal would be an API connection from JDE back to our partners sites so they can order only available inventory.  We will need to investigate what the integrations back will look like.

column1: Inventory Transfer Solution and Inventory Visibility in JDE
column30:
currently to transact inventory we would have to follow the ST process.  This requires a lot of effort and LT that is likely not needed.  Desire would be to have a solution to almost instantly transact inventory from JDA (using JDA scan gun) into this new warehouse.  Proposed idea is an inventory transaction similar to an IA that sends a record to JDE from JDA and then allows for JDE to have the inventory in the new warehouse

P4 Signal   ----  JDA IT --- JDE receipt  --- JDE putaway --- JDE status available
order scan guns that match the new  Buford scan guns
open item would be can Pierbridge support customer packing/shipping labels better than JDE

Part of the MVP is to have the ability to ship inside of 24 hours from OE.  Current process with JDE transportation planning does not allow for this.  We have a alt path from the quick ship process but need to evaluate this solution and adjust order fulfillment logic in JDE to ensure the customers we have defined for this are pointed to this branch.  Will likely need to consider the Amazon 3PL solution as well when looking at OFL.
Once branch is configured we will need to evaluate signals and ordering frequency.  All skus are to be replenned from

We intend to create a new branch that will serve as the landing location for all customers in this drop-ship program.  We will need solutions around 24-hr ship times/picking/packing/custom labels and packing lists/cycle counts/receiving/etc.  We dont immediately intend to have work orders or part transformations occur.  We will want to assign primary locations for products based on picking velocity and physical storage spaces.  Please reach out to Geoff Peer for that information when relevant.

Part of the drop ship requirements include custom packing lists that mimic the customers logos and other relevant information.  Likely we will need to develop custom templates for each customer.  We need those to automatically generate at “Pack” step of process based on the customer account that ordered the product.



Steve Francis is collecting the document requirements

Part of the drop ship requirements include custom shipping labels that mimic the customers logos and other relevant information.  Likely we will need to develop custom templates for each customer.  We need those to automatically generate at “Pack” step of process based on the customer account that ordered the product.



Steve Francis is collecting the document requirements

Technology tasks to support “a warehouse in a warehouse”

Overview:

* JDE warehouse to be setup within Buford (JDA/BY)
* Requires custom packing slips / documentation
* Primarily parcel

column1: Customer Fails to Sync to JDE

Cooling Solutions Group LLC
[https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/86952|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/86952]
column166:
12/Feb/24 6:24 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], JDE API fails with a 500 response during an attempt to sync this customer. Error from the response:

{quote}OroAddUpdCustomer3:\n(1) Code-Control: 018A-120, Title: Error: not found in User Defined Code,  Description: CORE not found in User Defined Code 01 TI \n(2) Code-Control: 018A-120, Title: Error: CORE not found in User Defined Code 01 TI,  Description: Tier CORE was not found in User Defined Code for system 01 , type TI  . \n{quote}

The problem must be related to Customer field “JDE Customer Type“ (dt_hist_global_customer_type). Please check if value “CORE“ is a valid JDE value. If not, it should be replaced using the next SQL:

{noformat}UPDATE oro_customer SET dt_hist_global_customer_type = %NEW_CORRECT_VALUE% WHERE dt_hist_global_customer_type = 'CORE';{noformat}

242 Customers in ORO are using the same “CORE“ value, most of them failed sync with JDE:

{noformat}orodb=> select count(*) customers_count,
orodb->        dt_hist_global_customer_type,
orodb->        last_jde_sync_status
orodb-> from oro_customer
orodb-> where dt_hist_global_customer_type = 'CORE'
orodb-> group by dt_hist_global_customer_type, last_jde_sync_status;
 customers_count | dt_hist_global_customer_type | last_jde_sync_status 
-----------------+------------------------------+----------------------
              28 | CORE                         | success
             214 | CORE                         | failed
(2 rows){noformat}

The 28 record didn't fail, so potentially JDE didn’t fail before when “Customer Type“ was passed as “CORE” in the API. Those customers are:

There is a field in the product family entity to make it inactive and hidden on the UI, but according to the current state of the DB, all product families are active:

{noformat}orodb=> select * from dt_product_family;
 id | jde_id |             name              | active |     created_at      |     updated_at      | serialized_data 
----+--------+-------------------------------+--------+---------------------+---------------------+-----------------
  1 | CHEMX  | Chemicals                     | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  2 | COMPX  | Components & Accessories      | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  3 | CONDX  | Condensate Management         | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  4 | EQMTX  | Equipment Mounting            | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  5 | HVACX  | HVAC/R Electrical             | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  6 | IAQXX  | Indoor Air Quality            | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  7 | MONTX  | Mounts                        | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  8 | OTHRX  | Other                         | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
  9 | PADSX  | Pads                          | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
 10 | TOOLX  | Tools                         | t      | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 2022-10-12 23:00:45 | 
 13 | CNTRL  | Connected Products & Controls | t      | 2023-07-18 09:00:12 | 2023-07-18 09:00:12 | 
 11 |        | .                             | t      | 2022-10-14 09:00:15 | 2022-10-14 09:00:15 | 
(12 rows){noformat}

Most of these entities were created and updated on {{2022-10-12}} when [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2602|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2602|smart-link] was deployed to PROD.

I assume that all these records were always active during all this time.

The [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2602|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2602|smart-link] has the next assumption:

{quote}To hide old ProductFamilies, the administrator will need to run SQL to update the boolean field “active“ of the entity.{quote}

It looks as if no one made any changes via SQL to hide those product families.

The SQL to hide them is next:

{noformat}UPDATE dt_product_family SET active = false WHERE jde_id IN ('CHEMX', 'MONTX', 'OTHRX', 'PADSX', '');{noformat}

Please let me know if you want me to apply this change in the DB.

column173:
13/Feb/24 7:50 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], [~accountid:5f31179632360700383d0325] 

1. All the product families in the DB in PROD and UAT are still active. Check screenshots from DB both on PROD and UAT:

!image-20240214-002134.png|width=1055,height=392!

!image-20240214-002157.png|width=1055,height=379!

The [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2602|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-2602|smart-link] has the next assumption:

{quote}To hide old ProductFamilies, the administrator will need to run SQL to update the boolean field “active“ of the entity.{quote}

It looks as if no one made any changes via SQL to hide those product families.

The SQL to hide them is next:

{noformat}UPDATE dt_product_family SET active = false WHERE jde_id IN ('CHEMX', 'MONTX', 'OTHRX', 'PADSX', '');{noformat}

Please let me know if you want me to apply this change in the DB.

----

2. If Product Family has flag {{active=false}} in ORO, it will be hidden in the UI, except the next case:

* The Account Plan already has Account Plan Goal related to inactive family and non-zero field “Account Goal ($)“

Here is the screenshot provided earlier:

!image-20240214-002652.png|width=1058,height=1164!

The UI shows Account Plan Goals with inactive Product Families because these goals have non-zero  “Account Goal ($)“ (for example, the goal for “Mounts” has “Account Goal ($)” = $708,319.00)

To completely hide those inactive Account Plan Goals from the page of Account Plan, please open edit page of the Account Plan, and set zero in “Account Goal ($)” field, or remove the respective Account Plan Goal on the form.

The display of the inactive but non-empty Account Plan Goals on the page of Account Plan is intentional, because the Account Plan Goal affects the calculation of Account Plan fields, even if “Account Plan Goal“ has an inactive Product Family.

----

3. Regarding the values shown on the next screenshot on the PROD:

!image-20240214-003401.png|width=1350,height=798!

The UI shows the highlighted values based on the information from DB:

{noformat}orodb=> select pf.jde_id, pf.name, apg.account_goal from dt_go_account_plan_goal apg left join dt_product_family pf on apg.product_family_id = pf.id where apg.account_plan_id = 635 order by pf.name;
 jde_id |             name              | account_goal 
--------+-------------------------------+--------------
        | .                             | 1461640.0000
 CHEMX  | Chemicals                     |       0.0000
 COMPX  | Components & Accessories      | 1270105.0000
 CONDX  | Condensate Management         |  575811.0000
 CNTRL  | Connected Products & Controls | 3048930.0000
 EQMTX  | Equipment Mounting            |  244623.0000
 HVACX  | HVAC/R Electrical             |       0.0000
 IAQXX  | Indoor Air Quality            |       0.0000
 MONTX  | Mounts                        |       0.0000
 OTHRX  | Other                         |  236145.0000
 PADSX  | Pads                          |       0.0000
 TOOLX  | Tools                         |       0.0000
(12 rows){noformat}

The field  “Account Goal ($)“ (“account_goal“) of Account Plan Goal can be imported or edited from the UI.

[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], what is the issue here? Do you mean that the user imported the file attached to this task, and the import did not update the values of the respective Account Plan Goals? If this is the case, I plan to get the DB dump from UAT and run the import of the attached file to try to reproduce this issue. As of right now, I assume that this file was either not imported on PROD, or these values that you highlighted were edited from the UI and now they are different from what you have in the import file.

14/Feb/24 12:58 AM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5f31179632360700383d0325], [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], the provided file is XLSX. Import of Account Plans supports only CSV file:

!image-20240214-054311.png|width=727,height=422!

I assume that to import Account Plans on PROD you converted the sheet with name “Template“ from the XLSX file to CSV and imported it.

Here is the file that I converted from the XSLX file to CSV:

[^Account Plan Upload.csv]

Please note, that this file contains column “ID“ which is empty. This will make the import always create a new record, instead of updating the existing record.

I’ve imported this file on my local instance and was able to see Account Plans created as expected:

!image-20240214-054759.png|width=2436,height=1162!

The second import of the same file didn’t update the existing records, because the column “ID“ is empty. Now, to update such an Account Plan as “AC PRO“, the import file should contain not null column “ID“ that matches the ID of the respected record in the app.

So, to update the account plan for “AC PRO” I created the next CSV file:

[^Account Plan Upload_UPDATE_AC_PRO.csv]

Notice, this file contains ID = 635:

!image-20240214-055515.png|width=1806,height=517!

After running the import of this file locally, I see that the account plan goals were updated as expected in the file:

!Screenshot from 2024-02-13 21-56-13-20240214-055635.png|width=1816,height=1331!

[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], if you still see the issue, please share the original CSV file that was used to update Account Plans in PROD. Please ensure that this CSV file contains the “ID“ column, corresponding to the account plans that should have been updated.

column1: Business Development Funds (Co-Ops) not updating with Group change
column30:
There were a few customers that I had to update the Group to accurately reflect co-op %. Funds Allocated is not updating. Attached is an example

!image-20240212-183910.png|width=1179,height=620!



!image-20240212-183846.png|width=100%!
column166: 12/Feb/24 1:53 PM;5f31179632360700383d0325;Moved BDF to Customer and the allocation updated to 1%, but saving as a Group did not update
column167:
27/Feb/24 3:52 PM;712020:9527b93d-c273-4ab6-8445-c2109b3f4caa;!image-20240227-205153.png|width=1217,height=655!

Another example- 92162 Air Engineers
column168:
27/Feb/24 8:14 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:712020:9527b93d-c273-4ab6-8445-c2109b3f4caa],

According to the current implementation, the formula of calculation BDF field “Funds Allocated“ is next:

* "BDF"."Funds Allocated" = "BDF"."Prior Year Net Purchases" * "BDF"."Customer Matching BDF Type"."Co-Op Percentage"
** where “Customer Matching BDF Type“ could be the “BDF“.”Customer” itself, or it could be “Sub“/”Rollup”/”Group” related to the “BDF“.”Customer” depending on the “BDF“.”Calculated Fund Type”.

The re-calculation of “BDF“ fields is triggered in the next cases:

* BDF is created 
* BDF has one of the next fields updated: “Prior Year Net Purchases“, “Fund Year“, “Customer“, “Calculated Fund Type“
* Co-Op Request created
* Co-Op Request  has one of the next fields updated: “Amount Requested“, “Fund Year“, “Customer“, “Amount Approved“, “Status“
* Customer has field “Co-Op Percentage“ updated

The re-calculation is not instant and scheduled in the message queue. Depending on how busy is the queue, the re-calculation finished with some delay.

----

*1. Checking the case with* [*PC-2024-100008975*|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/business-development-fund/view/8975]

[PC-2024-100008975|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/business-development-fund/view/8975] has the following properties:

* Prior Year Net Purchases = $204,117.72
* Calculated Fund Type = “Group”
* Customer = [92162|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/83752]
* Customer Matching BDF Type =  Customer related to 20887 with Entity Type “Group” =  [A-D|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/32710]
** !image-20240228-004234.png|width=888,height=678!
* Funds Allocated = $2,759.46

Customer [A-D|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/32710] with Entity Type “Group“ has next properties:

* Co-Op Percentage = 1%

!image-20240228-004407.png|width=888,height=678!

So, to calculate  “Funds Allocated” = $2,759.46 the next formula is applied:

* “Funds Allocated“ = $275,945.73 * 1% = $2,759.46





----

*2. Checking the case with*  [*PC-2024-100008975*|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/business-development-fund/view/8975]

[PC-2024-100008975|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/business-development-fund/view/8975] has the following properties:

* Prior Year Net Purchases = $204,117.72
* Calculated Fund Type = “Group”
* Customer = [92162|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/83752]
* Customer Matching BDF Type =  Customer related to [92162|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/83752] with Entity Type “Group” =  [A-D|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/32710]
* Funds Allocated = $0.00

The “Funds Allocated“  is calculated incorrectly, most likely because of the next reason:

* BDF calculation happened around Feb 9th when it was created
!image-20240228-005539.png|width=2487,height=1288!
* At that moment, “Group“ of [92162|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/83752] was [IND|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/33963] which has “Co-Op Percentage“ = 0%
!image-20240228-005808.png|width=2487,height=1288!
* Later, on Feb 12th Customer [92162|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/83752] was updated with another Parent Customer, which made its Group to be equal to [A-D|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/32710]
!image-20240228-005921.png|width=2487,height=1288!


----

*Hot-fix solution*

Execute re-calculation of all BDFs in 2024.

!image-20240228-011400.png|width=2487,height=1288!

[PC-2024-100008975|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/business-development-fund/view/8975] is now showing correct value in field “Funds Allocated“.

*Long-term solution*

Ticket [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6600|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6600|smart-link]  is created for the use case of updating BDF fields when Customer has field “Parent” updated. [~accountid:5f31179632360700383d0325], please review and set “priority” and “sprint” for that new ticket.

column1: ORO Product Update:  Pull Families and Group Table

** Family label (e.g. “Tube Cutters”)
** group label (e.g. “Pricing & Accounting“)
** attribute label (e.g. “Warranty by RMA Only“)
* Example of rows:
** Tube Cutters, Pricing & Accounting, Warranty by RMA Only
** Tube Cutters, Pricing & Accounting, Discounts Allowed
** Tube Cutters, Pricing & Accounting, Backorders Allowed (Y/N)

** name (name of the column in products staging table, e.g. “Warranty_by_RMA_Only“)
** label (label for the UI, e.g. “Warranty by RMA Only“)

column1: Daily Reconciliation of JDE-JDA Shipment Report - 2/09/24
CPOV - Sku not Extended to Branch
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Add new order validation error when product is not extended in the select Branch
** This condition means that the product has no inventory data and no Stocking Type in the selected Branch
** For example, check next screenshot
!image-20240212-175237.png|width=1079,height=294!
** The command on the screenshot shows product “CP-22LPT“ availability in Branches. This product is extended only to Branches 10400, 11200, 11400, 11500, and 12200
** At the same time, the user now can select any branch on the order create/edit page, even if the product is not extended in this branch, and the application does not show any related errors:
!image-20240212-175815.png|width=1844,height=894!
* Details of the new validation error that should be added when product is not extended in the selected Branch:
** Level: Critical (hard error)
** Error Code: line_item_not_extended_branch
** Consolidated Message: “Not Extended at Branch”
** Detailed Message: “The requested product has not been extended at the selected Branch”

column1: P3 Orders not showing in Decisions Dashboard
column166:
08/Feb/24 9:34 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Added a filter on the query to pull orders that would have a Reference Qualifier of TN after finding the wrong values populating the Pro# field. However the Pro #'s and reference qualifier fields are only populated upon shipments being confirmed, so new orders still in early stages aren’t pulling in. 

Need to update the Query and flow to pull in the data and fitler in the flow instead of the query. 

----

Added field ReferenceQualifier to Database Query structure Snowflake_Query_P3SelectFilteredOrders

Updated Query P3SelectOrders, added select field 

{noformat}SRN.XIREFQ AS "ReferenceQualifier"{noformat}

Removed Filter condition where SRN.XIREFQ = ‘TN’

Full new query

{noformat}SELECT
    SODF.SDSHAN AS "Ship To",
    ABM.ABALPH AS "Customer",
    ABD.ALCTY1 AS "City",
    ABD.ALADDS AS "State",
    SODF.SDMOT AS "Mode of Transport",
    SODF.SDSHPN AS "Shipment Number",
    SODF.SDDOCO AS "Order Number",
    SODF.SDLNID AS "Line Number",
    SODF.SDLITM AS "SKU",
    SODF.SDPQOR AS "Qty",
    SODF.SDDCTO AS "Order Type",
    SODF.SDAN8 AS "Bill To",
    SODF.SDTRDJ AS "Transaction Date",
    SODF.SDMCU AS "Branch",
    SODF.SDPPDJ AS "Promised Ship Date",
    SODF.SDOPDJ AS "OriginalPromShipDate",
    SODF.SDCARS AS "Carrier",
    SODF.SDZON AS "Zone Number",
    SRN.XIREFN AS "Tracking Number",
    SRN.XIREFQ AS "ReferenceQualifier",
    IM.IMSRP5 AS "Product Category",
    IM.IMSTKT AS "Stocking Type"
FROM FLURRY_PROD.RAW_PRICING.F4211 SODF
LEFT OUTER JOIN FLURRY_PROD.RAW_PRICING.F0101 ABM on TRIM(ABM.ABAN8) = TRIM(SODF.SDSHAN)
LEFT OUTER JOIN FLURRY_PROD.RAW_PRICING.F0116 ABD on TRIM(ABD.ALAN8) = TRIM(ABM.ABAN8) AND ABD.ALEFTB = ABM.ABEFTB
LEFT OUTER JOIN FLURRY_PROD.RAW_PRICING.F4217 SRN on TRIM(SRN.XISHPN) = TRIM(SODF.SDSHPN)
LEFT OUTER JOIN FLURRY_PROD.RAW_PRICING.F4101 IM on TRIM(IM.IMLITM) = TRIM(SODF.SDLITM)
WHERE IM.IMSRP5 IS NOT NULL AND SODF.SDDCTO NOT IN ('CO', 'CA', 'CR', 'SQ') AND IM.IMSRP5 IN ('ECO', 'ELT') AND IM.IMSTKT != 'O' AND SODF.SDZON = 'PPP';{noformat}

column1: Design mechanism that prevents parallel work of DT and ORO side of the integration that syncs the products data
column30:
h2. Overview

On the high level, there is the next flow of syncing Catsy products to ORO using staging tables:

# Informatica or some other DiversiTech system writes Catsy data to staging tables in ORO DB
## This operation can include truncating the staging tables and altering columns in the product's staging tables.
# ORO reads the data from the staging tables, and converts/syncs this data to the native format of products in ORO.

The flow is supposed to start one time per day.

There should be a mechanism to prevent simultaneous work ORO and DT sides of the integration, there are 2 main options to choose from.

h2. Option 1. Use an additional table to acquire/release locks

Add additional table {{dt_catsy_integration_lock}} with next structure:

* id  varchar(32), primary key
Name of the lock, for now, we can support only one possible value, for example, {{global}}
* system_name varchar(32)
Name of the system that acquired the lock, for example, {{oro}}, {{dt}}, etc.
* lock_acquired_at datetime
When the lock was acquired

*Here's how the approach would work:*

# Acquiring a Lock:
## Before starting its operations, the system (ORO or DT) inserts a row into the {{dt_catsy_integration_lock}} table:
### id = global
### system_name = dt  or oro
### lock_acquired_at = current timestamp
## If the insertion is successful, the system proceeds with its operations
### In the case of DT, the system syncs staging tables
### In the case of ORO, the system is syncing the staging tables into ORO native product tables
## If the insertion fails (lock with id = global already exists), it means that another system is already running, and the current system should wait until the lock is released.
# Releasing a Lock:
## Once the system (DT or ORO) completes its operations, it removes the record of the acquired lock from {{dt_catsy_integration_lock}}, indicating that the lock is released.

*Pros/Cons*

* Pros:
** Simplicity: This approach is straightforward to implement. It involves basic database operations for acquiring and releasing locks.
** Explicit Locking: The use of a dedicated lock table provides a clear and explicit way to manage the synchronization process between ORO and DT systems.
* Cons:
** No Concurrent Sync: DT and ORO systems cannot work in parallel and should wait for each other. This may be not the optimal behavior in some cases.
** Manual Recovery: If a system fails to release the lock due to an unexpected error, manual intervention may be required to reset the lock, leading to potential downtimes.

h2. Option 2. Use versioning

Add additional table {{dt_catsy_data_version}} with next structure:

* id  integer, primary key
Number of the Catsy data version
* is_synced_from_catsy boolean
** If TRUE, this means that all staging tables were prepared by DT, and the DT side is not expected to make any changes
** If FALSE, this means that the staging tables were not prepared yet by DT, and ORO should not start syncing this version
* is_synced_to_oro boolean
** If TRUE, this means that all staging tables in this version were synced to ORO
** If FALSE, this means that the staging tables in this version were not synced to ORO yet
* created_at datetime
** Timestamp when the data version was created

*Here's how the approach would work:*

# DT pushes new version data to staging tables in ORO DB:
## DT system inserts a new record in table {{dt_catsy_data_version}}
### id = auto-incremented integer value
### is_synced_from_catsy = false
### is_synced_to_oro = false
### created_at = current timestamp
## DT system creates staging tables
### Each staging table name has a version ID added to the name
### For example, if version id = 647, the table names will be like this:
#### dt_catsy_product_attributes_647
#### dt_catsy_product_families_647
#### dt_catsy_products_647
## After the DT system finishes with data sync in the staging tables, it updates the respective record in table {{dt_catsy_data_version}}
### is_synced_from_catsy = true
# ORO syncs new version data into native ORO product tables:
## ORO finds the most recent {{dt_catsy_data_version}} where the next criteria matched:
### is_synced_from_catsy = true
### is_synced_to_oro = false
## ORO syncs all the data from the respective staging tables. For example, if the version ID was 647, the data will be synced from the next tables:
### dt_catsy_product_attributes_647
### dt_catsy_product_families_647
### dt_catsy_products_647
## Once the sync is finished, ORO updates the respective {{dt_catsy_data_version}} with the next data:
### is_synced_to_oro = true
# DT removes old staging tables for versions that were synced more than 3 days ago
## Some CRON jobs on the DT side are running daily and find all records in {{dt_catsy_data_version}} where:
### is_synced_from_catsy = true
### is_synced_to_oro = true
### created_at < current timestamp - 3 days
## For all the found records, the DT system drops the respective staging tables

*Pros/Cons:*

* Pros: 
** Fine-Grained Control: Versioning allows for fine-grained control over the synchronization process, enabling precise tracking of Catsy data versions.
** Concurrent Sync: Both systems can run in parallel without interfering with each other
* Cons:
** Complexity: This option introduces more complexity, involving version tracking, additional tables, and rules for data synchronization, which may increase the chances of errors.
** Increased Storage: Maintaining historical data versions and associated staging tables may lead to increased storage requirements over time.

column167:
07/Feb/24 4:26 PM;712020:706767cf-9324-4f27-ae9c-1d513e0e7742;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] The goal of the locking mechanism is to prevent simultaneous access and updates to the table by both Informatica and ORO systems. While we plan to schedule synchronization on our side, there may be occasions where we need to initiate the sync manually, especially if jobs fail. Therefore, locking the table should not be overly complex or detailed. My suggestion is to ensure that we can easily release locks.

Also, note that the objective is to refresh the data daily without syncing multiple times a day. Should the need arise, we can consider working on enhancements at that time.



Option 1. Use an additional table to acquire/release locks

column30: Request: Add a count for how many orders are in the Informatica folder for inbound orders before Flow runs. At the end of the flow, a count of how many orders were successfully processed, and a count of how many errors.
column166:
06/Feb/24 5:20 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Update to python script that runs as a pre-processing command when pulling orders. 

Script: cpov_build_edi_file_list.py

Added the following

*  Import os.path
* Path Parameter CNTDIR for count directory where the number will be output
* file_count variable with starting value 0
* Script to add 1 to file_count for each file (element) in the source directory (SRCDIR)
* Write to EDI_File_Count.txt file the result

{noformat}#Count EDI Files in Informatica Directory
file_count=0
for element in os.listdir(SRCDIR):
    element_path=os.path.join(SRCDIR, element)
    if os.path.isfile(element_path):
        file_count+=1

with open(CNTDIR, 'w', encoding='utf_8') as output_file:
    output_file.write("Total count of Files: " + str(file_count))
    output_file.close(){noformat}

Will be able to use this in conjunction with the Aggregate step in Informatica to tables to store the total count of orders pulled for that job, as well as the PO numbers. Will need a new flow/mapplet to write the PO numbers and count.

# Click "Revalidate"
## Since there are 141 items in the order, the prices will be loaded in the background, there is a message about it in the UI, and field "DT Price Load Status" will show the progress of price loading. Usually with such large set of prices in the request, JDE API will work very slowly, potentially more than 2 minutes for the response
# Open logs [https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;cursorTimestamp=2024-02-01T19:23:44Z;duration=PT1H?project=diversitech-com-prod|https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;cursorTimestamp=2024-02-01T19:23:44Z;duration=PT1H?project=diversitech-com-prod]

{noformat}severity>=ERROR logName:app "dt_jde_api_rest"{noformat}
# Here is the link to the logs [https://cloudlogging.app.goo.gl/QwGdmekJnUazZ91Y7|https://cloudlogging.app.goo.gl/QwGdmekJnUazZ91Y7]
## See screenshot: 
!image-20240201-192958.png|width=1836,height=888!

{noformat}PriceInteractor: Cannot get products prices. Reason: API client request failed. Reason: Failed to send HTTP request.
