{"criteria":{"DT\\Bundle\\JdeApiIntegrationBundle\\BoundedContext\\Price\\DTO\\ProductsPricesCriteria":{"billToCustomer":{"id":6983,"dt_jde_id":"23717","dt_billing_type":"X"},"shipToCustomer":{"id":12670,"dt_jde_id":"24295","dt_billing_type":"S"},"productPriceCriteria":["1506-EA-1-USD","1457-EA-1-USD","4762-EA-1-USD","4764-EA-1-USD","4767-EA-1-USD","49-EA-1-USD","485-EA-1-USD","486-EA-1-USD","789-EA-1-USD","1365-EA-1-USD","1366-EA-1-USD","1370-EA-1-USD","1726-PK-1-USD","1937-PK-1-USD","1938-PK-1-USD","1941-PK-1-USD","1943-PK-1-USD","1945-PK-1-USD","2163-PK-1-USD","2167-PK-1-USD","2173-PK-1-USD","2174-PK-1-USD","2290-PK-1-USD","2291-EA-1-USD","2648-EA-1-USD","2690-EA-1-USD","1459-EA-1-USD","1461-EA-1-USD","1462-EA-1-USD","3403-PK-1-USD","3406-PK-1-USD","3407-PK-1-USD","3417-EA-1-USD","3574-EA-1-USD","3614-PK-1-USD","3870-PK-1-USD","3882-EA-1-USD","3957-PK-1-USD","3966-PK-1-USD","3968-PK-1-USD","3970-PK-1-USD","3971-PK-1-USD","4309-PK-1-USD","4467-PK-1-USD","4495-EA-1-USD","4502-PK-1-USD","4508-PK-1-USD","4660-EA-1-USD","4753-EA-1-USD","5129-PK-1-USD","2500-EA-1-USD","5497-EA-1-USD","5610-EA-1-USD","6089-EA-1-USD","6127-PK-1-USD","6128-PK-1-USD","6164-EA-1-USD","6168-EA-1-USD","6175-EA-1-USD","6219-PK-1-USD","6733-PK-1-USD","6739-PK-1-USD","2791-EA-1-USD","7102-PK-1-USD","7548-EA-1-USD","7549-EA-1-USD","7686-PK-1-USD","7949-PK-1-USD","7950-EA-1-USD","8015-EA-1-USD","8019-EA-1-USD","8042-PK-1-USD","8071-PK-1-USD","8075-EA-1-USD","2806-EA-1-USD","2250-EA-1-USD","356-PK-1-USD","5836-EA-1-USD","5837-EA-1-USD","26634-EA-1-USD","26702-EA-1-USD","26926-EA-1-USD","27095-EA-1-USD","27161-EA-1-USD","27182-EA-1-USD","27197-EA-1-USD","27222-EA-1-USD","27279-EA-1-USD","27284-EA-1-USD","27296-EA-1-USD","35274-EA-1-USD","27455-EA-1-USD","24614-EA-1-USD","24713-EA-1-USD","31324-EA-1-USD","31325-EA-1-USD","31326-EA-1-USD","31328-EA-1-USD","31329-EA-1-USD","31331-EA-1-USD","28380-EA-1-USD","28381-EA-1-USD","26117-EA-1-USD","29805-EA-1-USD","29806-EA-1-USD","29808-EA-1-USD","29816-EA-1-USD","29824-EA-1-USD","23716-EA-1-USD","23674-EA-1-USD","23689-EA-1-USD","23692-EA-1-USD","23695-EA-1-USD","23698-EA-1-USD","23700-EA-1-USD","23703-EA-1-USD","23705-EA-1-USD","23727-EA-1-USD","23731-EA-1-USD","23763-EA-1-USD","23769-EA-1-USD","23773-EA-1-USD","23435-EA-1-USD","23437-EA-1-USD","23448-EA-1-USD","23449-EA-1-USD","26151-EA-1-USD","26152-EA-1-USD","35443-EA-1-USD","30232-EA-1-USD","30239-EA-1-USD","30240-EA-1-USD","30242-EA-1-USD","30244-EA-1-USD","30245-EA-1-USD","30247-EA-1-USD","30256-EA-1-USD","30265-EA-1-USD"],"options":{"context_entity":{"className":"Oro\\Bundle\\OrderBundle\\Entity\\Order","id":949105}}}},"requestUri":null,"exception":"[object] (DT\\Component\\JdeApiClient\\Exception\\ApiClientRequestException(code: 0): API client request failed. Reason: Failed to send HTTP request. Reason: cURL error 28: Operation timed out after 120001 milliseconds with 0 bytes received (see https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html) for http://jdeaisp01.diversitech.com:9090/jderest/v3/orchestrator/OroGetBatchPrice at /opt/ocom/app/deploy/20240104231149/src/DT/Component/JdeApiClient/Client.php:56)\n[previous exception] [object] (Oro\\Component\\HttpRest\\Exception\\HttpRequestException(code: 0): Failed to send HTTP request. Reason: cURL error 28: Operation timed out after 120001 milliseconds with 0 bytes received (see https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html) for http://jdeaisp01.diversitech.com:9090/jderest/v3/orchestrator/OroGetBatchPrice at /opt/ocom/app/deploy/20240104231149/src/Oro/Component/HttpRest/Guzzle/GuzzleHttpClient.php:150)\n[previous exception] [object] (GuzzleHttp\\Exception\\ConnectException(code: 0): cURL error 28: Operation timed out after 120001 milliseconds with 0 bytes received (see https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html) for http://jdeaisp01.diversitech.com:9090/jderest/v3/orchestrator/OroGetBatchPrice at /opt/ocom/app/deploy/20240104231149/vendor/guzzlehttp/guzzle/src/Handler/CurlFactory.php:210)"} []{noformat}

Summary of the error:

{quote}Cannot get products prices. Reason: API client request failed. Reason: Failed to send HTTP request. Reason: cURL error 28: Operation timed out after 120001 milliseconds with 0 bytes received (see [https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html|https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html]) for [http://jdeaisp01.diversitech.com:9090/jderest/v3/orchestrator/OroGetBatchPrice|http://jdeaisp01.diversitech.com:9090/jderest/v3/orchestrator/OroGetBatchPrice]{quote}

*Root cause:*

The application waited for 2 minutes to get a response from JDE with prices. After 2 minutes, the application stopped waiting and failed with error. The timeout of 2 minutes is configured in the System Configuration ([https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/config/system/platform/dt_jde_api_integration|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/config/system/platform/dt_jde_api_integration]): 

!image-20240201-193227.png|width=1836,height=888!

Recently, [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] reported [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6229|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6229|smart-link] and the hot-fix solution was to set 2 minute timeout. This hot-fix solution now breaks the use case of price loading for large orders.

*Suggested hot-fix solution:*

# Remove timeout for the price API in System Configuration (set it to 0, or to a higher value than 2 minutes)

*Suggested long-term solution:*

# Implement 2 types of timeouts for the JDE API calls from ORO:
## Timeout during web-requests
### Used when the user interacts with the application in the browser. For example, if an order has 2 items, the price can be loaded immediately without background processing. Short timeout of 30 seconds can be applied (users won’t wait for too long for the page to load)
## Timeout during background jobs
### Used when an API call for pricing is made in the background job. For example, an order has 100 items, and to load the prices, the application schedules a background job in the message queue. This job runs an API call with a timeout of 10 minutes (could still be not enough for JDE to respond)

column30:
EP Sales customer account, business unit, and rep code were setup and tied together. Then a bulk upload to update the customer accounts to assign them to that rep code. The EP SALES AGENCY was reassigned the accounts from JJ Morgan. Their Commission Code/Rep Schedule is 112, JDE ID is 104961, and Supplier # is 105009.

ISSUE: When a rep from EP SALES looks to view customer entity, they cannot see/view any assigned to EP SALES
column166:
07/Feb/24 4:23 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], [~accountid:5f31179632360700383d0325],

*Short description of the problem*

The “EP SALES” Sales Agency / Business Unit has Rep Code = 112:

!image-20240207-211433.png|width=666,height=527!

The Rep Code 112 has no Commission Schedules assigned to it.

*Additional Details*

The logic of Sales Agencies users permissions is documented on this page (you should have it in your wiki as well, but I don’t know the link): [https://oro-inc.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DIV/pages/2248933444/Sales+Agencies+Permissions|https://oro-inc.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DIV/pages/2248933444/Sales+Agencies+Permissions|smart-link] 

Particularly, check this screenshot of the diagram that visualizes the permissions granting logic:

!image-20240207-211028.png|width=1542,height=848!

Brief logic description: 

* The Sales Agency User (External Sales Rep) has permission to Customers data if the Customer has a Commission Schedule that is assigned to the Rep Code of their Sales Agency

There was a report in PROD previously that shows the data of  Rep Codes and related Commission Schedules, but I cannot find it. I created a new report - [https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/report/view/464|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/report/view/464]. Try to open this report and filter by Rep Code = 112. You will not see any values.

This relation between the Rep Code and the Commission Schedule is synced from JDE to ORO daily using the “rep_code“ file. Example of the most recent “rep_code“ file from JDE synced to ORO (downloaded from FTP):

[^P_rep_code_20240207T030127Z.csv]

There are no records for Rep Code 112.

*To fix this issue, follow the next steps:*

* Add data to JDE to populate rep_code file that has correct Commission Schedules for Rep Code = 112
* Wait for the daily sync to finish, or trigger it manually from CLI:
{noformat}# Step 1. Upload CSV files from FTP to ORO (this command runs 2 times per hour, so you can skip it if the CSV file was already transferred to ORO)
orocloud-cli app:console "oro:cron:dt:integration:sftp:synchronize"
# Ensure that rep_code file was transferred to ORO folder:
ls -lsa /mnt/ocom/app/www/var/data/importexport/jde_file_integration/new/
# Step 2. Run import of this file (otherwise it will run 2 time per day based on CRON schedule "45 9,19 * * *")
orocloud-cli app:console "oro:cron:dt:integration:import:rep_code"{noformat}
* To validate, open the report [https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/report/view/464|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/report/view/464] and filter records with Rep Code = 112
column167:
07/Feb/24 4:30 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], [~accountid:5f31179632360700383d0325], I remember the same kind of problem reported previously in the last 3 months. 

It looks as if the logic of the permissions and the integration of the Rep Code Commission Schedules from JDE to ORO was developed a long time ago, and the team forgot how it works. 

When a new Sales Agency is added or updated, all the modifications should be done in JDE, and ORO should simply sync this data daily using the mentioned “rep_code“ file. 

Also, it is important to remember that the Rep Code assigned to Sales Agency != Commission Schedule of the Customer. This means that if you assign Commission Schedule “112“ to the Customer, and if Rep Code “112” does not have related Commission Schedule “112“, the Sales Reps of the Sales Agency will not have permission to access those customers.

We can make changes to the current permissions logic if needed, but I’d suggest reporting a separate ticket for this and collect requirements first.

column166:
08/Feb/24 8:35 AM;6189567bcc2d7c00715af2fd;The way I found to identify missing orders is by doing the following:

# Log into Dapi
# Navigate to the DTI_P4 Archive folder and find the DemandPlansImport_2024* files
# FTP these files to an accessible directory
# Open the files in excel and get only Distinct order numbers (This is the DemandPlanID but you will need to remove the line number concatenated to the order number)
# Place each files disctinct orders numbers on the same excel sheet in different columns.
# Order by order numbers descending
# Compare columns and look for missing order number
# Search for missing order numbers in the dapi ARCHIVE folder using grep -li 'SO000027053' DemandHistoryDetailsImport_202*
# Use the GET DemandHistory api in Postman to get the details of the order
# Check the 4 different PlannedDemand-to-DemandHistory apis to find if it will import into P4

column1: Streamlining the Migration of Informatica Jobs from Development to Staging
column30: Currently, Informatica dev is functioning as our production environment. The mapping was developed without following the formal transition process to the stage and production environments. To rectify this, we'll move the mapping to the stage and then, in due course, to the production environment, ensuring all dependencies are handled correctly. This will align with the intended use of these three environments.

column1: Select design of integration to sync attributes from Catsy to ORO
column30:
h2. Approach 1. Use separate ORO Web API end-points for managing data of product attributes, product families, product categories, products, and product images

h3. Overview

In this approach, the API client of the external system (e.g. Informatica) is responsible for the orchestration of the API sync flow and has full granular control over the process.

The sync contains several steps, on each step API client is responsible for making requests to different API endpoints to complete the sync.

h3. Sync Flow

h4. Step 1. Sync Product Attributes via API

The goal of this step is to sync the state of all product attributes that exist in Catsy and should exist in ORO.

Note, that this step includes syncing the data on the level of the product attribute itself. It does not cover the usage of this attribute anywhere in the product data or product family data.

*API calls made on this step:*

# *API calls to check existing product attributes from ORO*
#* _Notes_
#** _This API can be used to detect which attributes already exist in ORO. If the attribute does not exist in ORO, it will have to be created via a separate API call._
# *API calls to create a new attribute in ORO*
#* Supported attribute types:
#** string
#** text
#** float
#** bool
#* Supported storage types:
#** serialized
#* _Notes_
#** _All custom attributes created via API should have a name with a special prefix “dt_“_
#** _There is also a “table column“ storage type, but better to avoid it in the first iteration, adding new attributes with this storage type will make the integration more complex since it will require enabling maintenance mode in the application to apply the necessary DB schema changes and rebuilding the cache._
# *API calls to update existing attributes if they require modification*
#* _Notes_
#** _Better to avoid it in 1st iteration, if we do not have such use cases_
# *API calls to delete existing attributes if they are deprecated or created by mistake*
#* _Notes_
#** _Better to avoid it in 1st iteration, if we do not have such use cases._

h4. *Step 2. Sync Product Attributes Families via API*

TBD

h4. *Step 3. Sync Product Categories via API*

TBD

h4. *Step 4.1 Sync Products Data*

TBD

h4. *Step 4.2 Sync Product Images Data*

TBD

h2. Approach 2. Send product file over API that contains all product data to sync

h3. Overview

In this approach, the external system (e.g. Informatica) provides a complete file with all the data needed to sync the products. ORO side of the integration takes care of all steps of the product data synchronization. This means that the external system has less control and may be complex to implement. In this scenario, the ORO side will bear the weight of the integration sync flow's substantial workload.

h3. Sync Flow

h4. 1. Create a new sync job via API

* The sync job must contain a link to a file with product data that can be downloaded by ORO for importing
* The result of the API call is the ID of the sync job

h4. 2. Check the status of the sync job via API

* Using the ID from the previous step, the API client sends a request to check the current progress of the sync job
* Besides the status, the sync job API exposes any errors that happened during the sync operation
* Some errors may be critical and will make the sync job fail without completion, other errors may allow to general part of the sync job to be completed
* In addition to API, the sync job can be monitored from ORO UI. User responsible for Catsy catalog sync in ORO can have special permissions to see all sync jobs and their statuses to be able to supervise the sync process and make manual actions if required.
* The sync job processing sends an email to notify interested parties about the status of sync completion or failures

h2. Approach 3. Sync using staging tables in ORO DB

h3. Overview

DiversiTech adds. staging tables to ORO DB. The tables are replicated from Snowflake and contain data needed for sync. ORO is using these tables as data sources for the sync on a daily basis.

h3. Staging Tables

Next tables are required:

* Table with attributes
** Columns
*** id (optional, if you want)
*** name (name of the column in products staging table, e.g. “Warranty_by_RMA_Only“)
*** label (label for the UI, e.g. “Warranty by RMA Only“)
*** type (string, float, text, integer, boolean, enum)
**** new enum attributes not supported in 1st iteration, but existing attributes could have enum type
* Table with product families and groups
** Columns
*** id (optional, if you want)
*** family_label (e.g. “Tube Cutters”)
*** group_label (e.g. “Pricing & Accounting“)
*** attribute_label (e.g. “Warranty by RMA Only“)
** Example of rows:
*** Tube Cutters, Pricing & Accounting, Warranty by RMA Only
*** Tube Cutters, Pricing & Accounting, Discounts Allowed
*** Tube Cutters, Pricing & Accounting, Backorders Allowed (Y/N)
* Table with products
** Column
*** SKU (primary key)
*** … columns for every attribute of the product …

h3. Sync Flow

h4. Step 1. DiversiTech updates data in staging tables

h4. Step 2. ORO uses staging tables to sync attributes, families, groups, categories, products, product images data

column168: 08/Feb/24 9:24 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:712020:278d673b-282a-4090-8ce2-c5157b0d4477]  Have we discovered why the PPDJ is updating when a pick list is printing?
column169:
16/Feb/24 8:33 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;There are two scenarios that are changing the Promised Ship Date.

 

# Inbound orders from other systems care overriding the  Promised Ship Date.  
## The expectation is that the external system either provides a REQUEST DATE for each order or no request date.    
## Our configuration in JDE was not setup to accept an override of the Promised Ship Date. 

                                                               i.      This may be conflicting with the preferences that are in place that calculate the *Order Prep Dates* to prepare the order for shipment and the *Order Ship Days* to allow for transportation from our facility to the customer.

                                                             ii.      Generally the *Order Prep Dates* preference add five days from the order date to calculate the ship date.  

# Exceptions are also in place for quick ship.

                                                           iii.      Then the *Order Ship Days* preferences generally adds five days to the Ship Date to calculate the delivery date which is when we expect their shipment to arrive.  

# If it’s not an issue with the external system changing the promised ship date, then according to Bhargava who made the changes to the Consolidated Shipments, this is working as designed with consolidated shipment.
## The newer sales order lines are consolidating with shipments that are old and the new lines get their dates from the older shipments that they are consolidating into.
## The Promised Ship Date and the Delivery Date on the SO detail lines of other shipments will be updated with dates from the root consolidated shipment.    The root consolidated shipment will generally be the oldest shipment that is past due for the same ship to customer.  
## The Requested Date will remain the same on those other order lines. 
## The customer service team does not update dates on old sales orders when they become past due.  They just keep their old dates. If they maintained these dates, then this issue would go away.  

 

We also had a case where Bennie on the transportation team ran a lot of SA shipments through Shipment Routing / Approval on 10/31/23 and forced the date backwards.    That seems to have been a single event but it affected a lot of orders.

Please note, that the number in the string “enum.enum_options.%index%“ stands for the index of the distinct value of the attribute in the file.

For example, attribute “Answer 1“ has the next value with index = 6:

{quote}In dual fuel systems such as heat pumps with gas auxiliary, the system traditionally relies on the thermostat's swing settings to determine when to engage additional stages of heat, including the gas auxiliary. The system only knows the indoor temperature. Using an outdoor temperature sensor allows the technician to set a "Dual fuel balance point" temperature to determine when the system should switch to the auxiliary heat, maximizing the comfort, efficiency, and longevity of the system. In many parts of the country, this is either a code or a requirement to receive a rebate.{quote}

IMO, all such enum attributes should be converted to serialized strings, which should be done in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3033|smart-link]

column1: Updated Packadrdline.com SSL/http website with American Eagle
Gasp: add one more parameter to redirect URL for Decisions
column30:
This is the final version of the URL we should be using for Oro to Decisions 

It can be broken down in the following manner: 

 

https://{Environment}.decisions.com/Primary/?FlowId={FlowID}&&sessionid={SessionID}&ForceFormat=true&OroOrderId={ID}&OroErrorUrl={ErrorURL}&OroSuccessUrl={SuccessURL}&Location=Center&Chrome=Off

 

* Environment: For connecting to UAT/PROD
** Values: diversitechuat OR diversitechprod
* Flow ID: Constant parameter.
** Value: 08dc12cc-21c6-470c-8d1b-161a3805f2c1
* Session ID: Constant parameter that uses a defined session created in Decisions for the Oro Sys Account user. 
** Value: NS-08dc1920-8b0e-5ed5-8d1b-161a3806b472
* OroOrderId: Input parameter of the order ID from Oro. 
* OroErrorUrl: URL provided by Oro for the specific order upon some error where the order payment information is not received.
* OroSuccessUrl: URL provided by Oro for the specific order upon successful payment information gathered and sent to Decisions for processing.

h2. Acceptance Criteria

# The base URL must be changed, the test URL must have {Environment} value equal to diversitechuat .
# All new parameters except “Session ID“ must added via code.
# The “Session ID” must be added as a text field on the integration configuration page as a required field.

h2. Exclusions

* Migrations are not included, the admin will be responsible for updating the payment method integration configuration.

column1: MVP+ CPOV - Bug - Obsolete Flag not Flagging (Item Master)
column30:
Users have flagged an issue where ORO is not flagging lines with Item Master Obsolete SKU’s. Please review for a solution.

The SKU’s confirmed not showing are as follows:

* PSMJ710A
* PTMJ400A
* K610

!TroubleLog 15.png|width=1288,height=344!

!PTMJ400A Obsolete.png|width=1313,height=554!

!PSMJ710A Obsolete.png|width=1301,height=530!

!K610 Obsolete.png|width=1302,height=554!
column166:
25/Jan/24 3:51 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], someone has updated on  the UAT the enum table that holds “Stocking Type“. The old values, active currently on PROD:

{noformat}orodb=> select * from oro_enum_a6a3e5e5_395a7160;
       id        |       name        | priority | is_default 
-----------------+-------------------+----------+------------
 purchased       | Purchased         |        1 | f
 manufactured    | Manufactured      |        2 | f
 obsolete_use_up | Obsolete - Use Up |        3 | f
 obsolete        | Obsolete          |        4 | f{noformat}

Notice the value of ID column.

The new values on UAT:

{noformat}orodb=> select * from oro_enum_a6a3e5e5_395a7160;
 id |       name        | priority | is_default 
----+-------------------+----------+------------
 m  | Manufactured      |        0 | f
 o  | Obsolete          |        0 | f
 p  | Purchased         |        0 | f
 u  | Obsolete - Use Up |        0 | f{noformat}
column167: 25/Jan/24 3:54 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], please note any changes to the enum tables may break some business logic. In this case, the application has built-in logic to identify “Obsolete“ stocking type by comparing the ID of the record with string “obsolete“. After the record “obsolete“ was deleted, and instead the record with ID = “o“ was added, this logic stopped working.
column168:
25/Jan/24 4:08 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], as I see, this issue should not reproduce on PROD, because the update in the table of “Stocking Type“ enum attribute was done only on UAT, but not on PROD.

I need clarification what to do next:

# Option 1) You will revert the changes on UAT
# Option 2) We need to update the application logic to use new enum IDs.
column169:
29/Jan/24 11:51 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] 

# Are you able to see who made these changes in UAT and the reason for the change?
# What does the priority field govern?
# If we were to choose option 2, what other area’s could this change impact? Would it effect the Catsy to ORO updates in any way?
column170:
29/Jan/24 12:44 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] 

# No, I don’t. Check with [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] , maybe she can help to find out. Changes were made directly to the DB.
# The order of options when the user sees the field in the drop-down.
# First of all, if this change that someone did on UAT will be rolled out to PROD, this bug will start affecting PROD immediately after that.
The Catsy updates should not be affected.
But to fix this bug, we will need to prepare a solution that will support both old and new version of IDs for this enum (e.g. both “o“ and “obsolete“ should be considered as Obsolete stocking type).
In any case, such direct changes to the DB can cause problems. It is never recommended to delete rows from table that may be used somewhere and replace them with new values that have different IDs.
column171:
30/Jan/24 8:57 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] Thanks for clarifying.

3. Can we not prepare a solution to support the new version of IDs for this enum? Why would we need to keep 2 separate IDs that represent the same value? No one recommended deleting any rows from the table just updating the values in the table and the application logic associated with it. 

[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] Thoughts?
column172:
30/Jan/24 9:03 AM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837]  - we’ve rolled back the ENUM table on UAT to be same as PROD. 

1. We should re-confirm the issue is no longer causing a problem on UAT. 
2. Next, if we are looking to update the “values” NOT IDs, then that is the work we should be discussing.
column173: 30/Jan/24 9:36 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] I discussed with Janelle yesterday and she agreed that the “New” UAT Values for the ID fields were the correct values. Why would we revert back? How much technical debt are we willing to incur in these one off discussions?
column174:
30/Jan/24 12:52 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], if you need to update the IDs of these enums to the new version, the correct approach is to report the ticket and request this change. No one should make these changes manually via DB SQL queries, since this will lead to bugs like you reported here.

{quote}I discussed with Janelle yesterday and she agreed that the “New” UAT Values for the ID fields were the correct values. Why would we revert back?{quote}

The users of the ORO application should not care about the way how ID of this enum is represented in the DB. If you have such dependencies where some external system to ORO demands the new version of IDs, this may be a sign of some design issues in the external system.

Also, taking into account that the stocking type of the product will be soon replaced by read from external DB, this field in the product will be soon deprecated and not used anywhere in the application logic.
column175: 31/Jan/24 2:37 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] please review the reverted changes and confirm that there is no additional work needed here.
column176: 31/Jan/24 5:55 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], confirmed.

column1: Refactor shipping methods and setting freight terms logic
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Add “Freight Terms” and “Mode of Transport” to the form of shipping method on the Shipping Rule create/edit page

!image-20240119-193553.png|width=1843,height=895!
* The fields should be added using select types. 
** In case it will impact the implementation cost significantly, use plain text fields to enter the code of “Freight Terms” and “Mode of Transport”
* When the order is created on the checkout, it should have  “Freight Terms” and “Mode of Transport” set based on these fields set from the UI in the shipping method rule options from the UI.

h2. Exclusions

* Migrations are not included, the admin will be responsible for updating shipping method rules on UAT/PROD after delivering this feature.

h2. Technical Notes

* Leave {{\DT\Bundle\OrderBundle\Feature\OrderShipping\Provider\OrderFreightTermsProvider}} as a fallback. The admin will be responsible for updating shipping method rules on UAT/PROD after delivering this feature
* Update logic of {{\DT\Bundle\OrderBundle\Feature\OrderShipping}} to use these new fields from the shipping rule form to update the order entity

13/Feb/24 7:14 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a], this page may return 403 in certain cases, for example:

* The payment callback URL was already processed for the linked checkout
* The related Checkout is not applicable for the given payment callback
* The Order in the related Checkout is NOT in the status Payment In Progress (“payment_in_progress“)

In this case, there is no clear reason for this issue. I added debug code via a patch to collect more information in case this issue happens again on UAT.
column171: 14/Feb/24 8:23 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18]  Thanks. I was just trying to get the form working so I wasn’t debugging but in my testing scenarios today I’ll also keep an eye out. I did think I notice the status updated to AR Review before I finished submitting the payment, so that makes sense. I’ll let you know what I find.
column172:
19/Feb/24 1:09 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18]  Created several more orders. In every instance the Succuss URL shows an Unauthorized error. The Redirect for errors/canceling works as expected. Let me know if you want a seperate bug ticket. 

I thought maybe it was the impersonation causing the issue so I logged in as the user and then created an order and submitted payment. Same outcome. 

Scenario: 

* The customer user places a Genpad order with CC as the payment option.
** Enter the PO number and click on Submit Order
** Redirected to Decisions form to enter payment details. 
** Enter payment information correctly and click on Place Order
** Redirect shows Unauthorized, but Decisions continues to work and API updates the status of the order correctly 
*** Order shows on the customer portal under Order History. 
*** Order status updated to Review AR
*** The customer’s cart does not clear, the same product and qty showing along with the same PO number already populated. 

Example of one successful redirect URL: [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/payment/callback/return/aea561ca-beb1-480f-b687-dfdd87848975|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/payment/callback/return/aea561ca-beb1-480f-b687-dfdd87848975]
column173:
23/Feb/24 11:26 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Ignat Shcheglovskyi (Guest)Wednesday 1:31 PM

Hi Nika

Question about [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6176|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6176|smart-link] 

There are some PATCH API requests sent to ORO Order when the user is entering payment information.

Nika Hall

Yes, I patch the order to update the internal status from payment in progress to review ar

It does happen just before the redirect, is that the issue?

Ignat Shcheglovskyi

Yes, the expected flow is next:

# User creates checkout and selects payment method
# ORO redirects User to Decisions to enter payment method
## ORO updates Order internal status to Payment in Progress.
# User enters payment in Decisions form
# Decisions redirects the user back to ORO using the success URL callback
# ORO is processing the callback, the next validation runs:
## Find not finished Checkout that used on step 1 and 2
## Check related Order internal status, it should be Payment in Progress
# If validation passed
## ORO updates the internal status to Review AR
## User sees finish checkout page with link to review order, checkout is finished

 

Just found that this flow and other use cases are described in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|smart-link]

!image-20240223-162630.png|width=1110,height=527!

The reason why it is failing now is that the logic finds that the Order is already moved to "Review AR" status, and fails to process the callback URL.

This is done to prevent processing of the callback multiple times. This callback URL is expected to be used only once.
column174:
28/Feb/24 12:48 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Updated flow to move the redirect step before the API call. API call was happening too quickly and before the page would load, leading to the same issue. 

Added 30 second pause step between the redirect and API call. Successful redirect

!image-20240228-174835.png|width=623,height=323!

column30:
Current issue with the default branch being set on the line level causing pad lines to be cancelled in JDE. The pads are marked obsolete in the branches (ex: 11500) so the order processes, but the pads are removed from the order. 

Hotfix to update the Oro to JDE flow that maps to the F47012 (Order Detail table) and set the branch value to NULL if it is a pad line. 

# Create a mapplet with the branch logic to be easily removable once invetory allocation is full implemented in Oro
# Lookup part by sku (productSku) in the Item Master table (F4101.IMLITM)
# Run a rule set to see if sub-section (IMSRP2) is in the list of pad sub-sections (List Below)
# If subsection is in the list
## True - Set branch (dt_cost_center_id) to NULL
## False - Do Nothing

List of UDCs for pad sub-sections: 

* 100
* 103
* 105
* 106
* 109
* 110
* 115
* 120
* 200
* 205
* 210
* 215
* 220
* 221
* 223
* 225
* 925

column30: Verify Informatica updated to account for Freight and Mode of Transport changes in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3104|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3104|smart-link]
column166:
01/Feb/24 5:04 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] and [~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18]  Please confirm Informatica should be using the following Attribute fields from the Order API to populate the Freight and Mode of Transport fields in JDE

|JDE Field|Description|Oro Field|Oro Field Type|
|MOT|Mode Of Transport|dt_mode_of_transport_id|Attribute of orders entity|

column30:
h2. Overview

Optimize the use of the Content Security Policy (CSP) header on the DiversiTech websites hosted in Oro. Read more about CSP in [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy|smart-link] 

h2. Reasons to use Content Security Policy header

Reasons related to security:

# *Mitigating Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Attacks:*
## XSS is a common web vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into a website.
## CSP effectively blocks unauthorized scripts from executing, significantly reducing the risk of XSS attacks.
# *Preventing Data Injection Attacks:*
## CSP can restrict the sources from which data can be loaded, protecting against attacks like:
### HTML injection
### JSON injection
### URL injection
# *Defending Against Clickjacking:*
## Clickjacking tricks users into clicking on hidden elements, potentially leading to unintended actions.
## CSP's {{frame-ancestors}} directive blocks unauthorized websites from framing your content, preventing clickjacking attempts.
# *Limiting Script Execution Scope:*
## CSP's {{script-src}} directive can control where scripts can execute from, reducing the attack surface and potential damage.
# *Enhancing Privacy and Security Best Practices:*
## Implementing CSP demonstrates a commitment to web security best practices, building trust with users and potential partners.
# *Early Detection of Vulnerabilities:*
## CSP violations generate reports in the browser's console, aiding in early identification and remediation of potential vulnerabilities.
# *Reducing Attack Surface and Impact:*
## Even if a vulnerability exists, a strict CSP can limit the attacker's options and potential damage.
# *Protecting Against Emerging Threats:*
## CSP can be adapted to address new attack vectors as they emerge, ensuring ongoing protection.
# *Compliance with Security Standards*
## Some industry standards and regulations mandate the use of CSP, and its implementation can help demonstrate compliance.

*While CSP isn't a direct ranking factor, it can indirectly influence search engine rankings in several positive ways:*

# Enhanced Security and User Experience:
## *Reduced risk of attacks:* CSP protects against XSS and other vulnerabilities that can harm user experience and website reputation.
## *Improved trustworthiness:* A secure website is more likely to earn Google's trust, potentially leading to better rankings.
## *Signal for good practices:* Implementing CSP shows a commitment to security and best practices, aligning with Google's focus on user safety.
# Potential for Faster Page Load Times:
## *Optimized resource loading:* CSP can encourage efficient resource management, potentially reducing page load time — a known ranking factor.
## *Blocking unwanted resources:* It can prevent the loading of unnecessary or malicious scripts, reducing overall page weight and load time.
# Reduced Risk of Penalties:
## *Protecting from malware:* CSP helps prevent malware injection, which could lead to Google penalties for compromised sites.
## *Avoiding manual actions:* Security breaches can trigger manual actions from Google, significantly impacting rankings. CSP helps mitigate such risks.
# Alignment with Google's Security Initiatives:
## *Signal of proactiveness:* Google actively promotes security measures like CSP, and websites that adopt them may be seen more favorably.
## *Increasing emphasis on security:* Google's algorithms are likely to increasingly favor secure sites, making CSP a wise investment.
# Possible Future Direct Impact:
## *Potential ranking signal:* While not yet a direct factor, CSP could become a more explicit ranking signal in the future, as Google continues to prioritize security.

h2. Current State of using CSP on all Websites

Currently, the PROD application uses the next Content Security Policy header generated by default:

{noformat}Content-Security-Policy: connect-src https: 'self'; img-src 'self' data: https://*; default-src blob: https: 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'{noformat}

Use the free Google service [https://csp-evaluator.withgoogle.com/|https://csp-evaluator.withgoogle.com/|smart-link]  to evaluate this value:

!image-20240112-195332.png|width=1051,height=799!

Use another free service - [https://csper.io/evaluations/65a1989073eb9d58ab9f5bea|https://csper.io/evaluations/65a1989073eb9d58ab9f5bea|smart-link] :

!image-20240112-195407.png|width=1846,height=1319!

h2. *Plan to Enhance Use of Content-Security-Policy header*

# Begin with Report-Only mode
## *Deploy in report-only mode:* Add {{Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only}} header to website responses.
## *Configure reporting endpoint:* Set up a reporting endpoint to receive and analyze violation reports.
## *Monitor violations:* Observe violation reports logs.
## *Review thoroughly:* Analyze reports to understand the website's resource usage and identify required sources.
# Create a Strict Initial Policy:
## *Default to* {{self}}: Start with {{default-src 'self'}} to allow only resources from the same origin.
## *Add specific sources:* Gradually whitelist trusted external sources as needed (e.g., {{script-src 'self' https://trusted-cdn.com'}}).
## *Consider nonces or hashes:* Use nonces or hashes for inline scripts and styles to control their execution.
# Gradual Enforcement:
## *Switch to enforcing mode:* Change the header to {{Content-Security-Policy}} to start blocking violations.
## *Monitor closely:* Watch for errors and user experience issues.
## *Refine as needed:* Adjust the policy based on feedback and violation reports.
# Continuous Monitoring and Maintenance:
## *Regular reviews:* Regularly review CSP reports for potential issues and attack attempts.
## *Update as needed:* Adapt the policy as your website evolves and new threats emerge.

Additional:

* Test thoroughly in the UAT environment before deploying CSP to production.
* Use tools to generate and manage CSP headers.
* Consider using a Content Security Policy generator for guidance.
* Minimize inline scripts and styles.

h2. Steps

# Implement Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only
# Deploy changes to UAT/PROD
# Monitor CSP violations in logs during 1-2 sprints
## Analyze reports to understand the website's resource usage and identify required sources
## Update Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only to support valid cases
## If there were no errors found on this step, or no changes needed to be deployed in Report-Only mode, go to step 4, otherwise, go to step  2
# Enforce the Content-Security-Policy header and deploy changes to PROD/UAT
# Continuous monitoring and maintenance of CSP header

(link of the page on UAT [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/attribute/index/product|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/attribute/index/product])

The file is missing any value in columns “Infographic 01”, “Infographic 02”, and “Infographic 03”. This is the reason why the attribute is not added

* To add the attribute, the import should be able to determine the type of this attribute.
* Without any values provided, it is not possible, and adding the attribute is ignored.

Can you import a file that satisfies the following conditions:

* Column “Infographic 01” has more than 100 unique values
* Column “Infographic 02” has more than 100 unique values
* Column “Infographic 03” has more than 100 unique values

If this is a problem, we need to create those attributes manually, otherwise, they may be created as enums, which is not expected.

----

PS.

The current logic of “Import Salsify File“ on “Product Attributes“ is next:

# For each column in the file, check if the corresponding attribute already exists.
# If the attribute exists 
## If the type of the attribute is enum
### Add new values to the enum based on the file
# If the attribute does exist
## Detect the type of the attribute using unique values from the file
### Detect boolean type (column has only 2 values, e.g. Y/N, 1/0)
### Detect enum type (column has at most 100 values, every value has a length of less than 255 characters)
### Detect string type (column has more than 100 values, some values exceed the length of 255 characters)
### Detect text type (all other cases)
## Add the new attribute using this type

----

PPS. Link to technical dept task that should allow adding attributes with custom types (replace the logic in step 3 above with manual configuration) - [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3032?searchObjectId=17871&searchContainerId=10002&searchContentType=issue&searchSessionId=87d1efca-ce33-46cf-bb50-314809cae2cb|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3032?searchObjectId=17871&searchContainerId=10002&searchContentType=issue&searchSessionId=87d1efca-ce33-46cf-bb50-314809cae2cb|smart-link]

column1: DTI P4 - Pumphouse P4 service levels are not showing correctly. Demand Plan Shipment command. Manage engine 102508
column30:
Manage engine #102508

Found POs that were demand plan but the requested ship date comes up and for some reason even though there is inventory on hand, the line shows that 0 was sent out. Need to add more logging to ctach what is happening
column166:
12/Jan/24 3:55 PM;6189567bcc2d7c00715af2fd;I the reason why the service level is lower than it should be is from these type of orders. This is an order that was a planned demand order. When the shipment date became today, then the order was sent to P4 as demand history. However the issue is that even though the shipment date is today, the order still shows the 0 of the requested 40 has been shipped. So a 0 will be sent to P4.

 

Now I read through my notes and I see that for normal demand history and for planned demand where the requested Date is today, we take the qty_requested from the order and we check the inventory level of that item to see if there is enough inventory. We then send the results of that calculation to p4.

 

However, we are not doing this for orders that were planned demand but the shipment date is now today. For those orders we are taking the actual values of quantityBase and outstandingQuantityBase to figure out the qty sold and send that to P4. So it looks like that those fields don’t always reflect what inventory was actually shipped. See the order in my screenshot below, even though the order was shipped today, it shows the quantity shipped for this line was 0.

My first thought is that we need to also make the planned demand orders with shipment dates for today go through the same process of checking the qty on hand to see if there was enough inventory to fulfill the order and send the results of THAT calculation to P4. 

*My concerns:* Does the qty on hand number I pull already have the amount shipped from these “shipped today” orders taken out of it?

Unless anyone knows of another way, I guess we have to run the orders with a shipment date of today through the same process using the qty on hand calculation.

column1: Update checkout logic when Collect Payment method is used
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* The changes below should be applicable when the Collect Payment method is used on the checkout
** See [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|smart-link]
* Add new internal statuses for the Order 
** Payment In Progress (payment_in_progress)
** Review AR (review_ar)
** See the section “Related Order Internal Statuses“ in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|smart-link] 
* When checkout is submitted a new order is created (see create_order transition). This order should be initially saved only with internal status = “Payment In Progress“
** Note, that the order should never be saved to the DB with internal status = “New“, because we need to make sure it won’t be transferred to JDE as other orders created on checkout
* When payment method error callback is executed:
** The order’s internal status should be updated from “Payment in Progress“ to “Cancelled“.
** The logic should update the internal status only if the current status is “Payment in Progress“, otherwise the error callback execution should fail.
** Checkout should finish, but instead of the “Thank You For Your Purchase!“ text, it should contain text about the error and information that the order was canceled ((?) TBD Request requirements about text on this page)
* When payment method success callback is executed:
** The order status should be updated from “Payment in Progress“ to “Review AR“.
** The logic should update the status only if the current status is “Payment in Progress“, otherwise the success callback execution should fail
** Checkout should finish, and the user should see the standard “Thank You For Your Purchase!“ page

column30:
Wofklow needed to create Assignments for AR to process CC payments customers place on the Oro Customer Portal

# Data structure creation for CC payment information
## CC number field should be encrypted
## Validations needed to verify CC info is valid (starts with the right number, correct length, all data entered, not expired). 
## data should be purged after flow ends and not stored. 
# Payments are to be assigned to AR team to process the payment
## Form with the relevant order and customer information as well as CC info
## Output of either success or failure 
## upon success, updates the order in Oro to appropriate status
## Upon failure, updates the order in Oro to ‘Cancelled’
# Assignments should be auditable to log who last updated the assignment as well as who completed it. 

High level flow

# Customer submits order and moves to CC payment screen in Oro that redirects user to the Decisions form. 
## Input for start of flow should be the Oro Order ID
## Upon submission, Decisions redirects the customer to either a success or error page in Oro. 
# Trigger main flow start: Subflow to fetch customer and order information based on the Oro ID passed through
## Customer Info: 
### Name (attribute)
### JDE Account ID (attribute)
### Billing Address (relational)
## Order Details: 
### Order number (linked to the order in Oro)
### Total

----

[https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|smart-link] 

The redirect URL consists of the next components:

* Base URL
** Value for PROD - (?) TBD Should be provided by Nika, assumed value is {{https://diversitechprod.decisions.com/Primary/H/}} - {color:#36b37e}This is correct{color}
** Value for UAT - (?) TBD Should be provided by Nika, assumed value is {{https://diversitechdev.decisions.com/Primary/H/}} - {color:#36b37e}Value would be {color}[{color:#36b37e}https://diversitechuat.decisions.com/Primary/H/{color}|https://diversitechuat.decisions.com/Primary/H/]
* FlowId
** ID of flow in Decisions, please provide this value for PROD and DEV.
** Value for PROD - (?) TBD Should be provided by Nika - {color:#36b37e}TBD{color}
** Value for UAT - (?) TBD Should be provided by Nika - {color:#36b37e}TBD{color}
*** {color:#36b37e}*The flow ID will be the same for PROD and UAT either way.*{color}

Use Case Scenarios

# ORO redirects the Customer User Decisions payment form via the Decisions Redirect URL
## Decisions should check the given order via API to ensure that it has internal status = “Payment In Progress“. If the internal status is different (e.g. Approved, Review AR, Cancelled, etc), it is possible that this order was already processed, and the application should show an error to the user (?) TBD Confirm it with Nika - {color:#36b37e}Agreed. Flow will validate status when pulling order information{color}
# DT user opens Decisions and finds payment record created on step 3
## Decisions load order information via API to show it to the user, including Total, Billing Address, Internal Status
## At this step, Decisions should validate that Internal Status equals “Review AR“, otherwise it should prevent the user from processing the payment to avoid incorrect charges (?) TBD Confirm it with Nika - {color:#36b37e}Agreed. The Status field on the form should run a flow to get the updated status from Oro to prevent duplicate billing issues as well as check if an order was cancelled.{color}

column168:
16/Jan/24 1:20 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], the meaning of warning like

{quote}Warning in row #14405. Row contains non-empty values in "Product Name, Secondary UoM, Pricing UoM, Purchasing UoM, Production UoM, Shipping UoM, Component UoM, Volume UOM, Weight UOM, Primary Volume (cubic feet), Master Planning Family ID, Master Planning Family, Category Name, Catalog Item Family  - ID, Catalog Item Family, Long Description, Flash Point (deg. F), Order Reprice Group, Accounting Cost Qty" columns. This product does not have "Product Name, Secondary UoM, Pricing UoM, Purchasing UoM, Production UoM, Shipping UoM, Component UoM, Volume UOM, Weight UOM, Primary Volume (cubic feet), Master Planning Family ID, Master Planning Family, Category Name, Catalog Item Family  - ID, Catalog Item Family, Long Description, Flash Point (deg. F), Order Reprice Group, Accounting Cost Qty" attributes and this values were ignored.{quote}

is next:

# The product has “Product Family” in Oro, it has a specific list of attributes.
# The import file contained the Product with attributes that do not belong to the “Product Family” of the Product.
# The import ignored updating the values of those attributes from the Warnining message. 

So this warning message can hint you the root cause of the problem if you try to follow the next steps:

# Open some Products after import in ORO
# Open this Product in the file
# Check that the attribute like“Purchasing UoM“ has some value in the file for this Product, but the Product in ORO has no value for this attribute after import.

Please confirm that you want to remove these warnings from the logs.

Maybe instead of simply removing these warnings it is better to always set the values of the product attributes during import, even if they do not belong to the product family.
column169: 16/Jan/24 2:11 PM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] Most of these attributes should already be assigned to all of the product families. Kelly never mentioned updating the product families, so my apologies if I am incorrect.
column170:
16/Jan/24 2:50 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:621cf583a124500068860e4d], whenever the import shows warning messages like in the example above, there is a case that the attribute mentioned in the warning message does not exist in the product family of the product provided on the given line in the import file.

So it seems that if you have too many errors like this, the product families may not be updated. As I know, Kelly used some files in native ORO format to update product families using “Products” / “Product Families“ - “Import File“.

!image-20240116-194845.png|width=1848,height=899!

If you would try to use “Import Salsify File“ for the use case of updating product families, please note that this type of import may produce unexpected results and it should be used carefully (we planned to remove it). This import could be used only if the provided file represents a full dataset (not a file that was split into parts).
column171: 19/Jan/24 12:10 PM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] Just so I understand, I can load the attribute updates into ORO using the ‘Import file’ w/o splitting the file and it will not error out?
column172: 19/Jan/24 12:12 PM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;I’ve spot checked some of the ones that have errored. Found the attribute in the file, went to the product family in ORO, and checked to see if the attribute is assigned to the family and they are there. Would there be another reason for the errors?

column1: POH - ORO to ADD Columns to Order Table & Order Line Item Table
column30:
*ORO* - ADD Column to Order Table & Order Line Item Table

* Convert from JSON to TEXT for static column (same as the last report) & Concat
** Column: {color:#00b8d9}*Initial Errors*{color} - Concat TEXT Errors 
*** {color:#00b8d9}*_Only shows whatever errors the order had upon the initial receipt of the order from the customer_*{color}
*** {color:#00b8d9}*_Boolean Field Removed_*{color}

h2. Acceptance Criteria

h3. Entity Order and OrderLineItem


Add next columns:

* dt_validation_{color:#00b8d9}*init*{color}_errors
Label: {color:#00b8d9}*Initial Errors*{color}
Type:  dt_order_error_check_error_list (see {{DT\Bundle\OrderBundle\Feature\OrderChecker\Doctrine\CheckErrorListType }})
Auditable: True
Form: Hidden
Datagrid: Hidden
* dt_validation_{color:#00b8d9}*init*{color}_errors_text
Label: {color:#00b8d9}*Initial Errors Messages*{color}
Type: Text
Auditable: True
Form: Hidden
Datagrid: Hidden

h3. Location of the new logic

* Create an interface for  {{OrderCheckResultsHandler}} 
* Create an additional handler {{InitialOrderCheckResultHandler}}, its purpose is to sync data in initial fields
* {{InitialOrderCheckResultHandler}} should decorate {{OrderCheckResultsHandler}}

h3. The logic of updating the data in initial fields on “Line Level“ and “Order Level“

* This logic must work only when the Order has a null value in the field {{dt_validation_executed_at}}
* Initial validation errors and error text must be saved to the corresponding entity
* In the case when the Order is created via API all provided errors must be merged with internal errors and saved to the corresponding entity

h2. Out Of Scopes

* Data migration for existing Orders

01/Feb/24 8:07 AM;557058:9faed481-f20c-4b44-b2a4-6d509e95e185;HI [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] I have some questions related to this functionality. Please, help me answer them:

* Do we update "Historic errors" in canceled line items?
* Do we set the flag "Ever Had an Error" to true when the canceled line item receives any error during the check (in the case when previously it hadn't any of them)?
* Do we update the flag "Ever Had an Error" for Order in the case when only canceled line items have errors?
* Do we update the flag "Ever Had an Error" for Order when a non-canceled line item with errors changes the status to canceled, but other items don't have any?
* Do we update the flag "Ever Had an Error" for Order when a non-canceled line item is removed, but other items don't have any?
* Do we need to show values from these new fields on the Order view page?
* Do we need to create a migration to fill new fields in existing Orders, OrderLineItems with data from the existing validation result?

column1: Transition error on approval workflow for customized order entity
column30:
h2. Initial Issue details

In PO Validation workflow, user triggers exception error on Approval. 

ERROR: “An exception occurred while executing 'INSERT INTO dt_order_inventory_reservation (created_at, order_id, order_line_item_id) VALUES (?,?,?) with params [“2024-01-05 15:27:21”, 939136, 8566021]. SQLSTATE[23505]: Unique violation: ? ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique contraint “uniq_1fa437ea30b4753” DETAIL: Key (order_line_item_id)=(8526021) already exists.”

!image-20240105-201217.png|width=1716,height=238!

h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Open CPOV Order that satisfies the next conditions:
## Created before deployment of  [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5131|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5131|smart-link]  to PROD or UAT
### This means that reservation was not created for this Order, because the old version of the workflow was used
## Order workflow status implies that inventory reservation is required:
### Ready for approval
### Imported approval
### Approval override
# Click the button to run the “Approve” transition

Expected:

* The order moved to Approved status

Actual:

* The transition failed, and the user see an error message as shown in the screenshot above

h2. Hot-Fix Solution

Fix the data of the orders and create all missing reservations for applicable orders. Such orders match the next criteria:

{noformat}(
    ("Order Status" = "Review" AND "Order Review Step" IN ("Ready for Approval", "Imported Approval", "Approval Override"))
    OR 
    "Order Status" IN ("Pending", "Approved")
) AND "Order Not Committed to JDE"{noformat}

h2. Complete Solution

* Add logic to actualize inventory reservation before the execution of order validation
** If such an order is applicable for reservation but it does not exist, it should be created 
** This operation should flush changes in the DB

I will add a hot-fix solution in the next 2 hours. You should be able to reproduce it on UAT based on the information provided in “Steps to Reproduce“.

column200: LOE to Generate Priority of PP on P3 Lines

column1: Update priority on P3 lines - JDE
column200: LOE to Generate Priority of PP on P3 Lines

column1: LOE to Generate Priority of PP on P3 Lines
column30:
Business asking for LOE for future enhancement on generating a priority code of PP on the line level that are part of the P3 program. 

Currently, the PPP flag is on the Customer level under the Zone Number and pushes to both the Order Header and Order Detail tables in JDE under the ZON field. 

Logic needed would be to check if the Customer has the PPP flag, and the SKUs on the line level have a Global Item Family ID (IMSRP5) value of ‘ELT’ or ‘ECO’. If conditions are met, then the Order Priority field would need to be set to ‘PP’ (Net New code) on that line.  

Note: When talking to Jessica, she said they also need to put in HOT RUSH in the CS Note field in Oro. Unclear why we would need both the Order Priority (URCD) and CS Note populated.

column1: Reconcile the difference between the Inventory Ledger and the General Ledger
column30: Request from Amanda Little to reconcile the difference between the Inventory Ledger and the General Ledger for December.

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Implement a new Shipping Method integration that has a hard-coded logic for 7 SKUs based on the file “Generac 2024 Prices 11-30-2023_3.5 increase.xlsx“ from the parent ticket.
* This hard-coded solution should be suitable to be replaced after Jan 19th in the scope of  [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|smart-link].
* Implement a service/specification that knows how to identify GenPads products. These are 7 hard-coded SKUs:
** CG3154-3G,  FG5431-3G2, FG5431-3G, FG9041-4G, FG8341-4G, FG7037-4G

h2. Exclusions

* Converting shipping cost to the Fee Line Item and setting the correct Freight Terms field to the order will be implemented separately in scope of [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6031|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6031|smart-link] 

h2. User Stories

All user stories from [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|smart-link] are applicable here.

It will help to save ~30-40 hours. This solution should be replaced with [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|smart-link]  after first iteration that is planned to release on Jan 19th.
column168:
04/Jan/24 2:35 PM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] UPDATE to Shipping calculation:
From spreadsheet, we only need to take into account SKU - Volume * FRT cost + Volume * Dealer Price Proposed (Column J) so calc would be for line 10 as such:
(5 * $50) + 5 * 154.50 = $2658.50 /.03%
column169:
04/Jan/24 3:46 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], let’s discuss these updated requirements. They do not look clear to me. In the scope of this task, we plan to hard-code the logic to calculate shipping cost using only the next columns from the file “Generac 2024 Prices 11-30-2023_3.5 increase.xlsx“:

* Generac Part Number (Product SKU in ORO)
* Qty
*  Freight Price 

----

*Example #1:*

Consider that we have the next checkout:

* Line #1: SKU=CG3154-3G, QTY=35
* Line #2: SKU=FG5431-4G, QTY=150
* Line #3: SKU=FG9041-4G, QTY=13

Shipping Rates are the same as in the file “Generac 2024 Prices 11-30-2023_3.5 increase.xlsx”

* Shipping Cost = 25.00 * 35 + 45.00 * 150 + 197.00 * 13 = 10186.0

Notes:

* The shipping cost does not take into account the “3.50%” coefficient. It will be added separately to a subtotal of the order that includes shipping and the summed price for all lines.
* The shipping cost does not take into account Dealer Price Proposed (Column J)

*Example #2:*

Consider that we have the next checkout (similar to the example from your previous comment):

* Line #1: SKU=FG5431-3G, QTY=5 

Shipping Rates are the same as in the file “Generac 2024 Prices 11-30-2023_3.5 increase.xlsx”

* Shipping Cost = 60.00 * 5 = 300.00

----

If this logic does not look correct to you, please let me know ASAP, since we are working on this implementation right now, and we need to be on the same page.

column30:
The Summary of Availibility drives the qty to make/buy.  If this includes an order that is dated 30 days into the future, then we are double counting that order amount.  We absolutely need to resolve this but it is not an urgent matter.  That is why Shandra was cc’ed so we can slot into the JDE teams workload as they have time.

 

+Proposal+

Step 1 would be to understand how JDE is functioning.

Step 2 would be to investigate if we can influence and then LOE to change

column1: Modify order created with calculated shipping method
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* The changes below should be applied to orders created using the “Calculated Shipping” shipping method
** See [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6052|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6052|smart-link]
* The shipping cost should be added as a separate line of order:
** Line name: “FRT“
** Line type: “N“
* The Freight Terms field of this order should be updated to “PP”

h2. *Technical Notes*

* See the example of implementation in {{\DT\Bundle\QuickShipBundle\Checkout\OrderUpdate\ConvertShippingCostToLineItemsOrderUpdater}}.

column1: Update checkout to allow purchase only GenPads
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* If the Customer User’s field “Allowed to purchase only GenPads?“ = “Yes“, the checkout should run additional validation and restrict products that do not belong to “Global Item Family” = “General Pads”
* The button to submit checkout should be disabled
* The user should see an error message on the checkout in the line that issue.
* As an example, see the UI on the Quick Ship Checkout, when one of the lines is not eligible for Quick Ship:

!image-20240104-073706.png|width=1846,height=1253!
* Error message in the line: “Item is not eligible for purchase. Only General Pads can be purchased at this moment.“
* Error message in the checkout header: “Order can't be submitted, please check errors in line items and/or contact customer service.“

column1: Changes to be made manually in ORO by the DiversiTech team
column30:
The changes below should be made manually by the Administrator user:

# Web Catalog Configuration
## Update the “Master Catalog“ Web Catalog used in the B2B website to add a new Content Node representing all GenPads products. This should help Customer Users to find GenPads products quickly.
# Payment Methods Configuration
## Depends on:
### [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|smart-link] 
### [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6027|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6027|smart-link] 
## Create a new integration with the type “Collect Payment“ to support the new Payment Method on the Checkout
### Name = “Collect Payment“ (use any convenient value, this name will not be shown for the Customer User)
### Label/Short Labe = “Credit Card“ (this label will be shown on the checkout to the Customer User)
### Decisions Flow ID =  (Use value provided by [~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a], this ID will be used in the Decisions URL)
### Allowed Credit Card Types = (select any credit cards that you want to show on the checkout page as icons)
## Add a new Payment Rule to allow the “Collect Credit Card“ payment method
### Enabled = Yes
### Name = “Credit Card” (use any convenient value, this name will not be shown for the Customer User)
### Sort Order = {{-100}} (use the minimum value, to make this payment method rule to apply first before any other rule)
### Stop Further Rule Processing = Yes (this will hide all other payment methods on checkout if this rule is applied, see comments in the “Expression” field)
### Expression = {{customerUser.dt_allowed_pay_by_cc = true}} (this payment method is allowed only for Customer Users with “Allowed to pay by Credit Card?“ = “Yes“)
# Shipping Methods Configuration
## Depends on:
### [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6052|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6052|smart-link] 
### [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6027|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6027|smart-link] 
## Create a new integration with the type “Calculated Shipping“ to support the new Shipping Method on the Checkout
### Name = “Calculated Shipping“ (use any convenient value, this name will not be shown for the Customer User)
### Label = “Standard Ship“ (this label will be shown on the checkout to the Customer User)
## Add a new Shipping Rule to allow the “Calculated Shipping“ 
### Enabled = Yes
### Name = “Standard Ship“  (use any convenient value, this name will not be shown for the Customer User)
### Sort Order = {{-100}} (use the minimum value, to make this shipping method rule to apply first before any other rule)
### Stop Further Rule Processing = Yes (this will hide all other shipping methods on checkout if this rule is applied, see comments in “Expression” field)
### Expression =  {{customerUser.dt_allowed_purchase_only_genpads = true}} (this shipping method is allowed only when the Customer User’s field “Allowed to pay by Credit Card?“ = “Yes“)
# Customers Updates
## Depends on:
### [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6027|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6027|smart-link] 
## A subset of Customers relevant to the GenPads Autoship Program feature will be updated manually via UI or DB to convert them to “Bill To” with the parent set to “IND” rollup.
## The Customer Users related to these Customers that should be able to make GenPads orders paid via Credit Card will be updated manually via UI or import with the next fields:
### “Allowed to pay by Credit Card?“ = “Yes“
### “Allowed to purchase only GenPads?” = “Yes“

column1: [ON HOLD, TECH DEPT] Add a new Shipping Method
column30:
h2. Summary

Support a Shipping Method that calculates the shipping price based on SKU, Minimum Quantity, and Price. 

This Shipping Method will be used at the Checkout to calculate the shipping costs for orders added in the context of GASP.

Note, the first interaction includes a hard-coded shipping method implementation (see [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6052|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6052|smart-link] )

h2. Shipping Rates File Sample

Example of a CSV file that can be imported in Oro with this shipping rates data:

[^custom_shipping_rates.csv]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

h3. Add a new entity “Shipping Rate“

* This record of this entity represents a single shipping rate rule used to calculate a shipping price for a line in the checkout/order.
* The entity has the following fields:
** ID, Primary Key
** Product, type: Relation to Product entity
** Minimum Quantity, type: Integer, Required
** Primary Unit Price, type: Money
* Make the entity should be extendable, to be able to add custom fields from DT namespace bundles if needed
* An index page with a grid should be added to see all records and to run import/export
* Support CSV export from the grid and the index page
** Export data in the format applicable for CSV import operation
* Support CSV import
** Allow updating existing records using fields ID
** Allow updating existing records fields “Product” and “Minimum Quantity” if ID is not specified
** See the example of the import file in “Shipping Rates File Sample“

h3. *Logic of shipping cost calculation for Checkout/Order*

* For each Order/Checkout Line, find a “Matching Shipping Rate” based on the next criteria:
** Line Product = Shipping Rate Product
** Line Quantity in Primary UOM >= Shipping Rate Minimum Quantity
** Shipping Rate Minimum Quantity has the maximum value among all records matching the previous 2 conditions
* Shipping Cost = SUM(Matching Shipping Rate Price *  Line Quantity in Primary UOM)
* Example:
** Line #1: SKU=CG3154-3G, QTY=35
** Line #2: SKU=FG5431-4G, QTY=150
** Line #3: SKU=FG9041-4G, QTY=13
** Shipping Rates are the same as in the file from the section “Shipping Rates File Sample“
** Shipping Cost = 25.00 * 35 + 45.00 * 150 + 197.00 * 13 = 10186.0

h2. Add new Shipping Method integration “Calculated Shipping“

* This integration should calculate shipping based on the Shipping Rates (see logic description in the section above).
* The admin user should be able to configure the Shipping Rule using this Shipping Method.
* On the Shipping Rule page, this shipping method does not require any additional options.
* Configuration of rules in UAT/PROD will be done manually, we do not need to implement any automatic migrations for it).
* Note, the admin user will configure the Shipping Method integration and Shipping Rule in the scope of [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6029|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6029|smart-link] 

h2. Edge Cases

# If “Matching Shipping Rate“ cannot be found for at least one line, the Shipping Cost cannot be calculated:
## The Customer User cannot submit an Order on the Checkout. 
## The Customer User should see an error message on the Checkout “Cannot calculate shipping price for one or more lines. Please contact support.“

h2. Technical Notes

* The implementation should be added in a new bundle in the OroLab namespace decoupled from DT-specific functionality.

h2. User Stories

||*#*||*As a <user type>*||*When/where*||*I want to <goal/objective>*||*So that <benefit/result>*||
|1|Admin|on the Shipping Rates index page|be able to import data for the Shipping Rates in CSV format|this data will be used to calculate shipping cost when “Calculated Shipping“ shipping method is used on the Checkout|
|2|Admin|on the Shipping Rates index page|be able to export data of the Shipping Rates in CSV format|I can open the exported CSV file update the file, and import it again to modify shipping rates|
|3|Admin|on the Shipping Rates index page|I see a grid of all Shipping Rates with filters and sorters|I can quickly find and review the Shipping Rates used in the application|
|4|Admin|on the System / Integrations / Manage Integrations page|I can create a new integration with type “Calculated Shipping“|I can use it in Shipping Rules to allow certain checkouts to select this custom shipping method|
|5|Admin|on the System / Shipping Rules|I can create a new Shipping Rule with the created “Calculated Shipping“ shipping method and configure expression for this rule|this shipping method will be allowed on the Checkout created in the context of GASP use case|
|6|Customer User working in the context of GASP|on the Checkout page|I see a shipping method “Standard Ship“ selected automatically, and shipping price is calculated based on the Shipping Rates|I can create an order and pay for the shipping according to the rates configured by DT|
|7|Customer User working in the context of GASP|on the Checkout page, if some line has no matching shipping rate|I cannot submit the order and see an error message “Cannot calculate shipping price for one or more lines. Please contact support“|I cannot create an order without having a shipping cost calculated properly|

h2. Acceptance Criteria

Next fields should be added to the Customer User entity

*Allowed to pay by Credit Card?*

* description: Can be used in Payment Rules, for allowing certain Customer Users to pay using a Credit Card on the Checkout
* name: dt_allowed_pay_by_cc
* type: boolean
* default value: false
* entity config:
** import/export: enabled
** datagrid: filter/column hidden by default
** import/export: enabled
** form: enabled
** view: enabled
** auditable: yes

*Allowed to purchase only GenPads?*

* description: Can be used in Checkout, for allowing purchase only products with “Global Item Family” = “General Pads“
* name: dt_allowed_purchase_only_genpads
* type: boolean
* default value: false
* entity config: same as for the field “dt_allowed_pay_by_cc“

Technical notes:

* There is no need to add a separate bundle for GenPads functionality at this point. These fields will be used in the expressions of Shipping Rules and Payment Rules to allow/deny a new Shipping Method and a new Payment Method implemented in a separate task. We can add these fields simply in DTSetupBundle.

h2. User Stories

||*#*||*As a <user type>*||*When/where*||*I want to <goal/objective>*||*So that <benefit/result>*||
|1|Back-office User|on the Customer User create/edit page|be able to set values of fields “Allowed to pay by Credit Card?“ and “Allowed to purchase only GenPads?“ to “Yes“|this Customer User will become eligible for GenPads Autoship Program|
|2|Back-office User|on the Customer User view page|see the value of fields “Allowed to pay by Credit Card?“ and “Allowed to purchase only GenPads?“|I can check if the Customer Users eligible for GenPads Autoship Program|
|3|Back-office User|on the Customer User grid page|be able to find all Customer Users with these fields enabled or disabled by using a dedicated filter/column|I can quickly find all the Customer Users eligible for GenPads Autoship Program|
|4|Back-office User|on the Customer User grid page|I can run export of Customer Users from the grid or the page|I can see in the exported file the value of these 2 fields and find Customer Users eligible for GenPads Autoship Program|
|5|Back-office User|on the Customer User grid page|I can run import of Customer Users using a file that contains the values of these 2 fields|I can run mass-update of a batch of Customer Users to make them eligible for GenPads Autoship Program|

We need to add validation for *Stocking Type by Branch* once added in ORO. 

The business needs ORO be able to detect whether a product is Obsolete or Use-Up at the branch and provide a validation error of for whichever branch is selected at the line level  

* *Error properties → Use-Up (Soft)*
** Level: NON-CRITICAL (SOFT)
** Error Code: “line_item_use_up_at_branch“
** Consolidated Message: “Use-Up at Branch”
** Detailed Message: “The requested product is set to Use-Up at the selected Branch”
** Customer Visibility: FALSE
** Bucket: Inventory
* *Error properties → Use-Up (Hard)*
** Level: NON-CRITICAL (HARD)
** Error Code: “line_item_use_up_at_branch_qty_exceeds_avail“
** Consolidated Message: “Use-Up at Branch. QTY Exceeds Avail”
** Detailed Message: “The requested product is set to Use-Up at the selected Branch. QTY exceeds Use-Up inventory”
** Customer Visibility: FALSE
** Bucket: Inventory
* *Error properties → Obsolete*
** Level: CRITICAL (HARD)
** Error Code: “line_item_obsolete_at_branch“
** Consolidated Message: “Obsolete at Branch”
** Detailed Message: “The requested product is Obsolete at the selected Branch”
** Customer Visibility: FALSE
** Bucket: Inventory
