column1: CPOV - ADD Stocking Type by Branch
column30:
The business needs *Stocking Type by Branch* added to the Inventory Availability Read work previously completed before EOY & to the Inventory Availability Table to be created in ORO slated for Sprint 2: [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5811|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5811|smart-link] The fields were already included by branch in the table provided.

||*Field Name*||*Field Alias*||*JDE Table*||*JDE Type*||*JDE Length*||
|Item Branch Stocking Type|IBSTKT|F4102|Character|1|
|Item Master Stocking Type|IMSTKT|F4101|Character|1|

During testing we discovered errors where ORO presented Inventory being available at branch locations where the product had been Obsoleted. We were able to send the order through because ORO currently only validates Stocking Type at the *“*+*Item Master*+*”* Level (Only if product is obsoleted at all branch locations). 

Because the product was not Obsolete at 2 branch locations the *“*+*Stocking Type*+*”* field in ORO on the product page was null, hence ORO did not flag that the product was obsolete at the branch where the inventory appeared. 

* At times the business will obsolete products with inventory still available (This is not common practice but happens)
* It is anticipated that there is still a need to validate whether a product is obsolete at the Item Master Level via the same method
** Update current *“Product is Obsolete”* error (for Item Master validation) to *“Obsolete in Item Master”*





This ticket is a pre-requisite to: [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6026|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6026|smart-link]

column170:
30/Jan/24 1:00 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], please request [~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4]  and [~accountid:712020:278d673b-282a-4090-8ce2-c5157b0d4477] to confirm the next SQL query that ORO will use for collecting inventory availability and stocking type of the product from JDE DB:

{noformat}SELECT productInventoryLevel.LIITM AS id,
       productInventoryLevel.LIMCU AS branch,
       productInventoryLevel.LILOCN AS location,
       productInventoryLevel.LILOTN AS serialNumber,
       productInventoryLevel.LIPQOH AS onHandQuantity,
       productInventoryLevel.LIHCOM AS hardCommittedQuantity,
       productInventoryLevel.LIPCOM AS softCommittedQuantity,
       productInventoryLevel.LIFCOM AS futureCommittedQuantity,
       productInventoryLevel.LIPBCK AS backorderQuantity,
       productInventoryLevel.LILOTS AS lotStatus,
       productBranchDetails.IBLITM AS productSKU,
       productBranchDetails.IBSTKT AS branchLevelStockingType,
       productMasterDetails.IMSTKT AS masterLevelStockingType
FROM CRPDTA.F41021 productInventoryLevel 
    INNER JOIN CRPDTA.F4102 productBranchDetails ON productInventoryLevel.LIITM = productBranchDetails.IBITM AND productInventoryLevel.LIMCU = productBranchDetails.IBMCU
    LEFT JOIN CRPDTA.F4101 productMasterDetails ON productInventoryLevel.LIITM = productMasterDetails.IMITM
WHERE productBranchDetails.IBLITM = 'WS-1' AND productInventoryLevel.LILOTS = ''
ORDER BY productInventoryLevel.LIMCU ASC{noformat}

The columns in the select query “branchLevelStockingType“ and “masterLevelStockingType“ will be used in ORO to calculate the respecting stocking type of the product on the branch and master levels.

We are assuming that this SQL is correct for the use case of getting inventory levels and stocking type for product “WS-1“. The new functionality in ORO will be using this kind of SQL to build the logic. If the SQL has some issues, please let us know, and we will make the necessary changes.

column166:
22/Jan/24 10:31 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;*Pad Fulfillment Logic*

+Details on Nika’s Hot Fix ticket for this Issue+

Current issue with the default branch being set on the line level causing pad lines to be cancelled in JDE. The pads are marked obsolete in the branches (ex: 11500) so the order processes, but the pads are removed from the order.

Hotfix to update the Oro to JDE flow that maps to the F47012 (Order Detail table) and set the branch value to NULL if it is a pad line.

# Create a mapplet with the branch logic to be easily removable once invetory allocation is full implemented in Oro

# Run a rule set to see if sub-section (IMSRP2) is in the list of pad sub-sections (List Below)
# If subsection is in the list
## True - Set branch (dt_cost_center_id) to NULL
## False - Do Nothing

* 103

*Subject:* RE: JDE Manufacturing Journal Entry Posting errors

 

Hi Carnell,

 

I have identified the issue with part of the items listed below.

Each line that has G/L Account Number indicated and the business unit is ‘10338’, the error is being caused because business unit 10338 is marked as ‘Non-Posting’ (Does Not Allow Entries)

And the ‘Subledger Inactive field is marked.  Both settings on this business unit need to be revised in order for manufacturing accounting to be allowed to post entries to the G/L accounts.

*Subject:* RE: JDE Manufacturing Journal Entry Posting errors

 

Thank you [@Jackie Reynolds|mailto:JReynolds@diversitech.com] for the details. If I was to run the MFG close jobs in proof mode only, would I be able to identify the WO errors throughout the month. I’m thinking if I run these Jobs weekly these errors can be caught sooner.

 

The jobs I’m referencing are the 3 Proof jobs below.

 



 

|*Carnell Sanders​​​​*
[+www.diversitech.com+|https://www.diversitech.com/]
[csanders@diversitech.com|mailto:csanders@diversitech.com]|
| |

 

*From:* Jackie Reynolds <[JReynolds@diversitech.com|mailto:JReynolds@diversitech.com]> 
*Sent:* Monday, January 15, 2024 2:56 PM
*To:* Carnell Sanders <[csanders@diversitech.com|mailto:csanders@diversitech.com]>
*Cc:* Amanda Little <[ALittle@diversitech.com|mailto:ALittle@diversitech.com]>
*Subject:* RE: JDE Manufacturing Journal Entry Posting errors

 

Hi Carnell,

 

You can identify the orders that have issues by either reviewing the output report when running manufacturing accounting or you can look in the work center for the order numbers that are in error.

 

When viewing the Manufacturing Accounting Report that is created as output when running R31802A, you will want to look for transaction lines that do not have G/L Account Numbers, as shown below.

This is not always feasible though because the Manufacturing Accounting Journal entries Report can be very lengthy and going through it manually can be tedious at best. 

 



 

Alternatively, you can review your Work Center for errors that were detected when the job was generated.  Below, the work center

message for the generation of R31802A shows all of the work order numbers that are in error.  You can open up the carots for each order to view the errors.

Sometimes the error messages are helpful and very detailed, sometimes they are not so detailed or helpful.   

 



 

I used the Shop Floor Workbench to view each order.   I was not able to tell what the issue was on each order initially, so I ended up locating a recent order for the same item number as the order that is in error.

 



 

Inquire on the order, select the row and view the WO Routing.  This is where I found orders that had processed through successfully, had a value of ‘D1’ on the

line for the outside processing.  The orders that were in error, did not have the value of ‘D1’ in the Cost Type field. 

 



 

I compared other components of the work order to orders that processed successfully and could not find anything.  After updating the Cost Type field with D1,

I ran R31802A again in PY and the only errors remaining were on the inventory completion, IC, transactions.  One item that can prevent inventory completions from being

Successful is when inventory is not available.  So I took an order and reviewed the availability of the items on the parts list.

 

Select the row for the work order and select ‘WO Parts List’ from the menu.

 



 

Select the row for the item to be viewed.  Click on Row and select ‘Item Availability’ from the drop-down list.

 



 

The availability for the item will be shown. Below, there is not inventory available to backflush the order.  Some items will have a location defined.

You will be able to see the availability by location.  That is where you can see if a different location has availability that will allow the order to backflush and

complete.

 



 

Let me know if you would like to hope on a call to review and we can walk through it.

 

Kind Regards,

 

|*Jackie Reynolds​​​​*
Consultant ‑ JDE
[+www.diversitech.com+|https://www.diversitech.com/]
[JReynolds@diversitech.com|mailto:JReynolds@diversitech.com]|

*Subject:* RE: JDE Manufacturing Journal Entry Posting errors

 

Hi Carnell,

 

I spend some additional time reviewing the work orders that are not processing through completions for manufacturing accounting. 

 

It appears there are a couple of issues involved in the errors being received. 

#  There are several orders that are missing the ‘D1’ outside processing designation on the work order routing.   Below is an example of one of the orders that is not updating.  I went through the list of orders that are not processing through sales update and updated this field to ‘D1’ where required.
# Inventory is either not available to issue material for the work order or it is not available in the location specified on the work order routing.  In some instances, where a location is specified, I suspect that going into the work order routing and changing the  location to one that has inventory available, will resolve the issue. 

 



 

Below are the orders that are held up with the inventory issue.  I looked at a random sampling from the list and all reviewed have availability issues.

column30: Original Invoice Number is currently populating the Credit Memo number instead of the Invoice Number the credit it should be applied to.

h1. Acceptance Criteria

h2. Payment Method Setup

* Oro should support new integration with the type “Collect Payment“ that will be used for collecting credit card information in Decisions
** The integration settings should contain the following fields:
*** Decisions Flow ID
This value is passed to the URL, where the user is redirected to enter a credit card after checkout.
For example [https://diversitechprod.decisions.com/Primary/H/?FlowId=%VALUE_OF_THIS_FIELD%|https://diversitechprod.decisions.com/Primary/H/?FlowId=%VALUE_OF_THIS_FIELD%]
*** Allowed Credit Card Types
The selected credit card types are displayed on the checkout if this payment method is selected.
*** Test Mode
This flag impacts the base URL, where the user will be redirected after checkout when this payment method is selected.
Base URL depending on the value of this field:
Test Mode is On: {{https://diversitechuat.decisions.com/Primary/H/}}
Test Mode is Off: {{https://diversitechprod.decisions.com/Primary/H/}}
** This payment method will work with Decisions to collect Credit Card information on the Checkout, it will not process the payment during checkout.
* The Credit Card information should not be saved in Oro or accessed from Oro. 
** Only the Decisions system will be used to enter/view credit card information.

h2. Related Order Internal Statuses

* Payment In Progress (payment_in_progress)
** This is a new status that should be added
** Order created on checkout when credit card payment method was selected, but the credit card information was not entered in Decisions yet.
** In most cases, this status for the order will be effective for several minutes while the user is entering credit card information in Decisions.
** Some orders may stuck in this status, for example:
*** The user didn’t enter credit card information in Decisions, and ORO’s success/error callback URL was not executed.
*** The user entered credit card information in Decisions, but ORO’s success/error URL was not executed due to some failure.
* Review AR (review_ar)
** This is a new status that should be added
** Order created on checkout when credit card payment method was selected, credit card information was entered in Decisions, ORO’s success callback URL was executed
* Cancelled (cancelled)
** Order created on checkout when credit card payment method was selected, Decisions executed ORO’s error callback URL was executed because of some error

h2. Decisions Redirect URL

Upon submitting an order on checkout, the user is redirected to the Decisions payment form. 

Example of redirect URL:

{{https://diversitechdev.decisions.com/Primary/H/?FlowId=123456&OroOrderId=915381&OroErrorUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fdiv50.local%2Fpayment%2Fcallback%2Ferror%2Fb3cb57d3-1739-4aa2-b469-78b91aaf3d9f&OroSuccessUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fdiv50.local%2Fpayment%2Fcallback%2Freturn%2Fb3cb57d3-1739-4aa2-b469-78b91aaf3d9f}}

The redirect URL consists of the following components:

* Base URL
** Value for PROD - {{https://diversitechprod.decisions.com/Primary/H/}}
** Value for UAT - {{https://diversitechuat.decisions.com/Primary/H/}}
* FlowId
** ID of flow in Decisions, please provide this value for PROD and DEV.
** Value for PROD - (?) TBD Should be provided by Nika
** Value for UAT - (?) TBD Should be provided by Nika
* OroOrderId=915381
** ID of order in ORO
* OroErrorUrl
** This is a URL where Decisions should redirect the user on error/failure of collecting payment method.
** The URL will lead to {{/payment/callback/error}} route in the Oro PROD/UAT application. Sample value:
{noformat}https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/payment/callback/error/b3cb57d3-1739-4aa2-b469-78b91aaf3d9f{noformat}
* OroSuccessUrl
** This is a URL where Decisions should redirect the user on the success of collecting payment method.
** The URL will lead to {{/payment/callback/error}} route in the Oro PROD/UAT application. Sample value:
{noformat}https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/payment/callback/return/b3cb57d3-1739-4aa2-b469-78b91aaf3d9f{noformat}

Notes:

* OroSuccessUrl and OroErrorUrl contain an access identifier of payment transition in ORO. Oro will create a new payment transition whenever the user clicks on the Submit button on checkout.
* Since users can submit checkout multiple times, the URL with the same OroOrderId and different OroErrorUrl/OroSuccessUrl can be called multiple times

h2. Use Cases

h3. 1. Success Checkout Payment Using Decisions

# Customer User submits checkout with the Collect Payment (Credit Card) payment method selected
## ORO creates a new order with the internal status “Payment In Progress“
## ORO creates a new payment transaction for the payment method
# ORO redirects the Customer User Decisions payment form via the Decisions Redirect URL
## Decisions should check the given order via API to ensure that it has internal status = “Payment In Progress“. If the internal status is different (e.g. Approved, Review AR, Cancelled, etc), it is possible that this order was already processed, and the application should show an error to the user
# Customer User enters the credit card information and submits the payment form
# Decisions redirects the Customer User to ORO using OroSuccessUrl
## ORO updates the order’s internal status to “Review AR”
# Customer User sees the finish checkout page with a link to review the created order
# DT user opens Decisions and finds payment record created on step 3
## Decisions load order information via API to show it to the user, including Total, Billing Address, Internal Status
## At this step, Decisions should validate that Internal Status equals “Review AR“, otherwise it should prevent the user from processing the payment to avoid incorrect charges
# DT user reviews payment/order information, processes the payment manually using POS, and confirms it in Decisions
# Decisions update order via API to set the internal status to Approved
## After this step, the Informatica API client will be able to transfer such an order to JDE

h3. 2. Failed Checkout Payment Using Decisions

# Customer User submits checkout with the Collect Payment (Credit Card) payment method selected
## ORO creates a new order with the internal status “Payment In Progress“
## ORO creates a new payment transaction for the payment method
# ORO redirects the Customer User Decisions payment form via the Decisions Redirect URL
# Customer User is unable to enter valid credit card information or decided to cancel
# Decisions redirects the Customer User to ORO using OroErrorrUrl
## ORO updates the order’s internal status to “Cancelled”
# Customer User sees the finish checkout page with a message that the order was canceled
## (?) TBD Request text for the page that is shown if the order was canceled

h3. 3. Checkout Payment Using Decisions Stuck In Progress

# Customer User submits checkout with the Collect Payment (Credit Card) payment method selected
## ORO creates a new order with the internal status “Payment In Progress“
## ORO creates a new payment transaction for the payment method
# ORO redirects the Customer User Decisions payment form via the Decisions Redirect URL
# Some issue happens, and ORO’s success/error callback is never executed. Example of scenarios when it could happen:
## Customer User closed the browser tab with the Decisions payment form and never submitted it
## Decisions was not able to call the success/error callback URL due to some failure
## The Internet connection was not working and the success/error callback URL was never executed
# Customer User opens checkout again
## Error message is shown “We were unable to process your payment. Please verify your payment information and try again, or try another payment method.“ (standard Oro behavior)
## It is not possible to submit the checkout again

h1. Exclusions

The next items of the scope will be implemented in separate tasks:

* Add a 3.5% handling charge. See [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6114|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6114|smart-link] 
* Add new internal statuses “Payment In Progress“ and “Review AR“ and apply these statuses to the order during checkout. See [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6115|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6115|smart-link]

column167:
08/Jan/24 12:47 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Data will need to be passed to Decisions for AR process

* Some sort of Oro ID, be it the shopping cart ID or the order ID, is to be passed in integration so Decisions can look up information about the order to display in approval form. 
** If the order is created before the CC payment data is entered, it is preferred to use that ID as the API is already exposed and can be leveraged by Decisions. If not, we’ll need to discuss the ID that will be used and the API work needed. 
* Customer to be redirected to enter CC payment information which will be a Decisions form.
* Decisions to validate it’s a valid CC number (as much as possible) and redirect the customer back to Oro with either a success page or error page if some sort of failure occurs on payment. 
** Ex: Some sort of processing failure upon submission would let the customer know to try again or enter a different payment option. 
** Will need Redirect URLs for both success and failure for Decisions workflow
* Once submitted, Decisions will then pull information about the customer and order along with the encrypted CC data and assign it to AR for approval. Need to discuss whether this will be a group of AR users or a specific user. 
* AR to process payment and either select an accepted or declined option. 
** If payment is not collected, should AR be required to submit a declined reason? 
** Order should be cancelled upon decline
** Order should be Approved upon successful processing. 
* Should log who approved which orders in Decisions. 
* Once an order is completed processing, the encrypted CC record should be purged from Decisions.

should be provided by you. I assume it will be some URL in {{https://diversitechprod.decisions.com/Primary/H/}} for PROD and {{https://diversitechdev.decisions.com/Primary/H/}} for DEV. Please provide the base URL for PROD and DEV

column1: DTC P4 - Build end of month process for Demand History
column30:
Currently the way the P4 process builds demand history, is that it pulls from teh proforma sales table in the DataWarehouse db. The problem is though that this table does not get updated until 7:30 am with yesterdays' data. The P4 import process has to start before 4 am to make sure it completes before the start of the day.

So at the end of the month, we will need a process that will wait until after the proforma db has been updated with the new data.

So, I will wait for day after the last day of the month to run a delayed import of all P4 import files. This will of course cause the P4 site to be off-line until the import process has completed.
column166: 29/Dec/23 1:52 PM;6189567bcc2d7c00715af2fd;Need to add a process that sends out a scheduled email to the group hte day before alerting the team that P4 will be unaccessible in the morning until the calcs job completes.
column167: 04/Jan/24 8:37 AM;6189567bcc2d7c00715af2fd;Reached out to INf-support for help with how to handle a schedule that runs every day of the month except the first. Received reply back with some potential logic. I will attempt to implement this logic.
column168:
05/Jan/24 1:12 PM;6189567bcc2d7c00715af2fd;Completed building the end of the month demand history alternate process. I modified the existing taskflow by adding a decision that checks if the day part of the date = 01. If it does NOT then the task flow runs like normal. If it does = 01 then the FTP file import process does not happen but instead will happen in the new taskflow I built. 

The new taskflow is on a schedule to only run the 1st day of the month @ 7:55am. It will run a demand history import after the proforma sales db table is updated.

*From:* Mike Wilson<[mike.wilson@p4tech.com|mailto:mike.wilson@p4tech.com]>
*To:* Mark Esbrook<[mesbrook@diversitech.com|mailto:mesbrook@diversitech.com]> 
*Subject:* Data Errors
*Sent:* {color:#808080}December 06, 2023, 14:01 PM, -05:00{color}


*_**Caution: External Sender**_*

Mark,

Tens of thousands of errors and warnings are generated each day due to bad data. Below you can see the log sizes for each day. You did not send data on Sunday, so you can see the log size difference. About 8 MB of the log contents are error/warning entries.

I attached yesterday’s log to this email, zipped due to size. Please review the log to identify the bad data being sent every day, and then please look into how to prevent it from being sent – or send the missing prerequisites so the data is no longer bad.

Statistics:

60,199 lines total

49,039 lines of data errors/warnings (lines begin with Warn)

10,323 lines of ‘could not be found’

37,369 lines of ‘not found’

1,380 lines of ‘not a valid’

28 lines of ‘do not have unique’

46 lines of ‘less than zero’

21,033 lines under ‘DATA ERROR. The following SKUs are assigned to

a Multi-Echelon Supplier, but the ME Parent SKU is Missing’

These numbers don’t add up exactly, so there must be some unique warnings I didn’t find.

*Michael Wilson*

Vice President of Development

[P4 Technologies, LLC|https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.p4tech.com%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cmesbrook%40diversitech.com%7C44818eaafbf94ad7a16608dbf68d9568%7C98e2a9e3e8af4bb0829ff1fc15b4e9db%7C0%7C0%7C638374860848168560%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fYfdy1YeH2hSF8tdylUPVJ90XwbrVabZ11EXKe8T6XY%3D&reserved=0]

column166:
20/Dec/23 1:13 PM;6189567bcc2d7c00715af2fd;First started with the 49,039 lines of data errors/warnings (lines begin with Warn)

Found instances in the Relationships Import where the supplier is of type TC (Transportation Carrier) or E (Employee) or ZZZ (inactive customer)

So I updated the RElationship import to only include supplier with type ('v', 'IV', 'F','IC', 'C')

column167:
20/Dec/23 4:30 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4], you can insert those records to the DB  manually. It is required to run reindex after that. Here is an SSH command to run in CLI:

{noformat}orocloud-cli app:console "oro:search:reindex DT\\Bundle\\EntityBundle\\Entity\\RepCode"{noformat}

The alternative and correct option is to make those new rep codes appear in the rep_code file that is transferred from JDE to ORO via FTP. Here is an example of the most recent file sent to ORO today:

[^P_rep_code_20231220T030125Z.csv]

Any new Rep Code in this file will be imported and added to the request table, no need to run a search index in this case.

Please note, the suggested approach is how it was initially designed when we need to create/update Rep Codes in Oro from JDE. I do not understand, why these Rep Codes should be added manually via SQL.

*From:* Mary Sullivan-Reed <[MSullivan@diversitech.com|mailto:MSullivan@diversitech.com]> 
*Sent:* Wednesday, December 13, 2023 9:18 AM

*Subject:* FW: FYI pad program

 

Good morning Nika,

 

Per the below the ship date changes to the day after the order date once it is printed. Those are the dates on the pick ticket.

The “Original Promise Date” stays the same in JDE. Is that the column you are pulling for Decisions?

2971736 ( order date:  12/6) that is on L 89039:  Approved and printed it this morning.

Original ship by:  12/13 and deliver by:  12/20

Now since I approved and printed:  ship by is:  12/7 and deliver by 12/7.

----

*From:* Renee Reagan <[RReagan@diversitech.com|mailto:RReagan@diversitech.com]> 
*Sent:* Wednesday, December 13, 2023 8:57 AM
*To:* Mary Sullivan-Reed <[MSullivan@diversitech.com|mailto:MSullivan@diversitech.com]>
*Subject:* FYI pad program

 

Eloise was telling me that during yesterday’s call about the pad program.

Gabe brought up how the ship dates change when approving and printing loads.



I have had this issue for months now and told help desk about it.

Original ship by:  12/13 and deliver by:  12/20

Now since I approved and printed:  ship by is:  12/7 and deliver by 12/7.
column166:
13/Dec/23 11:46 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Confirmed with [~accountid:712020:278d673b-282a-4090-8ce2-c5157b0d4477] , the PPDJ is the field being updated and causing issues. This field should be editable but not automatically updated when the Actual shipment is set. (Pending validation). P3 needs to use the PPDJ in cases where a future order is updated before processing. 

Ex: 

* Order placed 3 months in advance, 
* Rep calls the customer 45 days before it’s scheduled for delivery to confirm the lines and dates. 
* Customer changes when they want it. 
* Order is updated in JDE to reflect the new date (which is still > 30 days out
* Decisions pulls in the updated promised date and modifies the report to reflect the change

From the screenshot, the field highlighted (Original Promised) is the original promised Delivery Date OPDJ which is not editable and not being updated. 

Note: Can use the OPDJ to track a customer changed the order, which was an enhancement requested.

* Adding field to the DB structure and column to the table

* Adding Field to the Form
* Adding field to the Report
* Likely some KPI in the Dashboard

Two more fields added for mapping validation:

 

|*Field*|*JDE Field Alias*|*Oro Field*|*Example Oro Data*|*EDI Text file field*|

|Customer PO Unit Price|URAT|dt_original_price|14.7700|D15|

column30:
*Objective:* Genpads customers will need to be onboarded in mass on ORO Portal and assign as specific ROLE to purchase via Credit Card. CC should be received via form, encrypted and send to AR to process CC. 
Order should push to JDE for Direct Ship. These orders would be SD or Direct Ship order types?

*Details:*

# Add a buy now button on the [Grillpads.com|http://Grillpads.com] website
# set up the customers as prepaid customers in JDE and add them to the portal as credit card customers
# add the price list for the pads to those customers as Tom defines
# add a credit card input ability on checkout (states confirmation will be emailed to customer)
# add a processing fee of 3% to the checkout
# Temporarily until full CC processor implemented – the payment information will go with the notes to JDE for the order
# Finance will process the order 
# Once processed the order will ship 

 

Questions:

              How do we identify these customers or do we offer the CC option for all prepaid customers?

              We’ll need the list of skus for the portal 

              Do we show these customers only the genpads or do we open the catalog and if so what price lists for non-genpads
column166:
02/Jan/24 11:41 AM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;[^Copy of GENERAC_ALL CUSTOMERS.xlsx]

Use DealerID as NEW field in ORO. 
Add data to existing customers from list (DT will add JDE ID column to spreadsheet)

Customers from list can submit orders for ONLY Genpad skus in Portal. Unique identifier is dealerID. Do we set this by Customer User ROLE?

USER ACTION: When on portal, Customer goes through regular cart checkout process with EXCEPTION, customer can enter Credit Card information to be processed by DT. 

Integration ACTION: These orders must be held based on a flag of some sort, then DT accounting processes payment and then approves or disables flag to allow over to be pushed to JDE via API (Informatica) as normal SO order. 

On JDE side, DealerID / JDEID for these customers are set to prepaid and will process without Invoice notification. 

Part 1

!image-20240102-163304.png|width=1369,height=1083!

Part 2


!image-20240102-163835.png|width=1376,height=870!

Part 3
CC payment information can be in minimal amount of fields. 
Order status needs to be set as “REVIEW-AR”
Once AR processes order, they should “APPROVE”
Order gets processed to JDE.
column167:
02/Jan/24 1:58 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] 

|Q1: From the requirements:
{quote}Genpads customers will need to be onboarded in mass on ORO Portal and assign as specific ROLE to purchase via Credit Card. CC should be received via form, encrypted and send to AR to process CC. {quote}
What is “AR“?
*A: accounts receivable*
Oro allows payment method using Payment Method Rules (see [https://doc.oroinc.com/user/back-office/system/shipping-rules/expression-lang/#payment-shipping-expression-lang|https://doc.oroinc.com/user/back-office/system/shipping-rules/expression-lang/#payment-shipping-expression-lang|smart-link] ). The rule’s expression does not support checking the role out of the box. Did you consider using some attribute of Customer or Customer User to control access to CC payment method on the checkout?
*A: Payment terms for customer ShipTos will be changed in ORO to payment on delivery. So Payment term will not be removed from UI.* 
It is not clear why it won’t be removed from UI. Need to discuss.
*A: The customers will have a payment term in JDE called “payme on deliverynt”.  Yes lets discuss* 
On the checkout page, user can select Payment Method:
!image-20240103-182105.png|width=1846,height=897!
Now, Payment Terms payment method can be selected. In this implementation, we will add another custom Payment Method that will allow collecting Credit Card information using Decisions. So on the UI, technically we will not show old Payment Terms payment methods. Please confirm.
*A: CONFIRMED*|
|Q2: From the requirements:
{quote}1. Add a buy now button on the [Grillpads.com|http://Grillpads.com] website{quote}
It is not clear, how this scope is related to Oro.
*A: DT side will point to Portal login / registration page on B2B*|
|Q3: From the requirements:
{quote}2. set up the customers as prepaid customers in JDE and add them to the portal as credit card customers

3. add the price list for the pads to those customers as Tom defines{quote}
Confirm that this is not the scope outside of Oro.
*A: Confirmed this is in scope of DiversiTech only*
Confirm that JDE will return correct pricing for these customers via API.
*A: Confirmed*
Confirm that all these customers will be created in JDE and in ORO and share same JDE ID.
*A: Customers already exist in JDE and ORO as ShipTos*|
|Q4: How orders will be transferred to JDE? Using FTP or using API?
*A: API via Informatica flow for SO*
Do we need to use SD order type for such orders?
*A: SO order types*
Are there any other differences between such order and regular checkout orders besides order type and credit card payment method?
*A: No*
We identified the next differences on the call:
* Shipping will require custom calculation, based on volume.
* Shipping cost will be added using a separate line to the order, same as for quick ship orders *(FRT, line type: N)*
* The minimum order amount charge should be added in the same way as for regular orders.
* A 3% convenience fee for using a credit card will be added on top of the order total using a separate line to the order *(line name: HANDLING CHARGE, line type: N)*
* Notice that free freight charge should be hidden (*because customer user will see the shipping cost on the checkout).*
* Freight Handling Code should be provided with some specific value (FRT)
* After creating on the checkout, the Order should be moved to the special internal status “Review AR“. Back-office user will process the payment manually, and move the order to the next status, which can be picked up by order export integration (Informatica API client or FTP).
* Other limitations? (No other limitations per Tom Woolridge (Business user)|
|Q5: From the requirements:
{quote}4. add a credit card input ability on checkout (states confirmation will be emailed to customer){quote}
What payment method do you want to use? List of payment methods supported out of the box are available in [https://doc.oroinc.com/user/concept-guides/administration/payment-configuration/|https://doc.oroinc.com/user/concept-guides/administration/payment-configuration/|smart-link] .
Please note, adding a custom payment method on the checkout is a task with large scope of work.
*A: Payment Method will be processed manually at DiversiTech. As discussed, we can embed Decisions form to take in CC info.*|
|Q6: From requirements:
{quote}5. add a processing fee of 3% to the checkout{quote}
Do we need to add this fee on Oro side? 
Should it be added as a “Fee Line Item”? What should be the name and type of this line (C, CF, CN, D, F, M, N, P, PF, S)?
*A: Yes calculate and ADD 3% fee on ORO side. Fee Line Item “HANDLING CHARGE,N”*|
|Q7: From the requirements:
{quote}Temporarily until full CC processor implemented – the payment information will go with the notes to JDE for the order{quote}
How credit card information can be passed in order notes? Do you mean expose credit card number, holder name, CVS, expiration date in API/FTP?
*A: As discussed, to avoid security risk, we would consider using an embedded form for holding CC info. Will need a temporary order ID until order is submitted to match up against*|
|Q8: What are the limitations for these customers on the website? For example, it is mentioned in the requirements:
{quote}Do we show these customers only the genpads or do we open the catalog and if so what price lists for non-genpads{quote}
*A: Only the Genpads are shown based on the product family “Generator Pads”.* 
We identified the next limitations/customizations on the call :
* Users should see only genpad products on the website.
* Users cannot complete checkout if non-genpad product is added to the checkout for some reason.
* Users should not be able to see/use quick ship orders functionality.
Other limitations? (add more relevant info if needed) *No other limitations*|
|Q9: How to identify GenPads products? For example, there is a product family “Generator Pads“ (40 products), and the attribute "Global Item Family" = “Generator Pads" (48 products). There should be only one criterion for identification.
*A: We need to use only 7 SKUs from the provided file:* 
# CG3154-3G
# FG5431-3G2
# FG5431-3G
# FG5431-4G
# FG9041-4G
# FG8341-4G
# FG7037-4G|
|Q10: Is it expected to make the implementation flexible to be able to adapt it for future similar use cases? In other words, how likely is it that business will request to implement a similar feature for another group of products and another group of customers?
*A: Not likely in this stop gap process. for future project of integrating extension with ability to pay online.*|
|Q11: Let’s assume that some Customer User needs to buy GenPads using CC. Is it possible that the same Customer User, in another moment, needs to buy something else using the currently implemented checkout using payment terms?  
*A: YES and not covered in this use case. If they wish to purchase other products, they must go through a distributor or establish a credit process themselves and become a default Customer type.*|
|Q12: Need to make a key decision, should we implement a separate website for GenPads, or keep using the same B2B website?
Consider that portal has to support 2 different UX modes:
* Reglar Mode
** The current existing UX in [b2b.diversitech.com|http://b2b.diversitech.com]
** Allows to see/purchase any product
** Allow only payment terms payment method (CC payment method not supported)
** Shipping cost is not included on checkout.
* GenPads Mode
** Allows to see/purchase only GenPads products
** Allows only CC payment method
** Shows Shipping Calculation on checkout
** Pros/cons are below for single or two websites:
*Option 1. Use existing B2B website (*[*b2b.diversitech.com*|http://b2b.diversitech.com]*)*
More suitable for implementation of basic logic to implement GenPads Mode with minimum differences from Regular Mode:
* The same website supports Reglar Mode and GenPads Mode.
* Depending on the current mode, the web-page shows/hide UI/functionality related to GenPads Mode.
* The mode is selected based on some state taken from the current session. For example, from a special attribute flag that is set in the Customer User to activate GenPads Mode.
pros:
* Development and maintenance is simpler: If GenPads Mode and Regular Mode share the most of the portal functionality, it is simpler to add customizations in few places to active/deactive features related to GenPads Mode in the context of a single website.
* Lower operational cost: 1 website is simpler to maintain.
cons:
* If GenPads Mode will evolve and become significantly different from Regular Mode, it may be more efficient to transit to the approach with a separate website.
* Customer Users cannot access both GenPads Mode and Reglar Mode. This would be possible only if admin will switch the flag in the Customer User.
* Less convenient to use native ORO features to configure for Reglar Mode and GenPads Mode, more customizations could be required.
*Option 2. Add new website (*[*e.g.genpads.diversitech.com*|http://e.g.genpads.diversitech.com]*)*
More suitable for implementation if the functionality of the portal in GenPads Mode should have significant differences comparing to Reglar Mode:
* There is a separate website that provides only GenPads products.
* This website supports additional features related to GenPads Mode (CC payment method, products filtering, disab;le Quick Ship, etc.).
* Customer Users can login to both websites depending on their needs and will get a different user experience specific to each website.
pros:
* More extendable and flexible solution, suitable if the GenPads portal will evolve with adding a lot of additional features specific only to GenPads website.
* Customer Users can access 2 portals with 2 different UX modes at the same time.
* Higher convenience to use native ORO features to configure each website (B2B and GenPads) differently for various business use cases.
cons:
* Higher development and operational cost to maintain 2 websites.
* May require more development time for initial implementation.
*A: Option 1*|
|Q13: How the logic of shipping cost should work?
We have the next example in Quick Ship order checkout:
!image-20240103-181657.png|width=1846,height=897!
The cost is calculated based on the weight of lines added in the checkout, and the cost is displayed to the Customer User.
Do we need to make the same kind of UX for the GenPads Mode?
What is the formula of shipping cost calculation (please provide detailed info which product attributes are involved in the calculation)?
A: Details provided, see requirements in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6028|smart-link]|
|Q14: Do you have a case when the same Customer User should be able to purchase GenPads at this moment, but moment later they need to access the main b2b website functionality to purchase something else?
A: No (based on discussion on a meeting on 01/04/2024).|
|Q15: What should be the name of the shipping method for GASP on the checkout page? For example, for Quick Ship, the method name on the UI is “Overnight“:
!image-20240104-071802.png|width=1846,height=581!
A: Standard Ship|
|Q16: We discussed that 3% fee will be added using line item “HANDLING CHARGE“ with type “N“.
What should be the name and type of of the line that will represent shipping cost?
A: Ship Costs|
|Q17: What should be the freight handling code of the GASP order created on the checkout? (FP, EXW, C, PP, MPP, PC, PPP, PFP, UC, UFP, UPP)
A: PP|

06/Feb/24 3:33 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], 

{quote}“Payment has not been processed. If you have already submitted this order and believe it is a mistake, please contact us for assistance. Otherwise, please click on "Submit" to proceed with the order submission.”{quote}

This error happens when the user doesn’t finish the payment step in Decisions. Here are the steps to reproduce:

# Log in as a Customer User who can purchase only GenPad products
# Ensure that the cart has no existing not finished checkout
# Add GenPad items to the Cart
# Click Create Order from the Cart
## A new checkout will be created and opened
# Complete checkout and redirect to payment
## When the user is redirected to the payment form:
### Checkout is updated with the status “payment_in_progress“
### New order is created in status “payment_in_progress“
# Do not complete the payment in Decisions, close the browser tab/window
# Go back to ORO in the browser, open Cart, and click Create Order
# This will open the same checkout entity that was created in step #4
## This checkout still has the status “payment_in_progress“, because the payment was not finished on steps 5 and 6
# The checkout sees that it has status “payment_in_progress“ and shows error message: “Payment has not been processed…“
# The customer user cannot submit the checkout

Please note, this use case is described in Case 3 in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-6012|smart-link]  - 

!image-20240206-203341.png|width=1115,height=408!

column1: Questions / Provide instructions how Oro can read confirmation from JDE DB when order was committed to JDE
column30:
The use case is next:

# CSR creates Order in ORO
# CSR approves Order
# Informatica transfers Orders to JDE
# JDE commits the Order
## Data in the inventory table is decremented (JDE_CRP.CRPDTA.f41021) to fulfill the lines of the Order
# ORO needs to detect this change in step 5, to show the Product’s availability correctly
## The related task to implement this feature[https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5823|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5823|smart-link] 
## The check can be done via the next SQL:
### {{SELECT 1 FROM PRODDTA.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 is not null and trim(SYEXVAR12) = '%ORO_ORDER_ID%' and SYDOCO > 0;}}
### Where:
###*  F47011 - Order table in JDE
###* SYEXVAR12 -  Column that represents ORO Order ID
###* SYDOCO - Column that represents JDE Order Number
###* %ORO_ORDER_ID% -  Value of ORO Order ID to check
###* SYDOCO > 0 - condition needed to detect the case when inventory data was allocated for the Orde

A more detailed example of flow:

# The order created in ORO with line WS-1 (100 EA)
## Status set to Review
## Step set to Unassigned
# CSR requested approval for the Order
## Step updated to Ready For Approval
## Order Inventory Reservation created WS -1 (100 EA) 
# CSR approved Order in ORO
## Step updated to Approved
# Informatica transfers the Order to JDE
## Informatica pulls the approved Order from ORO using the API
## Informatica creates the Order in JDE table F47011 with the next data:
### SYEXVAR12 =  %ORO_ORDER_ID%
### SYDOCO = 0
## Informatica updates the ORO Order status using the API
### Status updated to Pending
# ORO runs SQL to check if the Order has allocated inventory:
## {{SELECT 1 FROM PRODDTA.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 is not null and trim(SYEXVAR12) = '%ORO_ORDER_ID%' and SYDOCO > 0;}}
## The query returns no result since the order has not been processed yet in  JDE
## ORO preserves information about Order Inventory Reservation created on step “2.b”
# JDE processes the Order in F47011 and allocates inventory data in {{f41021}}; This includes updating {{SYDOCO}} to some real non-zero value that represents JDE Order Number
# ORO runs SQL to check if the Order has allocated inventory:
## {{SELECT 1 FROM PRODDTA.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 is not null and trim(SYEXVAR12) = '%ORO_ORDER_ID%' and SYDOCO > 0;}}
## The query returns non empty result
## ORO removes information about Order Inventory Reservation created on step “2.b”
column166:

Join Query,
select from JdeDbsT02.JDE_CRP.CRPDTA.f41021
inner join JdeDbsT02.JDE_CRP.CRPDTA.f4102  on ibitm=liitm and ibmcu=LIMCU

columns
LIHCOM	Quantity - Hard Committed
LIPCOM	Quantity Soft Committed

cc: [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1]
column169:
11/Dec/23 3:42 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4], [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837],

# The query that ORO will use should somehow filter data by ID of the Order in ORO.
# We did not plan to track the state of order commitment on the line level (at least in the 1st iteration that we plan to deliver to UAT by December 22nd).
column170:
11/Dec/23 3:46 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;ORO needs to run SQL that can be rephrased like this:

{noformat}SELECT order_inventory_committed_state 
FROM some_table
JOIN some_tables
WHERE ​jde_order_table.ORO_ID = %ORO_ORDER_ID%{noformat}

where {{order_inventory_committed_state}} can be used to find out was the order committed to JDE and whether inventory was allocated or not.

We initially thought that the Informatica API client would send ORO push notifications. This logic has the same kind of use case:

* Get data from JDE related to order transferred from ORO
* Check if this order was committed and inventory was allocated or not
* If the check above passed - send a notification to ORO via API

The approach we are going to use removes Informatica API client intermediary. The idea is to get all needed data for this use case directly from the DB of JDE.
column171: 11/Dec/23 4:22 PM;614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4;API notification will delay the project, we can use the query approach then add API as enhancements.
column173:
12/Dec/23 8:24 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;Every time you submit transactions must query [~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] 

*Columns*
LIHCOM - Quantity on Hard Committed
LIPCOM - Quantity on Soft Committed

LIFCOM - Quantity on Future Commit

LIQOWO - Work Order Hard Commit

LIFUN1 - Work Order Soft Commit

12/Dec/23 1:28 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4]

{quote}Select SYDOCO, SYEXVAR12 from proddta.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 = "ORO_ORDER' This query will provide with the Oro Order created in JDE{quote}

This query does not return any data at this moment:

I need SQL that ORO can run to answer a simple question:

column180:
12/Dec/23 2:56 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;An example of SQL that ORO needs to use to check if the Order created in JDE has allocated inventory  data:

{noformat}SELECT 1 FROM PRODDTA.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 is not null and trim(SYEXVAR12) = '%ORO_ORDER_ID%' and SYDOCO > 0;{noformat}

Where:

*  F47011 - Order table in JDE
* SYEXVAR12 -  Column that represents ORO Order ID
* SYDOCO - Column that represents JDE Order Number
* %ORO_ORDER_ID% -  Value of ORO Order ID to check
* SYDOCO > 0 - condition needed to detect the case when inventory data was allocated for the Orde

The example of flow:

# The order created in ORO with line WS-1 (100 EA)
## Status set to Review
## Step set to Unassigned
# CSR requested approval for the Order
## Step updated to Ready For Approval
## Order Inventory Reservation created WS -1 (100 EA) 
# CSR approved Order in ORO
## Step updated to Approved
# Informatica transfers the Order to JDE
## Informatica pulls the approved Order from ORO using the API
## Informatica creates the Order in JDE table F47011 with the next data:
### SYEXVAR12 =  %ORO_ORDER_ID%
### SYDOCO = 0
## Informatica updates the ORO Order status using the API
### Status updated to Pending
# ORO runs SQL to check if the Order has allocated inventory:
## {{SELECT 1 FROM PRODDTA.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 is not null and trim(SYEXVAR12) = '%ORO_ORDER_ID%' and SYDOCO > 0;}}
## The query returns no result since the order has not been processed yet in  JDE
## ORO preserves information about Order Inventory Reservation created on step “2.b”
# JDE processes the Order in F47011 and allocates inventory data in {{f41021}}; This includes updating {{SYDOCO}} to some real non-zero value that represents JDE Order Number
# ORO runs SQL to check if the Order has allocated inventory:
## {{SELECT 1 FROM PRODDTA.F47011 WHERE SYEXVAR12 is not null and trim(SYEXVAR12) = '%ORO_ORDER_ID%' and SYDOCO > 0;}}
## The query returns non empty result
## ORO removes information about Order Inventory Reservation created on step “2.b”

column1: CPOV - Inventory - Inventory quantity interpretation and divide by 100
column30:
We need clarifications about how to interpret quantities in the table. 

On your screenshot of the CRON script, I saw that you apply division by 100 for all quantities:

!image-20231208-173246.png|width=1842,height=936!

Question 1. Do we need to do the same when quantity is used by in Oro?  For example, if some item in inventory table has quantity 12300, it means that there are 123 items.

Answer based on comments: Yes. The quantity should be divided by 100.

Question 2. How to deal with quantities that will have decimal parts? For example, here are records that from DB 

!image-20231208-173440.png|width=3840,height=2160!

If record has quantity = 48425, after division by 100, the value is 485.25. We do not have UOMs in Oro that have decimal part in unit precision. Can we interpret such values as integer value 485?

Answer based on comments: We can ignore decimal part. Quantity value 48425 should be interpreted as 484 in Oro.
column166:
08/Dec/23 12:36 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], please check and help with this question. It would be good to get the answer today, since this is related to low level task, that we planned to complete this week.

cc [~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4], [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1]
column167:
11/Dec/23 3:33 PM;614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] 

Question #1, We doesn’t use decimals in JDE reason of dividing by 100 to match ORO definition. quantity 12300, it means that there are 123 items.

Question #2. QOH get divided by 100 when inserting to ORO if you are going to compare random will be the correct, but let me validate with Richard 

cc [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837]
column168: 11/Dec/23 3:37 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4], [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], can we ignore the decimal part when quantity from JDE DB is selected in ORO? We found only ~450 products impacted by this. All other products have quantities that can be divided by 100 without having a non-zero value in the decimal part.
column169: 11/Dec/23 4:19 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4] can you confirm?
column170: 11/Dec/23 4:24 PM;614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] [~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18]  I don’t see any problem with that, we can ignore the decimal part as we are not propagating data into JDE, we are just validating availability.
column171: 11/Dec/23 5:03 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], [~accountid:614e1d4a41af8300715a09f4], thanks, I updated description with answers according to your feedback. I will close this task.

tf_all_jde_prod_raw_tables - prod_raw_tables

column1: ORO Pipeline Data pull - Sales RHS Tableau
column30:
* Bolivar
** Build database in Snowflake that links i) ORO Pipeline Data and ii) JDE Sales and Booking Data
*** Complete by 24 December

* Astley
** Work with me to build the structure in Tableau for the dashboards that will pull in the data from the new Snowflake database
*** Complete initial version by 20 December (before he goes out on vacation)
** First week of January
*** Pull in data from new database into the dashboards and test functionality
**** Ensure that Sales/Booking Data and ORO Pipeline data can be integrated in the same Tableau dashboard that can then be imported into ORO for sales team use
*** Understand if other changes need to be made or other database changes need to be made
* Eric
** Work with Shandra and team to ensure clear communication on the scope and when we expect delivery
** Work with Astley to pilot dashboards for first sales leadership reviews in early January

 

Project Goal Recap

* Set of dashboards built in Tableau and displayed in ORO that show ORO Pipeline data and Sales/Booking data for use with:
** RSM and RSA to have single source of data to make decisions on where to prioritize selling time.
** Rep Agencies have easy access to data to facilitate their own selling process with customers
** Commercial Leadership oversight of the full picture and how the team is doing to meet goals
* The Commercial Leadership Team will be kicking off a rotating cadence of reviews on a regional basis in early January  
** Goal to use dashboards to facilitate the discussion.

 

Recognize that deviations from the above will fall below the priorities:

# Buford 3.0
# CPOV
# Global Logic workstreams
# Pro1 – Connecting information flows from NetSuite to Core DT (i.e. JDE, Snowflake, Informatica) to consolidate financial information.

 

Separate IT Project to Scope

* End of week, deliver requirements for changes to the ORO Contractor pipeline and NAM HVAC Pipeline
** Schedule time with Shandra/Brea to discuss requirements and how it fits into the Sprint Schedule/resourcing

column30:
Request to not process specific types of Order Error Credits under $25 without rejecting them. 

----

Original Request by Crystaly: Good Afternoon

Can we create a workflow that will deny all credit memos in ORO with a dollar value of $25 & under with a reason code that states AR adjustment?  AR has a policy that writes off all balances that is $25 and under and we are trying to avoid customers receiving duplicate credits by way of a write off & the ability to use the credit against another deduction.

Jackie, can you update the pain points so that we can track to progress of this new workflow?

*Nika Hall- Nov 28, 2023 09:22 AM*

h4. Re: [Request ID :##99785##] : New Credit Memo Workflow

*To :* cthomas@diversitech.com
*Cc :* alittle@diversitech.com,jreynolds@diversitech.com,sdwilliams@diversitech.com

Good morning, 

I want to make sure I understand this request. We want to automatically reject any Order Error Cases with the reason of AR Adjustment, correct? We can do this but will you please provide a rejection message (required when rejecting any OEC) to display in Oro for when these cases come through. Example of one we already have "Credit automatically rejected because no credit reason provided".

Thank you, 
Nika Hall 

*Amanda Little- Nov 29, 2023 08:08 PM*

h4. RE: [Request ID :##99785##] : New Credit Memo Workflow

*To :* cthomas@diversitech.com,help@diversitech.com
*Cc :* jreynolds@diversitech.com,sdwilliams@diversitech.com

I don’t want it to be rejected on the surface. I want CSR and the customer to view it as if the credit process completed and was issued. I just want to stop the actual issuance of credits under $25. Reason is because we write off debit memos $25 and below, therefore, when the credit is processed we don’t actually need it to process. We do however need the record in ORO for case / error tracking, plus the customer needs to know there issue has been resolved and account in whole (which we did by writing off the debit memo). If that doesn’t make sense, let’s schedule a quick chat.

column200: MVP+ CPOV: Branch Allocation in ORO

column30:
The goal of this project is to create a Channel for specified customers that make dropship purchases at retail for items that often have a Customer Multiple Order Buy that our standard processes/systems won’t allow to be broken. This process uses a physical 3PL as a virtual branch within DT’s operating systems called Encompass, that will receive inventory from us for dropship orders placed for customer’s apart of this program. Allows DiversiTech to sell items at a higher price point (retail), which provides another business avenue to provide another layer of service, maximize profits on price, and stay competitive in the market of competition.

h2. Initial Requirements Gathering: Steve (eCommerce)

* List of Encompass Customer Bill To Accounts
* List of SKUs Approved for Encompass (est. 500 skus)
** Encompass (in Lawrenceville) will pick-up Inventory for Free → Fullfilled using Inventory from Buford
* Encompass Contract Terms & Cost
* Plan to incorporate Encompass Orders into the CPOV Informatica Flow
** Rules:

*Branch Information provided by Amanda Little:*

* Business Unit = 12500
* Description = Encompass 3PL
* Co = 00001
* BU Ty = BP

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Mass-action - Multi-select Branch Locations
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* The User can use a mass-action “Update Branch“ on the grid of Order Lines displayed on the Order view page when the Order is on review.
* The User can select multiple Order Line Items for the mass-action
* The User can select “Branch” that should be set in the selected Order Line Items
* After the action is submitted, the Order should be re-validated, and the page should be refreshed, so that the user can see an updated validation result

h2. Use Case

Pre-conditions:

* Large order is available on review and a lot of lines have incorrect branch

Steps:

# Open Order view page
# Scroll to Order Line Items grid
# Use a checkbox in the grid’s leftmost column to specify which lines should have Branch updated
# Click on the “…“ icon in the grid’s header to open mass actions
# Click on “Update Branch“ mass action
# In the opened dialog, select a new Branch from the list of available branches
## Values are loaded using the same logic as on the Order form in the Order Line Item “Branch“ field
# Submit action
# Wait until the action is completed and the page is refreshed
# See new validation results on the Order view page

h2. Considerations

Need to check how the UI of the Order Line Item grid will look when a new mass action is added. This will place an additional column in the grid to show a checkbox, making the space in the grid more squeezed. As a workaround, we may implement Action on the Order view page, instead of mass-action in the grid.

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Fill order line branch field automatically on create/edit
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* On order create via API request, when Order Line Item has an empty “Branch” field:
** Set the “Branch” of the Order Line Item based on the “Branch“ from the Order Header (set based on Ship To by default)
* In order create/update the page in the UI
** When the user adds a new Order Line, the Line Branch should be set automatically based on the Header Branch
*** Note, it could be empty, for example, when Ship To is not selected, or the Order Header branch is set to empty value manually
** When the user updates Ship To, and the Header Branch is updated, all lines in the form should have the Line Branch field value set with a new value of the Header Branch field
** When the user updates the Header Branch, all lines in the form should have the Line Branch field value set with the new value of the Header Branch field

h2. User Stories

||*#*||*As a <user type>*||*When/where*||*I want to <goal/objective>*||*So that <benefit/result>*||
|1|CSR|on the Order create/edit page, 
when I add a new line|have a new line added with Branch automatically set to the Order header Branch|I don’t need to set it manually ever time, and all lines are set to the Order header Branch by default|
|2|CSR|on the Order create/edit page,
when I change Ship To|have Order header Branch field automatically updated to the Branch of the selected Ship To|Order header branch field corresponds to the Ship To’s branch field by default|
|3|CSR|on the Order create/edit page,
when I change Ship To and order header Branch field is updated|have all lines in the form to be updated with the Branch from order header Branch|I don’t need to update it manually for every line, and by default the line’s Branch corresponds to Order header Branch|
|4|CSR|on the Order create/edit page,
when I change Branch field manually|have all lines in the form to be updated with the Branch from order header Branch|I don’t need to update it manually for every line, and by default the line’s Branch corresponds to Order header Branch|
|5|CSR|on the Order create/edit page|be able to change Branch of the line with custom value and submit the form|after form submission, the custom Branch that was selected in the line is kept as is|
|6|CSR|on the Order create/edit page|be able to set Branch of the line to empty value and submit the form|after form submission, on the Order view page, I can see validation error in the line that the Branch field is not selected|

h3. UATesting Results:

The “Branch” location of the Order Header was carried to all lines on the order initially once Ship To Customer was selected on the order create page. +Issues observed+ when changing the Ship To Customer – The header branch defaulted to the new Ship To customers branch but the line level Branches remained the same as the previous Ship To’s default branch.

!Change Ship To Customer Line Branch Test - Fail.png|width=1084,height=644!
column171:
20/Dec/23 1:09 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], check Acceptance Criteria of  this task:

!image-20231220-180621.png|width=932,height=257!

The implementation works exactly as described.

The application can override the line’s branch only if it is empty. 

You are requesting to change the line’s branch when header branch is updated. We can of course do this, but how you will know for sure that the line’s branch should be updated?

 For example,

# The CSR could have selected some specific branch in the line, and do not want to change it
# The CSR updated the Ship To or branch selected in the header, and submitted the order form
# The application set the new branch from the header to all lines' Branch fields, and the selection made in step 1 was overridden

This flow does not look correct to me. Before we can implement any change, let’s confirm that the requirements will cover all use cases.
column173:
20/Dec/23 2:31 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] you have approved the next Acceptance Criteria:

!Screenshot from 2023-12-20 11-23-50-20231220-192442.png|width=1109,height=349!

As this logic describes, the application overrides the Branch of the line item, +only when it is empty+. There is no mention of the next requirement anywhere in the Acceptance Criteria  or User Stories of the related tickets:

* Reset the Line’s Branch to the value of the Branch in the Order header, even if the old Branch in the line is already selected and does not match the previous Ship To.

This requirement should be easy to implement, but we need to confirm that it is expected by the users to have their custom Branch selections to be overridden when they change Ship To and/or Branch in the order header level.

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Make order line branch required (add critical validation error)
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Empty value in Order Line Item’s field “Branch”  should trigger Order Check Validation Error:
** Level: CRITICAL (HARD)
** Error Code: “line_item_branch_not_selected“
** Consolidated Message: “Branch is empty”
** Detailed Message: “The branch is not selected.”
** Customer Visibility: FALSE
** Bucket: inventory

h2. User Stories

* As a CSR, I want Order Line Item without Branch to have a Critical validation error, to prevent submitting such a Line to JDE

h2. Dependencies:

* [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|smart-link]

* [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|smart-link]

The application will always require users to select the branch. It will be selected automatically based on the Branch selected in the header level. Right now the branch of the order line could be empty in Oro.

I plan to deliver these items to UAT this week before all other changes related to inventory sync and branch availability logic are delivered. But I need your confirmation that it will work for you.

So now, when you submit the form, and some line has empty branch, the implementation sets the branch according to the requirements in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|smart-link] .

If something is not working as expected, please provide the list of full requirements that describe the expected behavior for all use cases. For now, it looks as you confirmed the requirements that were implemented exactly as they were provided, and now requesting changes because the requirements were not completely covering all use cases.

20/Dec/23 2:42 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], we are not on the same page here.

{quote}I never requested upon submission of the form to populate branch fields.{quote}

Not sure how is this possible, but we added implementation exactly for this logic in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5827|smart-link] . The requirements of this task and the implementation contain the logic, the Branch field of the line is set automatically based on the Branch in the header level (only if the line’s Branch is empty):

{quote}Acceptance Criteria
  On order create/update via API or form, when Order Line Item has an empty “Branch” field:
  Set the “Branch” of the Order Line Item based on the selected “Branch“ from the Order Header{quote}

There is a conflict of requirements that I see here:

# You requested to show the validation error if the Branch field was left empty.
# If the Branch is empty, when the order form is submitted, the application sets the Branch field according to the header’s Branch (check DEV-5827)

We need to understand what is the logic of setting the Branch based on the order header. It seems to me that in some cases the application should set the Branch field to the lines based on the header, and in other cases you expect this field to be kept blank.

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Show inventory data for order lines in branch drop-down on order create/edit page
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Additional information about product +Available Quantity+ is added on the form in the +Branch Field+ (drop-down) of the Order Line
* Requirements for User Interface
** +Branch Field+ shows the options in the next format:
*** [10100]  East Part (10)
*** [10200] COLUMBUS MFG (50)
** Example:
** !image-20231207-230853.png|width=1699,height=469!
The number in parenthesis represents the +Available Quantity+ for the Product using the currently selected UOM
** +Branch Field+ has text shown below it: _Available QTY: %quantity%_. Example:
*** !image-20231207-230906.png|width=1107,height=191!
On the screenshot, 547 is the available quantity in UOM = PK for the Product selected in the line
** Restrictions:
*** This +Available Quantity+ value is displayed as “N/A“ in the UI in the following cases:
**** UOM is not selected in the line
**** Selected UOM is not valid for the selected Product
*** The UI does not show +Available Quantity+ at all if the line represents a “Fee Line”
* +Available Quantity+ calculation logic
** The value is calculated using the next formula:
*** {{(Available Quantity in DT Inventory Data) - (Reserved Orders Quantity in Oro prior reservation for this Order Line)}}
* Logic of data loading for +Available Quantity+
** Data is +loaded in real-time+ in the next scenarios
*** The user adds a new Line and selects a Product
*** The user updates the existing Line and selects a different Product
*** The user opens the Order Edit page, data is loaded for all Lines in this Order
** Data is +NOT loaded in real-time+ in the next scenarios:
*** The user changes UOM for the Line
*** The user changes the Branch for the Line
*** The user clicked on the Branch field to expand the drop-down

h2. User Stories

* As a CSR, when I create a new Order, after selecting a Product, I want to see the +Available Quantity+ when choosing a Branch
* As a CSR, when I open the Order edit page, I want to see the +Available Quantity+ for every line that has an applicable Product (excluding “Fee Lines”)
* As a CSR, on the Order create/update page, when I change UOM, I want to have the +Available Quantity+ updated according to the selected UOM
* As a CSR, on the Order create/update page, when I change the Product, I want to have the +Available Quantity+ refreshed with real-time data
* As a CSR, I want +Available Quantity+ to take into account the Product’s Availability in JDE and reservations in Oro

h2. Dependencies

* [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5819|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5819|smart-link]

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Clear reserved inventory for orders after commit to JDE
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Clean-up +Oro Inventory Reservation+ for Order in ORO after it was committed to JDE and +JDE Inventory Data+ was decremented to fulfill lines of this Order
* Triggered clean-up logic using 2 methods:
*# CRON command
*#* The command that runs every 5 minutes to clean up +Oro Inventory Reservation+  for Pending Orders committed to JDE
*# Warm-up state
*#* Warm-up state of +Oro Inventory Reservation+ before calculating +Available Quantity+ in Oro
*#* This method is used to provide real-time value of +Available Quantity+ in Oro that should take into account accurate +JDE Inventory Data+ and +Oro Inventory Reservation+ that do not have overlapping changes

h2. Use Case for Clean-Up CRON Command

# Order was created in ORO
#  Order was approved in ORO
#* +Oro Inventory Reservation+ was created for this Order
#  Order was transferred to JDE via the Informatica API client
#* Order Status changed to “Pending”
#* No manual actions were made in ORO by CSRs between steps 3 and 5 (e.g. it was the end of the working day and no users were online)
# Order was committed to JDE and +JDE Inventory Data+ was decremented 
# ORO runs CRON command (every 5 minutes) to clean +Oro Inventory Reservation+ for pending Orders
#* 5.1 Found pending Order in ORO that may require +Oro Inventory Reservation+ clean-up
#* 5.2 Check that the Order was committed to JDE and +JDE Inventory Data+ was decremented to fulfill lines of this Order
#** This check should be performed using SQL query to JDE DB (see [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5890|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5890|smart-link] )
#* 5.3 Remove +Oro Inventory Reservation+ related to this Order
# Future requests to calculate +Available Quantity+ in Oro will not use the outdated +Oro Inventory Reservation+ that was deleted, because the Order was committed to JDE and +JDE Inventory Data+ was decremented

h2. Use Case for Warm-Up Oro Inventory Reservation

# Order #1 was created in ORO
#* Order has product “WS-1“
# Order #1 was approved in ORO
#* +Oro Inventory Reservation+ was created for this Order
# Order #1 was transferred to JDE via the Informatica API client
#* Order Status changed to “Pending”
#* CRON command was not executed between steps 3 and 4
# CSR opens edit page for Order #2
#* Order has product “WS-1“ (same as in Order #1)
# CSR wants to see the +Available Quantity+ for this product.
The application calculates and shows this value.
The calculation logic is described below:
#* 5.1 Find that Product “WS-1“ is related to Order #1 that has a “Pending“ status and related +Oro Inventory Reservation+
#* 5.2 Check that Order #1 was committed to JDE and +JDE Inventory Data+ was decremented to fulfill lines of this Order
#** This check should be performed using SQL query to JDE DB (see [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5890|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5890|smart-link] )
#* 5.3 Remove +Oro Inventory Reservation+ related to Order #1
#* 5.4 Calculate +Available Quantity+ based on +JDE Inventory Data+ ignoring the deleted +Oro Inventory Reservation+ related to Order #1
# CSR sees the +Available Quantity+ for product ”WS-1” using the correct data in +JDE Inventory Data+ and +Oro Inventory Reservation+. There are no overlaps between those data sources.

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Reserve inventory for order lines during Order Review workflow
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Add additional logic in the existing Order Review workflow to reserve inventory in ORO for Orders
** Add inventory reservation for the Order lines
*** When the Order Review Workflow enters the next steps:
**** Approval Override
**** Ready For Approval
**** Imported Approval
**** Approved
** Clear inventory reservation for the Order lines
*** When the Order Review Workflow enters any other step
** Example 1:
*** CSR #1 created the Order manually via UI, the Order Review workflow in step “Unassigned“
*** CSR #1 moves the Order Review workflow to steps “Reviewed“
*** CSR #1 moves the Order Review workflow to step “Ready For Approval“
**** Inventory reservation created for the Order
*** CSR #2 didn’t approve the Order and moved the Order Review workflow to step “OE Review“
**** Inventory reservation cleared for the Order
*** CSR #1 updated the Order and the workflow to step “Ready For Approval“
**** Inventory reservation created for the Order
*** CSR #1 approved the Order and moved the Order Review workflow to step “Approved“
*** The Informatica API client transferred the Order to JDE and updated the status field to “Pending“
*** The ORO application automatically detected this change and cleared the inventory reservation
**** Note, that this part of the logic will be implemented separately in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5823|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5823|smart-link] 
** Example 2:
*** The Informatica API client created the Order without any validation errors, The Order Review workflow step was set to “Imported Approval“
**** Inventory reservation created for the Order
*** CSR #2 didn’t approve the Order and moved the Order Review workflow to step “Cancelled“
*** Inventory reservation cleared for the Order
* Documentation in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3862|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-3862|smart-link] should be updated to reflect additional logic added in the scope of this task

h2. Technical Implementation Notes

* It may be not very efficient to include the required login in all transitions of the workflow. A simpler option should be considered:
** Add event listeners for the workflow step change, and run logic to add/clear reservation for the Order based on the new workflow step

h2. Order Review Workflow Transitions Diagram

!image-20231208-201332.png|width=890,height=850!

h2.

column1: DEV- Use Cases / Validate order line with available inventory
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Add a new check to validate the availability of the Order Line
* This check is executed in the same way and in the same events as all other checks:
** Informatica API client creates a new Order
** User submits form on the Order create/edit page
** User clicks the Revalidate button on the Order view page
* Logic of the check
** Trigger error when Order Line’s Quantity cannot be covered by +Available Quantity+. Formula:
*** {{(Order Line Quantity) > (Product Available Quantity)}}
** Where +Available Quantity+ is calculated using the same logic as described in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5824|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5824|smart-link] 
*** {{(Available Quantity in DT Inventory Data) - (Reserved Orders Quantity in Oro prior reservation for this Order Line)}}
* Error properties
** Level: NON-CRITICAL (SOFT)
** Error Code: “line_item_inventory_exceeds_avail“
** Consolidated Message: “QTY Exceeds Inventory Avail”
** Detailed Message: “The requested quantity exceeds the availability of inventory in the selected Branch.”
** Customer Visibility: FALSE
** Bucket: Inventory

h2. User Stories

As a CSR, during the Order Review workflow, I want to see validation errors when the Order Line does not have enough availability

h2. Dependencies

* [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5819|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5819|smart-link] 

h2. Additional Resources

* Check [https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/blob/feature/inventory_level_check/doc/inventory_availability/02_inventory_check_logic.md|https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/blob/feature/inventory_level_check/doc/inventory_availability/02_inventory_check_logic.md]
column166:
07/Dec/23 6:56 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], please review the requirements. I have doubts in next items:

* The language that should be used in the validation error. Please correct it if needed.
* During one of our discussions, you mentioned that the application should show a soft-validation error even if the requested quantity is enough, but the remaining is less than some threshold. 
** For example:
*** +Remaining Quantity Threshold+ is 100
*** +Available Quantity+  is 150
*** +Order Line’s Quantity+ is 60
*** +Remaining Quantity+ is 90, so even though there is no validation error (the item’s availability is enough), we still need to show some error to the user, so that they are aware that this item has low stock.
** Please check if we need to implement this additional logic, and if yes, can we do it later?
