column166:
07/Dec/23 2:47 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], after some testing we found that it should be possible to implement grid view that you initially requested:

* Each row shows one product and quantity in different branches

It may not work very fast, for example, 2-3 seconds to load the data without additional filters/sorts, and 3-6 seconds to load the data when some sorting is applied by some column with branch quantity.

Since this task is not in our primary scope in December, please update the requirements for it. 

Also, we need to decide, do you want to take into account in this grid information about product reservations for Orders in Oro that are not committed to JDE yet. If this is the requirement, we will have next limitation:

* Not possible to sort by quantity column that can be affected by local reserved quantity in Oro
* Not possible to sort filter by quantity column that can be affected by local reserved quantity in Oro

Sorting/filtering by quantity column that is calculated from 2 sources (JDE DB and ORO DB) is not possible.

column1: Reduce memory consumption during import of large Catsy/Salsify files
column30:
*Scope*

# Change the current implementation of readers in {{DT\Bundle\SalsifyImportBundle\Reader}}  to store data read from the file without empty values
## Note, if all rows contain empty values but column with such name exists, such field should be set to empty value in case of product import
# Test import works on the real file and provides performance metrics

Test file is provided in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5585|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5585|smart-link]
column166: 04/Dec/23 4:48 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;Merged to master in [https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/pull/1209|https://github.com/DiversiTech/ORO_DT_DEV/pull/1209|smart-link]

Please check on UAT once it is deployed. The file can contain all 550 columns in one tab. Please use files with single tab during real import.

!image-20231204-162253.png|width=1241,height=346!

*Data Query* per [~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] 

Based on the provided information, Oro is going to use the next data for the use case of getting inventory data from JDE:

select
 IBLITM as product_sku,
 -- IBAITM as product_sku, -- Which column to use for Product SKU in Oro, IBLITM or IBAITM?
 IBMCU as cost_center_code,
 LIPQOH - LIPBCK - LIHCOM - LIPCOM - LIFCOM as quantity_available,
 LIPQOH as quantity_on_hand,
 LIPBCK as quantity_backorder,
 LIHCOM as quantity_hard_committed,
 LIPCOM as quantity_soft_committed,
 LIFCOM as quantity_future_committed
from JDE_CRP.CRPDTA.f41021 -- inventory table
inner join JDE_CRP.CRPDTA.F4102 -- product table
 on IBITM = LIITM and IBMCU = LIMCU
where IBLITM = 'WS-1'; -- place any Product SKU here instead of "WS-1"

 “In my local tests, the execution time of such a simple query is 0.8-1 second. I'm not 100% sure if this is because I'm using VPN, or the query itself is slow. To make this solution work smoothly, we will need to ensure that a query like this runs in 10ms or less. The use case of the Oro application is to run tens and hundreds of requests like this in one web request, so it won't be acceptable to have high latency. “

column168:
07/Dec/23 12:22 AM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], it is easy to add support for API requests that will create/update the Order Error Case. There are only 2 things to consider:

# API requests will need to provide data that passes all validation rules that work in the form. For example, check the example of a validation error from my last comment in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5777|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5777|smart-link] 
!image-20231207-050038.png|width=1299,height=623!
# More difficult issue. The “Order Error Case” entity has an active workflow “Order Error Case Flow“ that applies some logic and restrictions:
#* It is used in the UI and has the next possible steps: Draft, Submitted, Closed.
#* Workflow step != Status field of “Order Error Case“
#* Users cannot change “Status“ directly, they should use workflow transitions (buttons in the UI)
#* Workflow steps to Status mapping:
#** Step “Draft“ mapped to Status “New“
#** Step “Submitted“ mapped to Status “Submitted“
#** Step “Closed“ mapped to Status “Closed“
#* The User cannot move “Order Error Case“arbitrarily between steps. This is done via transitions, and each transition has conditions to allow/deny the transition to the next steps. For example, in this case, the User cannot run the “Submit“ transition for the “Order Error Case“, because not all conditions are allowed:

!image-20231207-051445.png|width=2485,height=784!

So, taking into account considerations in item #2 it is not possible out of the box to simply enable create/update API requests for “Order Error Case” and with the possibility of changing the order “Status“.

One simple option could be updating the implementation, to move workflow automatically to Step “Submitted“, when “Order Error Case“ will be created via API. This option will work with the following restrictions:

* API client cannot provide the “Status” field directly in the create/update API request
* Every time the API client creates an “Order Error Case“, the workflow will move to step “Submitted“, it won’t be possible to create an “Order Error Case“ in step “Draft“ and Status “New“.
column169:
13/Dec/23 2:03 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], [~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a], we need more info about the use case.

As mentioned in the comments, there are some issues with submitting the Order Error Case in Status = Submitted.

Also, it is not clear if this API client will submit Order Error Case Line Items. To submit them, it will be required to provide ID of the related Order and Order Line Item.

Also, changes to the API should be made without breaking any existing integrations and API clients. I’m not sure how is it used now, and what should be the scope of the backward compatibility support with existing API clients.

Regarding your recent comment related to the “entity not found exception“ error.  I reported a bug for this problem to fix it in the upcoming releases. Also, I applied a hot-fix patch to PROD and UAT. Please check again.

As for the request to create an Order Error Case via API along with Line Items, there is a ticket with PR on review for this change, but unfortunately, I have other high priorities right now with a deadline in the next 2 weeks. How urgent is this task for your team?

FYI, the changes that we are working on will include the next modifications of the existing API:

# Requests to get Order Error Cases should include the parameter “include=lineItems“ if the API client needs to get “lineItems” in the response.
#* As an example, check how this API request for orders works:
{{GET {{base_url}}/admin/api/orders/807547?include=lineItems}}

!image-20240105-052024.png|width=2113,height=1312!
#* For backward compatibility, the API GET request will still return “lineItems” in the “attributes“, in the same format as now, for example:

!image-20240105-052117.png|width=2113,height=1312!
# POST/PATCH request will allow passing “lineItems“ in “relationships“ and “included“ keys of the request body. This will allow creating/updating Order Error Cases along with their line items.

As soon as I will have specific examples of the API requests, I will share them here. I’d assume I should have something after Tuesday next week.

* What type should be used?
*# Simple string
*## Any random value is allowed to be used in the fields
*# {color:#006644}*Enum*{color}
*## {color:#006644}*Only specific values are allowed to be used in the fields. If so, please provide those values.*{color}
* View permission:

* Write permission:

*# {color:#006644}*Users can enter/override these fields using UI forms or import*{color}

column1: MVP+ CPOV: Price Override Flag Update
column30:
h2. Use Case Explained:

Users have been experiencing issues with “Free Item” and “Price Overridden” Lines are not applying once they reach JDE. 

Richard was able to locate the “Price Overridden Flag” Field was not being updated on the push from ORO to JDE on orders. He ran a test on an order we’d previously tested in PY that sent a “Free Item” Line with $0.00 pricing to JDE, the order made it to stage with $0.00 but once in JDE the price changed. 

* He retested this order and changed the “Price Overridden Flag” to ‘1' (Override) instead of it initially being ‘0’ (Don’t Override) and the price came through as $0.00 as it should have initially.

!f1f535d5-81da-4b29-99c7-c450ddce6140.jpg|width=800,height=216!

!4b5f9e5a-5cb9-4bc0-aa9c-097ac99fed04.jpg|width=800,height=207!

So we tested the flag in ORO by making price changes to the lines, to see if the “Price Overridden Flag” in ORO updated as we saved changes. Resulted in the Flag remaining NO for all lines no matter the change that was made.

* *Initial - Unedited Values:*
!Test POF - 928477 Unedited.png|width=1340,height=694!

* *Edited:*
!Test POF - 928477 Edit.png|width=1352,height=670!

* *Saved:*
!Test POF - 928477 Saved.png|width=1358,height=665!


h2. *Requirements:*

* If the Price field on any line does not match the DT Price for the item selected, build logic in ORO to update the +Price Override+ flag as “Yes” (1) instead of “No” (0).
* If the Price field on any line matches the DT Price for the item selected, build logic in ORO to update the +Price Override+ flag as “No” (0) instead of “Yes” (1).

[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] Once this change has been made, we will need you to add the +Price Override+ field to your informatica flow to communicate these changes to JDE if you haven’t already.

|*JDE Field Label*|*JDE Table*|*JDE Alias*|*JDE Type*|*JDE Length*|*ORO Field*|*ORO Label*|*ORO Comments*|
|Price Override Code|F47012|SZPROV|Character|1|Order.lineItems[i].dt_price_overridden|Price Override Flag|0 - false 1 - true. Was price overridden in ORO|
column166: 30/Nov/23 11:43 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] Can you confirm if there is currently any logic behind the “Price Overridden Flag” in ORO or is it based on receiving updates from JDE after the orders have been created?
column167: 30/Nov/23 11:43 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] priorities on this?
column168: 07/Dec/23 1:38 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] would this be another small task for the part time dev to complete before end of year?
column169:
11/Dec/23 12:52 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837], the old logic on PROD is very simple. The field “Price Overridden Flag“ is set to TRUE only if the line has no relation to the existing Product. For example, if the line represents a Fee Line Item, or user entered Product that does not exist. We can update the logic as you suggested, and set this flag to TRUE when DT Price != Line Price.

Please take into account, that DT Price load itself can be failed in some cases. For example, if the user added a line with an invalid UOM, JDE returns will 500 error, and if price was not loaded for such line from cache, DT Price will be empty.
column170: 12/Dec/23 9:08 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] Understood. Thank you

column1: Update SF Query to pull only P3 customers
column30:
Received filter requirements from business on identifying qualifying customers for P3 orders. 

Will be using the Zone Number field (Alias ZON) in either the F03012 or F4211 tables

Working with Hilda to identify who will load this PP flag in the tables and when.
column166:
30/Nov/23 10:17 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;* Original DB Structure: Snowflake_Query_P3SelectOrders   [QueryDefinition.Types]
* New DB Structure: Snowflake_Query_P3SelectFilteredOrders [QueryDefinition.Types]



* Original Query Name: P3SelectOrders
* New Query: P3SelectFilteredOrders will generate a new DB structure with the Zone Number field added

{noformat}SELECT
    SODF.SDSHAN AS "Ship To",
    ABM.ABALPH AS "Customer",
    ABD.ALCTY1 AS "City",
    ABD.ALADDS AS "State",
    SODF.SDMOT AS "Mode of Transport",
    SODF.SDSHPN AS "Shipment Number",
    SODF.SDDOCO AS "Order Number",
    SODF.SDLNID AS "Line Number",
    SODF.SDLITM AS "SKU",
    SODF.SDPQOR AS "Qty",
    SODF.SDDCTO AS "Order Type",
    SODF.SDAN8 AS "Bill To",
    SODF.SDTRDJ AS "Transaction Date",
    SODF.SDMCU AS "Branch",
    SODF.SDPPDJ AS "Promised Ship Date",
    SODF.SDCARS AS "Carrier",
    SODF.SDZON AS "Zone Number",
    SRN.XIREFN AS "Tracking Number",
    IM.IMSRP5 AS "Product Category",
    IM.IMSTKT AS "Stocking Type"
FROM F4211 SODF
LEFT OUTER JOIN F0101 ABM on TRIM(ABM.ABAN8) = TRIM(SODF.SDSHAN)
LEFT OUTER JOIN F0116 ABD on TRIM(ABD.ALAN8) = TRIM(ABM.ABAN8) AND ABD.ALEFTB = ABM.ABEFTB
LEFT OUTER JOIN F4217 SRN on TRIM(SRN.XISHPN) = TRIM(SODF.SDSHPN)
LEFT OUTER JOIN F4101 IM on TRIM(IM.IMLITM) = TRIM(SODF.SDLITM)
WHERE IM.IMSRP5 IS NOT NULL AND SODF.SDDCTO NOT IN ('CO', 'CA', 'CR', 'SQ') AND IM.IMSRP5 IN ('ECO', 'ULT', 'ELT') AND IM.IMSTKT != 'O' AND SODF.SDZON = 'PPP';{noformat}

column1: Expose PATCH Order Error Case entity
column30:
We have the need to mass update the status of aged Order Error Cases and Credits older from before Jan 1, 2021. There are thousands of records from Salesforce that are stil in a new/submitted status that the business is asking us to mark as cancelled/closed. 

We are working on a quick Decisions workflow to use a CSV file with the Oro IDs for these cases to validate some fields and then update the status, but the PATCH api is not exposed to leverage. 

[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] Shandra asked me to check how quickly we could get the API exposed so I can use it for entityordererrorcases so I can patch cases by ID. 

*If there’s a credit associated*, I would be patching the Credit instead, assuming that it will dynamically update the Case. I already have APIs and logic for this process. Please let me know if that won’t work for the cases/credits that were imported from Salesforce.



Fields I anticipate needing to update
Order Error Case relationship - {{dtoecstatuses}} to Closed
Order Error Credits relationship  - {{dtcrorstatuses}} to Rejected
column167:
29/Nov/23 11:19 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Example Order Error Case: 00015475
Status is New (So no related Credit Request Order Error)

This is from 2020 and I would want to update the status to Closed

{quote}The request is using the attribute “isItemFound“ because we already have a logic in Oro’s existing Workflow to Close the “Order Error Case” when this attribute is set to FALSE.{quote}

Is this accurate? I see a lot of Cases that have isItemFound as FALSE and they’re still NEW status (not submitted or closed). Did you mean update it to TRUE to get workflow step updated to Closed?

{quote}I’d suggest using the next implementation:

Decisions can use Oro API to find old “Order Error Case“

Check if found “Order Error Case“ has a related “Credit Request Order Error“

      If it exists, send a PATCH request for this “Credit Request Order Error“ (similar to the example above). This action will Reject the “Credit Request Order Error“ and Close the “Order Error Case“{quote}

This was the intention. any aged Cases that have been submitted would get updated the normal way, by updating the Credit Request to Rejected (With a rejection reason) and the Case would also get updated to Closed. My concern for these were they were directly imported from Salesforce so I wasn’t sure if that would be sufficient. But you have stated that method will continue to work so I can handle that.
column170:
30/Nov/23 8:12 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1]  LOE is 2-3 hrs to expose the PATCH for order error cases. Do you want Ignat to proceed or wait until Sprint 50.

I can move forward with any Cases that are submitted, as I’ll update the Credit Request for those and already have the APIs in Decisions
column171: 30/Nov/23 8:14 AM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;Yes Proceed now [~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] / [~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a]
column173:
07/Dec/23 12:58 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18]  I definitely do not want to bypass any validations or create a patch API that’s only useful for one specific and uncommon use case. 

{quote}Option 3 - You include in the PATCH requests other attributes to update them and pass validation logic.{quote}

I’m good with Option 3, as long as I have the fields that are required and what validations need to occur. 

While option 1 is the easiest, I would rather not rely on SQL to update outstanding cases, as we’ll likely need to do this sort of cleanup in the future, and I’m a big fan of automating tedious tasks when and where we can. If I could build a flow that we just have to hit “RUN” on when needed, it’d save us time in the long run. 

[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1]  Thoughts? Also would this help/impact GL’s work at all? I know they’ll likely need a POST API for order error cases, but I’m not sure if they have a need for a PATCH
column174: 07/Dec/23 1:45 PM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;I’m ok with Option 3. 🙂
column175:
07/Dec/23 1:57 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a], in case of the error with updating {{https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/order-error-case/view/64}}, the validation error is:

{quote}An active INCode must be found by values of fields 'Credit Request Reason', 'Return?', 'Replace?', but any wasn't found."{quote}

This is not simply about adding some required fields. This error means that some fields are inconsistent, and active “IN Code” cannot be selected. You can open [https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/order-error-case/update/64|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer-service/order-error-case/update/64] and try to click the “Save“ button, it will show you the same error:

!image-20231207-185257.png|width=1853,height=929!

I think that someone from the Customer Support team can hint what is the issue. I think that fields “Credit Request Reason”, “Return?”, and “Replace“ should match existing and active IN Code.

Change request to how Quotes are handled for National Accounts. 

If a quote is for a National account, it should go to the RSM if it's a ship to location and to the NAM if it's a Parent.
column166:
29/Nov/23 8:10 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Garret Oliver- Nov 14, 2023 03:08 PM

h4. Re: [Request ID :##98988##] : Fw: Regional Manager on Quotes

*To :* help@diversitech.com
*Cc :* nhall@diversitech.com,rpeoples@diversitech.com

So, we have changed how we look at National Accounts.  National ship tos are now assigned to the RSM of the region, as opposed to the NAM of the National account. National ship tos can now route through the RSM assigned to the account, we just need the Parent account of the nationals to go through the NAM. Basically, the only exceptions need to be for the parent accounts of Nationals. I have listed those below



Thanks

29/Nov/23 8:11 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;*From:* Garret Oliver <[goliver@diversitech.com|mailto:goliver@diversitech.com]> 
*Sent:* Tuesday, November 28, 2023 4:15 PM
*To:* Helpdesk <[Helpdesk@diversitech.com|mailto:Helpdesk@diversitech.com]>
*Cc:* Nika Hall <[NHall@diversitech.com|mailto:NHall@diversitech.com]>; David Oriatti <[DOriatti@diversitech.com|mailto:DOriatti@diversitech.com]>; Lewis Bryson <[lbryson@diversitech.com|mailto:lbryson@diversitech.com]>; Service Desk <[help@diversitech.com|mailto:help@diversitech.com]>
*Subject:* National Quotes UpdateNika/helpdesk,

After the updates we made to national accounts a few weeks ago, we need to update the flow of quotes now as well. If a quote is submitted under the Parent account or a DC of a national account, it should go to the National Account Manager field in Oro. If it is just for a National Ship to location, it needs to go to the Regional Manager field in Oro. Basically, if it affects pricing for the whole account or a DC, the National Manager would handle. If it is just one ship to or a grouping of ship tos, the Regional Manager should handle. Hopefully the attached flow can help as well. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks

Garret Oliver

[^Quotes Submission Flow.pdf]

2/3 of the customers co-op funds were *NOT* spent by November.

EX: Customer allocated $1,000 in co-op funds
As of Nov 1st, Customer has spent $250 of those funds. (25%)

This should flag as an exception since the amount spent is not >= $660 (66.67%)

UPDATE

[Yesterday 4:35 PM] Garret Oliver

I just called Dave again, and we are revising it (again). If the customer has not spend 25% of their co-op funds by Nov 1, then it should go to Oriatti

column30:
Request by David O, Lewis, and Garret to change the 2/3 exception rule  as follows: 

2/3 of the customers co-op funds were *NOT* spent by November.

EX: Customer allocated $1,000 in co-op funds
As of Nov 1st, Customer has spent $250 of those funds. (25%)

This should flag as an exception since the amount spent is not >= $660 (66.67%)

UPDATE

[Yesterday 4:35 PM] Garret Oliver

I just called Dave again, and we are revising it (again). If the customer has not spend 25% of their co-op funds by Nov 1, then it should go to Oriatti

Nika,

 

Can you adjust the Decisions flow to have it correctly function with the right approvers:

 

*Change 1:* Co-op 2/3 spend by October 1^st^

                Change to: Co-op 2/3 spend by November 1^st^

 

+*If Customer is under the 2/3 rule on co-op spend:*+

 

*All Co-Ops - > RSM Approval*

                                Step 1 – RSM approves in decisions

                                Step 2 – Approved for processing

Issue: Dave O is seeing these and does not need to. In addition, Kevin W is also probably and should not see or approve these

 

*Co-Op > $1,000 Channel Manager Approval*

                                Step 1 – RSM approves in decisions

                                Step 2 – Channel Manager approves in decisions (Kevin W.)

                                Step 3 – Approved for processing

Issue: Dave O is seeing these and does not need to. In addition, Kevin W is also probably and should not see or approve these

 

*Co-Op > $5,000 Exec Approval (but less than $10,000)*

                                Step 1 – RSM approves in decisions

                                Step 2 – Channel Manager approves in decisions (Kevin W.)

                                Step 3 – VP of Sales approves in decisions (Dave O.)

                                Step 4 – Approved for processing

 

*Co-Op > $10,000 Acct Approval (Amanda)*

Step 1 – RSM approves in decisions

                                Step 2 – Channel Manager approves in decisions (Kevin W.)

                                Step 3 – VP of Sales approves in decisions (Dave O.)

                                Step 4 – Controller approves in decisions (Amanda L.)

                                Step 5 – Approved for processing

 

Thanks,
column166:
28/Nov/23 3:50 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;*From:* Service Desk <[help@diversitech.com|mailto:help@diversitech.com]>
*Sent:* Tuesday, November 28, 2023 9:25 AM
*To:* Lewis Bryson <[lbryson@diversitech.com|mailto:lbryson@diversitech.com]>
*Cc:* Helpdesk <[Helpdesk@diversitech.com|mailto:Helpdesk@diversitech.com]>; Garret Oliver <[goliver@diversitech.com|mailto:goliver@diversitech.com]>; Nika Hall <[NHall@diversitech.com|mailto:NHall@diversitech.com]>; David Oriatti <[DOriatti@diversitech.com|mailto:DOriatti@diversitech.com]>
*Subject:* Re: [Request ID :##100576##] : FW: Co-Ops

David O should only see credits under 10k if there is an exception on the Co-Op. Kevin W would also receive any credits with an exception.

Example. Co-Op request CR21-10001439 was only for $886.23 but there were not enough funds left to process, so it would have to get executive approval

Oro Exception message:

This request has the following exception(s) and requires special approval:
There are not enough funds left in the co-op fund for S.W.H. SUPPLY COMPANY.

 

Example of Exception message in Decisions Approval CR23-10002226

!image-20231128-205041.png|width=513,height=255!

I do believe there may be a discrepancy between Oro and Decisions about the rule of 2/3 funds not spent after September, and asked Garret to get clarification on what it should be so we can ensure both Oro and Decisions are flagging the same exceptions.

If there’s a Co-Op under 10k making it to David’s inbox without an exception, I would need an example so I can troubleshoot and look into it. The same for the Channel Mgr approvals.

Possible Exceptions:

* No funds allocated
* Funds remaining < Funds available
* Activity Type = “Other”
* After September, amount spent < 2/3 allocated (this is the one I believe is not synced with Oro and would need verification on)
column167:
28/Nov/23 3:51 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;h4. Re: [Request ID :##100576##] : FW: Co-Ops

*To :* help@diversitech.com,lbryson@diversitech.com
*Cc :* doriatti@diversitech.com,helpdesk@diversitech.com,nhall@diversitech.com

Nika,

Lewis, Dave, and I spoke this morning on this, and we are in agreement *that the 2/3 rule should be that 2/3 of the customers co-op funds were not spent by November*. Can you make sure that these align in Oro and Decisions?

Thanks

The files contain 6 different orders. All these orders were successfully loaded to FTP at some point. The table below shows the column “Success File“, this is the file that was uploaded to FTP successfully after the upload of files in the column “Failed File“ failed.

||*Failed File*||*Order Oro Number*||*Current Status*||*Success File*||
|P_sales_order_20231011T154505Z.csv~uploading
P_sales_order_20231011T160007Z.csv~uploading|910531|Pending|P_sales_order_20231011T161504Z.csv|
|P_sales_order_20231023T154505Z.csv~uploading|914892|Pending|P_sales_order_20231023T160005Z.csv|
|P_sales_order_20231023T154505Z.csv~uploading|914893|Pending|P_sales_order_20231023T160005Z.csv|

|P_sales_order_20231027T161504Z.csv~uploading|917028|Pending|P_sales_order_20231027T163005Z.csv|
|P_sales_order_20231101T120006Z.csv~uploading|918477|Pending|P_sales_order_20231101T121505Z.csv|

So the next actions can be made:

* Optional - Remove files with suffix {{~uploading}} from the FTP (I do not have permissions to do it)
* If the orders are stuck, check with the JDE team, since the orders were pushed to FTP successfully, and files moved to the archive.

The issue with failed file upload happened in the next scenario:

# Oro uploaded file with suffix {{~uploaded}} to FTP
# Once the upload finished, Oro tried to rename the file and remove the suffix {{~uploaded}}. This operation has failed due to connection problems with FTP (quite an old problem no one knows how to fix). Sample error in logs:
!image-20231128-003734.png|width=2497,height=1280!

column1: Support configuration to hide un-shippable branches
column30:
h2. *Context*

In [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5475|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5475|smart-link] a hard-coded solution was implemented to hide Un-Shippable branches.

In the scope of this task, hard-coded solutions should be replaced with flexible and configurable approach.

h2. *Acceptance Criteria*

*Option 1*

* System Configuration
** Add a new field in the System Configuration - [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/config/system/platform/dt_order|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/config/system/platform/dt_order]
*** Field name: “Un-Shippable Branch Locations“
*** Tooltip: 
**** The given branch locations will be hidden for selection from the Order create/edit page. The value of this field should contain the code of the branch on each line. Example value:
{noformat}10100
11200
88888
11600{noformat}
*** Field type: Textarea
*** Default value:
{noformat}10100
11200
88888
11600{noformat}
** System Administrator can change this field in the System Configuration whenever needed.
* UI of order create/edit page
** The UI contains the column “Branch“ in the grid of line items form
** This column has a respective field that represents the branch using a drop-down with options
** The UI should hide the given branches from the available options of the drop-down
** If the Branch is already selected for some existing line item, the UI will show it as-is (open the edit page and save it will not reset the Branch field if it was already set to some value that should be hidden)

*Option 2*

* Warehouse Entity
** Add a new field to the Warehouse entity
*** Field Label in the UI: Show on Order Create/Edit Page (field name may be different)
*** Type: Boolean
*** Default value: True
* UI of order create/edit page
** The UI contains the column “Branch“ in the grid of line items form
** This column has a respective field that represents the branch using a drop-down with options. Options are loaded based on the Warehouse entity that represents the Branch in DT.
** The UI should hide the values of Warehouses (Branches) that have the new “Show on Order Create/Edit Page“ field set to False
** If the Branch (Warehouse) is already selected for some existing line item, the UI will show it as-is (open the edit page and save it will not reset the Branch field if it was already set to some value that should be hidden)

column1: Include All Branches in DB Inventory Sync / Oro side (Portal)
column30:
*Problem*

Data in table {{oro_inventory_level}} requires frequent sync for all branches and products from JDE to Oro. Sync includes truncating and inserting records using SQL queries and can take 5-20 minutes. During this time, the Oro application should not be interrupted and be able to read/write data from {{oro_inventory_level}}.

*Suggested Solution*

Add a notion of version for {{oro_inventory_level}}. Make the DT inventory sync job aware of the version. When new data is prepared by the DT sync, the version is created in an inactive state. When all inventory data was synced, the old version became inactive, and the new version became active. Oro application will use (read/write) data only for the active version, and thus DT sync and Oro application will work in parallel without conflicts and DB deadlocks.

DT implementation side of this solution is described in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5728|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5728|smart-link] 

*Scope*

1. Load all branches in {{oro_warehouse}} table

All branches, like {{10100}}, {{10200}}, {{10300}}, {{10400}}, {{10600}}, etc. will be loaded to {{oro_warehouse}} table.

The table should be updated to include the code of the branch in JDE (column {{dt_code}}). Example of records:

{noformat}select * from oro_warehouse limit 2;
 id | organization_id | business_unit_owner_id | dt_code     |    name     |     created_at      |     updated_at      | serialized_data 
----+-----------------+------------------------+-------------+-------------+---------------------+---------------------+-----------------
  1 |               1 |                      1 | 11500       | Bufford     | 2021-11-10 00:00:00 | 2021-11-10 00:00:00 | 
  2 |               1 |                      1 | 12200       | Tempe       | 2023-01-17 23:24:23 | 2023-01-17 23:24:23 | {noformat}

2. Add new table {{dt_inventory_level_version}}

||*Column Name*||*Type*||
|id|integer, autoincrement|
|is_active|boolean|
|created_at|date-time|

3. Add a new column to table {{oro_inventory_level}} to refer to {{dt_inventory_level_version}}

Example of records:

{noformat}select * from dt_inventory_level_version;

-- Version that is not active now
-[ RECORD 1 ]-------------+-------------------
id                        | 9
is_active                 | false
created_at                | 2023-11-17 23:24:23

-- Version that is active now
-[ RECORD 2 ]-------------+-------------------
id                        | 10
is_active                 | true
created_at                | 2023-11-18 23:25:20


select * from dt_inventory_level_version where product_id = 34875 limit 2;

-- Record of inventory level for product with SKU = "POP10" (id = 34875 in Oro) stored in version 9 that is NOT ACTIVE now
-[ RECORD 1 ]-------------+-------------------
id                        | 172181683
product_unit_precision_id | 48533
organization_id           | 1
product_id                | 34875
quantity                  | 35.0000000000
warehouse_id              | 1
dt_version                | 9

-- Record of inventory level for product with SKU = "POP10" (id = 34875 in Oro) stored in version 9 that is ACTIVE now
-[ RECORD 2 ]-------------+-------------------
id                        | 172181683
product_unit_precision_id | 48533
organization_id           | 1
product_id                | 34875
quantity                  | 36.0000000000
warehouse_id              | 1
dt_version                | 10{noformat}

4. Update the logic of the Oro application to use only those records from {{oro_inventory_level}} that are related to the currently active version.

* This includes a grid in {{Inventory / Manage Inventory}} and all logic related to using of the inventory level quantity in the application

column1: Get Sku lists and sales projections
Implement Inventory API on JDE side
column30:
*Use Case*

* Reading real-time information about the available quantity for the Product in JDE in different DT branches.

*Requirements*

* API requests can contain 70-200 products
* Response time should not exceed 3 seconds for 200 products
* API should use the same method of authentication as used now for pricing
* Once the order is transferred from Oro to JDE using the Informatica API client, this new API should +*IMMEDIATELY*+ return an adjusted quantity. For example:
** 1. 2023-11-20 11:05:05 AM
*** The order was created in Oro and was approved, it has a line with 
**** SKU: WS-1
**** Quantity: 55
**** UOM: EA
**** Branch: 11500
** 2. 2023-11-20 11:05:05 AM
*** API call result data for this product:
**** Branch 11500
***** SKU: WS-1
***** Quantity: 200
***** UOM: EA
**** Branch 12200
***** SKU: WS-1
***** Quantity: 150
***** UOM: EA
** 3. 2023-11-20 12:00:00 AM
*** Informatica transferred the Order from Oro to JDE and updated the status to Pending
** 4. 2023-11-20 12:00:01 AM
*** Subsequent API call result data for this product (shows -55 items in Branch “11500”): 
**** Branch 11500
***** SKU: WS-1
***** Quantity: 145
***** UOM: EA
**** Branch 12200
***** SKU: WS-1
***** Quantity: 150
***** UOM: EA

*API Input*

* List of Item Numbers (Product SKUs) and respective UOM

*API Output*

* Available quantity of the Product in all applicable branches.

*Examples*

These are just examples, the format can be different:

+_Request:_+

{noformat}[
  {
    "ItemNumber": "ER317C",
    "UOM": "PK"
  },
  {
    "ItemNumber": "H2448-4",
    "UOM": "EA"
  }
]{noformat}

+_Response_+

{noformat}[
  {
    "ItemNumber": "ER317C",
    "UOM": "PK",
    "QuantitiesPerBranch": [
      "11500": "145",
      "12200": "150",
      ... INFO FOR ALL OTHER BRANCHES ...
    ]
  },
  {
    "ItemNumber": "H2448-4",
    "UOM": "EA",
    "QuantitiesPerBranch": [
      "11500": "2355",
      "12200": "199",
      ... INFO FOR ALL OTHER BRANCHES ...
    ]
  }
]{noformat}

column1: CPOV Changes - Map Customer Fields to JDE
column30:
Add CITM to F47012





We are getting issues with Chadwell supply (SPS Commerce) invoices due to missing Customer item field in EDI 850 staging table (F47012.SZCITM). We are getting invoice failure due to missing Buyer part# on invoice. The Invoice extract retrieves
 the F47012.SZCITM field (the buyer part# sent in EDI 850 PO) is populated as Buyer part on EDI 810 invoice document. The alternate fix is to setup item cross reference for all the Chadwell item numbers to JDE item numbers. Can you review and resolve this issue
 in CPOV process to populate the Customer Item number? Also it will be good to sort the CPOV data by customer PO line number instead of Item number to keep the line numbers in sync.

SPO0106486 does not show customer item# in EDI staging table.

05/Dec/23 10:32 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Original Query that pulls data from the temp table storing order data: {{DEV_ERP_DB{CUBE}.PUBLIC."oro_order_temp"}}

{noformat}SELECT 
"id",
"included_id",
"dt_order_company",
"included_dt_line_number",
"included_dt_line_type",
"dt_order_type",
"included_dt_customer_line_number",
"included_dt_cost_center_id",
"dt_supplier_number",
"dt_original_so_number",
"dt_original_so_company",
"dt_bill_to_jde_id",
"dt_ship_to_jde_id",
"dt_date_requested",
"dt_order_date",
"poNumber",
"included_productSku",
"included_quantity",
"included_productUnitCode",
"dt_mode_of_transport_id",
"dt_freight_handling_code_id",
"dt_price_effective_date",
"included_dt_price_overridden",
"included_freeFormProduct",
Y.DOCUMENT_NUMBER,
MAX_BATCH_NUMBER,
"included_value"
FROM
DEV_ERP_DB.PUBLIC."oro_order_temp"
INNER JOIN(SELECT DOCUMENT_NUMBER, ORO_ORDER_ID 
FROM
(
SELECT 
ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ORO_ORDER_ID ORDER BY DOCUMENT_NUMBER DESC) AS SEQ, DOCUMENT_NUMBER, ORO_ORDER_ID FROM DEV_ERP_DB.PUBLIC."oro_order_temp"
) X
WHERE X.SEQ = 1) Y
ON "id" = Y.ORO_ORDER_ID AND "included_type" = 'orderlineitems' AND "included_status" = 'In Progress';{noformat}

Added the following to the end of the Select section

{noformat}"included_dt_customer_item_number",
"included_dt_original_order_quantity",
"included_dt_original_uom",
"included_dt_original_price"{noformat}

column166:
20/Nov/23 2:41 PM;60145812c8c36c0069838010;I tried to use one the Kepware API endpoints using the POSTMAN through ‘GET’ method, but I get the below error. I think we enabled the API on the Kepware cloned server, but the Kepware config IP is same (on PROD and cloned server) since the API is not enabled on PROD but the same have been enabled on the clone Kepware server so not sure we will be able to connect and validate the needed details on the postman.

I believe the only way to validate Kepware API is we need to enable the API on the PROD-Kepware and test it, but I am bit nervous doing that due to that API enabling, we are not sure the existing Conveyor communication will get affected or not. Also, we thought be aware we don’t have anyone from Kepware to support our current configuration goes wrong.

Reached out to Lamartine for what do next on this.

column30:
Flow that maps the Planned data to the PlannedDetailsList

||*Data*||*Field*||*DataStructure*||
|Source|P3Query_Result|Snowflake_Query_P3SelectFilteredOrders   [QueryDefinition.Types]|
|Target|PlannedDetailsList|PartnershipLineDetails   [PadPartnership.DataStructures]|

For each order line the P3 Query result, 

* Does the line already exists
** If Yes, Update following fields
*** Carrier
*** LineNumber (Direct mapping)
*** ShippingSite (Direct mapping)
*** OrderType (Direct mapping)
*** ShipmentNumber (Direct mapping)
*** ProNumber (DirectMapping)
*** PlanType (Constant)
*** Drop Dead Due (Direct mapping)
*** InventoryCommit date (Calculated)
*** OrderDate (Calculated)
*** OrderInspected date (Calculated)
*** PickPackStage date (Calculated)
*** ProductionCompleteDate (Calculated)
*** ScheduledDeliveryDate (Calculated)
*** ShipConfirm date (Calculated)
*** TransferCompleteDate (Calculated)
*** updatedAt - Timestamp
** If No, Create
*** Carrier
*** LineNumber (Direct mapping)
*** ShippingSite (Direct mapping)
*** OrderNumber (Direct mapping)
*** OrderType (Direct mapping)
*** ShipmentNumber (Direct mapping)
*** ProNumber (DirectMapping)
*** PlanType (Constant)
*** Drop Dead Due (Direct mapping)
*** InventoryCommit date (Calculated)
*** OrderDate (Calculated)
*** OrderInspected date (Calculated)
*** PickPackStage date (Calculated)
*** ProductionCompleteDate (Calculated)
*** ScheduledDeliveryDate (Calculated)
*** ShipConfirm date (Calculated)
*** TransferCompleteDate (Calculated)
*** updatedAt - Timestamp
*** createdAt - Timestamp
column166:
01/Dec/23 2:53 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;Map Planned Details flow

!image-20231201-193222.png|width=1138,height=469!

# List Mapping Step - Maps all fields for the PlannedDetailsList output from the Query result
## Carrier → Carrier
## Branch → Shipping Site
## Line Number → LineNumber
## Order Number → OrderNumber
## Order Type → OrderType
## Shipment Number → ShipmentNumber
## Tracking Number → ProNumber
## Promised Ship Date → Converter (J to G) → DropDeadDue 
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 29 days → Inventory Commit
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 30 days → OrderDate
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 5 days → OrderInspected
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 15 days → PickPackStage
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 20 days → ProductionComplete
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 10 days → ScheduledDeliveryDate
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 5 days → ShipConfirm
## Compute In Past → Start DateTime → Converter (J to G) → Promised Ship Date - Offset 20 days → TransferCompleteDate
# For Each - Iteration through all lines in the PlannedDetailsList 
# Query existing PartnershipLineDetails with the following conditions matched fields
## Line Number
## Order Number
## Order Type
## PlanType
# If no result is found (singular), create the Planned Item
# If a result is found, update the respective fields. Should update all fields except CreatedAt timestamp and OrderNumber. 
# Outputs the mapped PlannedDetailsList

## Order Type → OrderType

### Order Number

### Order Number
### Plan Type = Planned

#### DeliveryMonth
#### LineNumber
#### Qty
#### ShipmentNumber
#### ShipToCity
#### ShipToState
#### TransportationMode
### If no result found, Create entity

column30: For the open PO’s, no problem updating the cost. For the orders at a 999 status, I would recommend those to be unreceived by the warehouse and re-received after the cost change. When a PO is received, a record is written to F43121 (PO Receipts) . This is the record that gets vouchered against. Also, re-receiving them will update the item ledger and weighted average with the new cost.

column1: API Questions / Customers in Oro with large number of Contacts
column30:
Some customers in Oro have 100-600 contacts, for example 23800 - GEMAIRE DISTRIBUTORS ([https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/6851|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/6851]) has 296 Contacts.

Top 10 customers:

{noformat}Oro ID  JDE ID  Contacts Count
59629           605
60118           508
68005           317
6851    23800   296
65637           275
60591           129
12133   23622   124
16475   29147   123
11535   22877   121
65645           119
{noformat}

We plan to implement Contacts sync at some point, so the Contacts from Oro will be pushed to JDE.

Q1. Do you want to have all Contacts of such Customers pushed to JDE API and respective OroWhosWho records created?

Q2. Or do you think that the user will need to specify which Contacts will be pushed manually from the UI? For example, right now, the user can open the Customer view page and schedule sync with JDE if this customer was not created in JDE before. The same kind of UX can be applied to Contacts:

* By default, Contacts are not synced to JDE
* The user opens some Contact in the UI, clicks button to push it to JDE
* Contact will be synced to JDE using API
* Further changes to the Contact will be synced automatically

Q3. If the option in Q2 is selected instead of the automatic sync of all Contacts to JDE, do we know the maximum number of Contacts that the Customer may have?

column1: Unable post more than 100 quote products
column30:
When creating a quote, any products after 100 are not being added to the quote. EX Quote 18616
There appears to be a max number of products and when updating the quote with approved pricing, I receive an error that the quote product does not exist, even though an ID was returned for the dtquote_products identity. 

*Error:* The remote server returned an error: (404) Not Found.

{"data":{"attributes":{"value":"18","currency":"USD"},"type":"dtquote_products","id":"140800"}}

Verified across multiple quotes when I receive this error that they are all quotes with over 100 SKUs. 

Can we remove this restriction or up the max allowed?

The field information is listed below and needs to be included in the CPOV+ Manual - Informatica Mapping to JDE.

|*Field Label*|*Table*|*Field Alias*|*Type*|*Decimal*|
|Payment Terms Code|F47011|SYPTC|String|3|

column166:

{noformat}IIF(IsNull(dt_payment_term_jde_id), '', dt_payment_term_jde_id){noformat}

Example: 

Order 826439 has Payment Term [10R] 1.5% 10th Prox 60 days

{{"dt_payment_term_jde_id": "10R"}}

column1: Substitute Parts for Price and Availability Widget
column30:
As a CSR, I want to have the ability to provide a substitute part when customers are asking about an obsolete or out of stock part.

F4104 is the JDE table

The types you need are R for Supersede

S for Alternative 

We will need the ability to add a new type when we are ready.

For the R type The ivlitm = the item that is obsoleted and the ivcitm is the item that will be taking it's place.

column1: For Mark Esbrook FW: External PO's
column30:
Find reason for external POs in P4 interface 
From:
Jesse Goffard <jgoffard@packardonline.com>

Date: Tuesday, October 3, 2023 at 9:36 AM

To: Kelly Goldsmith <kelly.goldsmith@p4tech.com>

Cc: P4 Support <support@p4tech.com>, Mark Esbrook <mesbrook@diversitech.com>

Subject: RE: External PO's

Mark,
 
As an example item, can you look at why item MP-FB on PO 375728 is showing in P4 as an external order?
 
Subject: RE: External PO's


No, you will cause an overlap. Those P4POIDs are automatically assigned as the Pos are generated from P4.

 
If the PO originated in JDE, that is fine, we just need to receive the record in the nightly files. It needs to be determined why those PO lines are not being sent in the data or where the discrepancy is coming
 from. 
 
Kelly
 From: Jesse Goffard <jgoffard@packardonline.com>


Sent: Tuesday, October 3, 2023 9:28 AM

To: Kelly Goldsmith <kelly.goldsmith@p4tech.com>

Cc: P4 Support <support@p4tech.com>; Mark Esbrook <mesbrook@diversitech.com>

Subject: External PO's

 
Kelly,
 
Edison is pushing to clean up the external PO’s.

If I drop the external PO’s and assign the next consecutive P4 PO numbers to the lines in JDE, would the night run see those and remove them from the external orders?
 
The next P4 PO number right now would be P4004581. I would assign it to the lines on the PO like the two lines below that are blank.
column166:
21/Nov/23 3:09 PM;60df4b7d70941d0069258bdc;This is a reoccurring problem. These purchase orders were entered into location 11500, not 11400. Pos are issued for a vender into a location, so that POID/locationID/SupplierID become the key. If one of those is changed, it becomes disjoint. This is something that has been mentioned a few times to the team and when this was brought up 2 years ago, the team wasn’t going to make those types of changes moving forward.

There is nothing you and we can do to ever keep these clean if the identity of the purchase order is going to continue to change.

When you are attempting to reconcile, you need to compare those 3 data points to the original values on the PO, not what they are currently.

column166:
17/Nov/23 2:19 PM;60145812c8c36c0069838010;*11/17*

From the discussion happened this week with BY and Conveyor team we understood that T-Manager cannot be used as a solution for the design needs.

Had a couple of calls with Kepware sales team and product team to know about the capabilities of Kepware. From the documentation point of view Kepware has API capabilities (attached the document to this ticket for reference) but Kepware teams confirmed they will not help on configuration means we need to find some 3rd party consulting team to do the configuration.

!image-20231117-191719.png|width=617,height=464!

DT has provided the requested details for Support contract and product license renewal waiting on the feedback from Kepware team for the next steps.

!image-20231117-191810.png|width=604,height=403!



So, between T-Manager vs Kepware we are moving ahead with Kepware for the design needs.

column30:
Need to identify the following fields and where we will be getting them from. Will need the JDE Table name and description) (F4211, Order Line Details), Field Name and description (EX: SZMCU, Business Unit), and Data Type (FLOAT, VARCHAR(5) etc).

Order Line:

* Customer Number (JDE Ship To Account Number)
* Customer Name (JDE Customer Name)
* Transportation Mode
* Shipment Number
* Order Number
* Order Line (Line Number)
* SKU
* Qty
* Drop Dead Due (Date the order must be shipped by)
* Order Date (Date customer placed the order, not the date it got into JDE)
* Carrier
* Pro Number (Shipping/Tracking Number assigned)

Calculated Fields

The calculated fields are based on the Drop Dead due date. All dates should be X days before the Drop Dead unless otherwise specified

||*Field*||*Days out*||
|Order Date|30|
|Inventory Commit (555)|29|
|Transfer Complete|20|
|Production Complete|20|
|Delivery Date Scheduled|10|
|Pick, Pack, Stage (560)|15|
|Order Inspected|5|
|Ship Confirm (575)|5|

column1: P3 - Scope - How to Identify Products Needed
column30:
In JDE the following product categories the business needs to identify for the Pad Partnership Program are as follows:

!image-20231109-195908.png|width=445,height=60!

h3. *Requirements:*

* Need to know which field/flag to refer to that allows us to pull a full list of items that apply to each of these categories.
** Essentially we need the ability to identify which items are UltraLite, which are E-Lite, and which are EcoPad from Diversitech’s inventory.
column166: 10/Nov/23 4:07 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:621cf583a124500068860e4d] please review and provide feedback for [~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a]
column167: 13/Nov/23 7:47 AM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] where are you looking in JDE?
column168:
13/Nov/23 8:56 AM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] Is this what you are looking for? Sales code 5 has the Global Product Hierarchy

!image-20231113-135632.png|width=445,height=219!
column169: 13/Nov/23 9:55 AM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] I can pull the list one of two ways based on the Catagory Curr which is for pricing & GL Accounting (accruals ect) or via the Global Product Hierarchy which is how the bossiness does reporting. Which one would serve your need best?
column170: 14/Nov/23 10:30 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:621cf583a124500068860e4d] Can you provide the global hierarchy information for the 3 product lines?
column171:
14/Nov/23 11:31 AM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;Item Branch Revisions → Sales Code 2 Field 

* 120 → ULT
* 200 → ELT
* 205 → ECO
* RAW = Raw Material (Materials used across the board)

*Item Master & Branch Revisions → Global Product Category → Sales Code 5*

* ECO → EcoLite
* ELT → E-Lite
* ULT → UltraLite

[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] it is believed that you should be able to reference the products from the Global Product Category → Sales Code 5 (in JDE). Waiting on an assist from Richard for the alias.
column172:
14/Nov/23 12:00 PM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] I’m unclear on what the below comments mean. 120 → Ult is vague. 


Also, are we pulling this data from JDE and not Catsy directly to find what SKUs are part of the partnership program? I thought Catsy would be the source of information.
column173:
14/Nov/23 1:13 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] see xlsx doc Diana attached for visual clarity, below are the 2 options you can “identify” these product categories in either system. I have also provided the field aliases for these labels in each system.

# *Sales Code 2* Field (+SRP2+) in JDE → *Category Curr Field* in Catsy (+category_curr+) - (includes a separate category label for RAW Materials)
## *EX*: 120 is the value in the Sales Code 2(Category Curr) field that represents the label for UltraLite Pads 
# *Sales Code 5* Field (+SRP5+) in JDE → *Global Product Hierarchy* Field in Catsy (global_item_family_id or product.global_product_hierarchy) - (does not show separate label for RAW Materials)
column174:
16/Nov/23 10:58 AM;5ef641d08624070abc725d7a;[~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837]  [~accountid:621cf583a124500068860e4d] Ran a query on the F4101 (Item Master) table where the SRP5 was ECO, ULT, or ELT AND the SRP2 was not RAW. 
I received 284 SKUs returned. The list of SKUs in the original example file provided by Diana only had 194 SKUs

Is there some other condition that will need to be filtered? 

[^P3 Test.csv]

Exact Query: SELECT * FROM F4101 WHERE IMSRP5 IN ('ECO', 'ULT', 'ELT') AND IMSRP2 != 'RAW';
column175: 16/Nov/23 2:26 PM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] I will run a check on these items
column176: 16/Nov/23 2:32 PM;621cf583a124500068860e4d;[~accountid:5ef641d08624070abc725d7a] [~accountid:63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837] I found the cause, these were obsolete before STEP and thus never made it into Salsify/Catsy. Hope this helps.

column30:
* Where is the existing un-edited data coming from? JDE?
* Are the calculated fields coming from JDE?
* What tables and fields in JDE should populate these values? (Where does Matte look to find these values?)
* How do we identify which SKU’s fall under the pad partnership program (UltraLite, E-Lite, Eco-Pad)? What field should we refer to?
* Customer Number - Bill To or Ship To?
* Customer Name - Bill To or Ship To?
* Order KPI?
* Pro Number?

Nika’s Questions

* For the Fields with like 560 and 555 status, are those time stamps of when the line went into that status? (Or projected dates?)
* What order statuses are we pulling in (Open/Pending/Closed)?
* For manually entered data, are we expecting to update those fields with JDE? Is it dynamically updated from JDE or always manually entered?
* Are there order type restrictions?
* Other restrictions considered?
column166:
10/Nov/23 2:02 PM;63247cbfa408c1e3a6592837;* Where is the existing un-edited data coming from? JDE?
** Consult Richard & Lewis (for screenshots on where pulled)
* Are the calculated fields coming from JDE?
** Calculated by the tool - tool to calculate the plan
** Based on Must Ship By Date in JDE
** Numbers above the table show calculated days out (-30, -29, -20, -20, -10, -15, -5, -5, 5)
* What tables and fields in JDE should populate these values? (Where does Matte look to find these values?)
** Consult Lewis
* How do we identify which SKU’s fall under the pad partnership program (UltraLite, E-Lite, Eco-Pad)? What field should we refer to?
** All roads lead to Lewis 
** Diana - hierarchy/taxonomy on this?
* Customer Number - Bill To or Ship To?
** Bill To - Number only (Add columns for both)
* Customer Name - Bill To or Ship To?
** Bill To
* Order KPI?
** OTIF - On time - in full
** Drop dead date (planned vs actual metrics)
*** 5 days before drop dead date - considered early!
*** 1 day late is late
**** % Early
**** % On Time
**** % Late
* Pro Number?
** Shipping tracking number assigned to shipments (field in JDE)
* Order Number (Customer PO? JDE Order #?
* Month for Delivery
** Month of the drop dead date
* Planned Order Date 
** Customer promises to send PO’s 30 prior to ship date

Nika’s Questions

* For the Fields with like 560 and 555 status, are those time stamps of when the line went into that status? (Or projected dates?)
* What order statuses are we pulling in (Open/Pending/Closed)?
** Pull everything to start (From now - keep moving forward)
** Filter by order status
* For manually entered data, are we expecting to update those fields with JDE? Is it dynamically updated from JDE or always manually entered?
** Remains Manually entered by user
* Are there order type restrictions?
* Other restrictions considered?
* Dates
** Mon/Date/Year

column167:
09/Nov/23 9:29 AM;712020:20d45db2-9b47-43a5-b64a-6f41fb845bfa;Criteria for cubing trailer

* Long
** 96x40x60=230,400 cu in
** 230,400/1,728=133.3333 cu ft
* Not long
** 48x40x60=115,200 cu in
** 115,200/1,728=66.6667 cu ft
* Trailer capacity
** 53x12x2=1,272 linear in
* Will it fit?
** 1,272-96x-48y=z
** If z>=0, yes
** If z<0, no

column30:
We would need the following details for the setup of the VPN Tunnel from On-Premise to AWS:

# IP Range or Space Available for new AWS Infrastructure, Required ranges /16.

# The internet-routable IP address for the device's external interface for on-premise networks.

# The type of routing: Static or Dynamic. ( Border Gateway Protocol(BGP) Autonomous System Number(ASN) Required for Dynamic Routing)

# Vendor, Platform, Software, and IKE version of On-Premise Network Gateway Device
column166:
10/Nov/23 10:09 AM;5f311796347294003ed2360f;# IP Range or Space Available for new AWS Infrastructure, Required ranges /16.  We can use any subnets that don’t conflict with existing IT internal infrastructure. From what I have been reviewing on AWS S2S,  we can use their default 172.31.0.0/16
# The internet-routable IP address for the device's external interface for on-premise networks. Diversitech’s Public firewall IP is 67.220.115.84
# The type of routing: Static or Dynamic. ( Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number(ASN) Required for Dynamic Routing)  Static Routing
# Vendor, Platform, Software, and IKE version of On-Premise Network Gateway Device. Cisco FTD firewall, Version 7.2 IOS, use IKEV2 – We would need to see AWS config file to use or make custom changes from AWS default to use to configure our Cisco FTD firewall.
# Diversitech Internal Subnets are: 10.200.100/24, 10.200.104/24, 10.200.102/24, 10.200.70.104/24
# We would need to use the AWS generated PSK and get the AWS generate public Gateway

column1: Support import CustomerAddress using default Customer import functionality
column30:
h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Default Customer import functionality allows importing the CustomerAddress of the Customer
* The import file should support columns of the address in the format “Address %customerAddressField%“
**  Next CustomerAddress fields should be supported based on “Import & Export” settings of the fields, for example 

!image-20231108-220943.png|width=1914,height=1087!
* Customer import operation should allow at minimum importing the next fields of Customer Address:
** Street
** Street 2
** Street 3
** Street 4
** City
** State
** Country
** Zip/Postal Code
* Import template should include all fields of Customer Address supported in the import
* Business Requirements
** The Customer entity can have at most one Address. The import functionality should respect this rule.
** If fields of CustomerAddress are provided in the file, the import should either create a new CustomerAddress if it does not exist and if validation is passed or update the existing CustomerAddress of the related Customer.
** Field Organization should be populated based on the name of the Customer (existing logic that should simply work during import)
** The type of the address (billing/shipping) should be populated based on the Billing Type of the Customer (existing logic that should simply work during import)
* Test functionality of address import based on the file provided in [https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5565|https://diversitech.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5565]
column77: 14/Nov/23 4:17 PM;ug:0c80aa0a-b0dd-4108-b596-d5e3be5aa0f4;Pro 1 Oro Customer Master CSV - Craig - UPDATED w Addresses (89f963e2-56f0-412e-8a11-22f8e2aaa6b2).csv;https://diversitech.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/20861
column78: 14/Nov/23 4:17 PM;ug:0c80aa0a-b0dd-4108-b596-d5e3be5aa0f4;Pro 1 Oro Customer Master CSV - Craig - UPDATED w Addresses.csv;https://diversitech.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/20860
column166:
13/Nov/23 11:42 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;Sample import template file:

[^customer_import_templatecsv]

This file can be downloaded from: 

!image-20231114-030704.png|width=2482,height=1294!

Sample import file (note, it is only added as an example, it should not be used on PROD “as-is” since it does not contain all field values from the file in the parent ticket):

[^Pro 1 - Test Customer Upload.csv]

Notes:

* Check how address fields are passed in the file.
** To pass State, use the field “Address State Combined code“, and it should have value in format “%country_code%-%state_code“, for example, “US-GA“
** The country code should be specified in the field “Address Country ISO2 code“
* When a new customer is created, the parent should match the business rules related to customer hierarchy.
** For example, if a new “B”/”X” customer is created, the parent should be a customer with “Entity Type”=“Sub“. It is recommended to use the “Parent Id“ field to specify the parent customer in this case. The value of the “Parent Id“ column should be the ID of the customer in the Oro application.
* Recommended flow of importing “S“ and “B/X“ customers:
** First, import customers with billing type “B/X“. Ensure to specify the “Sub” parent using the column “Parent Id“.
** Second, import customers with billing type “S“. Parent should be specified using either the “Parent Id“ column or the “Parent JDE Id“ column (only if parents were already synced to JDE).

Check additional information related to mapping the column names in the file to fields in the application:

[^custokmer_import_columns_mapping.csv]

column170:
15/Nov/23 4:49 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1],

{quote}addresses[0]: Custom region can be used only for countries without predefined regions.{quote}

as mentioned in the comments above, to import the address state you need to use the field “Address State Combined code“ instead of “Address State“, and the value should be in a format like “US-FL“, “US-TX“, “US-TN“, etc. 

I know this is not a good UX, but we reused out-of-the-box functionality to save some time. We can improve import customer addresses and use only one field “Address State“ in the format given in the current file, but it will take 3-4 hours of work.

{quote}Error in row #33. Parent Id: Parent of customer should not be blank.
Error in row #33. Parent Id: Parent of "Bill To" customer should be a "Sub" customer.{quote}

Please add value in column “Parent Id”, it should be the ID of the parent Customer in Oro. Based on the file, all new customers have “Billing Type“ = “X“, so you need to specify the ID of some customers with Entity Type = “Sub“.
column171: 15/Nov/23 4:53 PM;611a9de1ee947000717c9ab9;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] I understand the error on the Address State, and will update those. However, these are net new customers that are going to be Bill to Accounts which means they are parents. How do we assign a parent to a net new customer that is the parent?
column172:
15/Nov/23 5:01 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:611a9de1ee947000717c9ab9], I think you need to create a new Customer with Entity Type = Sub in Oro or reuse some existing one. Then pass the ID of such “Sub“ customer in the import file to create a new Bill Tos.

For example, when FAUV customers were imported, all Bill-Tos customers were assigned to these 2 parent customers:

!image-20231115-215720.png|width=1846,height=937!

In JDE Bill-To Addresses/Customers do not have parents, but in Oro, we have 5 levels of customers in the hierarchy:

* 1st level - Customer with Entity Type = “Group”
* 2nd level - Customer with Entity Type = “Rollub”
* 3rd level - Customer with Entity Type = “Sub”
* 4th level - Customer with Entity Type = “Customer” and Billing Type = “X“ or “B“
* 5th level - Customer with Entity Type = “Customer” and Billing Type = “S“

So in this case you are trying to add new customers on the 4th level, and the application can allow you to do it only if they are connected to the correct Parent customer on the 3rd level.
column173:
15/Nov/23 5:08 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:611a9de1ee947000717c9ab9], [~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], 

In case you will be creating new Group/Rollup/Sub Customers to plug in the new Customers in the correct place of the Customers hierarchy, take into account the next information.

The JDE ID of the “Sub”/”Rollup”/”Group” Customer should match a corresponding UDC field value in JDE.

When this Customer is pushed to JDE API, its parent Group, Rollup, and Sub are transferred using the next fields in the API request:

!image-20231115-220720.png|width=1846,height=937!

So there are 3 UDC fields in JDE that hold codes of Groups, Rollups, and Subs. Just ensure that if you will add a new Sub in Oro, the respective field will be updated in JDE.

column175:
16/Nov/23 2:10 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1], right now it is not recommended to use “Parent JDE Id” field when you want to refer to Group/Rollup/Sub. The problem is that the Customer with field “dt_jde_id“ = “IND“ exists in multiple instances: Sub, Rollup, Group

!image-20231116-190907.png|width=693,height=533!

So during the import the current logic selects any random customer that has this JDE Id value, and it appears that it is not Sub, but either Rollup or Group.

This should be another improvement that I’d suggest to implement, but right now, please use Parent Id field if you want to use a workaround. The value of Parent Id should be 37389 - [https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/37389|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/37389]
column176: 16/Nov/23 2:19 PM;611a9de1ee947000717c9ab9;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] can you explain the significance of using 37389? Is this not going to cause an issue since that is an existing customer in the system?
column177:
16/Nov/23 2:27 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:611a9de1ee947000717c9ab9], here is how the file should look like if you want to add 2 customers and set their parent to Sub IND ([https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/37389|https://b2b.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/37389])

!image-20231116-192441.png|width=460,height=215!

There should be no issues:

* Id column is empty, so the import will create a new Customer
* Parent Id = 37389, this value will be used to find existing Customer and set it to the created Customer’s Parent field.

On the UI it will be equal to the next screen of the Customer create page - 

!image-20231116-192702.png|width=706,height=791!

So don’t worry, the import will not modify any fields of Customer with ID = 37389.
column178: 16/Nov/23 2:52 PM;5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1;[~accountid:557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18] - Oh Great. the two net NEW items are in UAT. However when Craig syncs, the sync fails to push to JDE PY.
column179: 16/Nov/23 3:00 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] I will check errors in logs in 1 hour
column180:
16/Nov/23 5:08 PM;557058:ebfd60cd-ef4e-44c6-a5ff-1adfaf8f6b18;[~accountid:5fc6a980aca10c0069bf6eb1] I see next validation errors:

{quote}OroAddUpdCustomer3:\n(1) Code-Control: 018A-87, Title: Error: not found in User Defined Code,  Description: HVR not found in User Defined Code 01 04 \n(2) Code-Control: 018A-120, Title: Error: not found in User Defined Code,  Description: HVR not found in User Defined Code 01 TI \n(3) Code-Control: 018A-87, Title: Error: HVR not found in User Defined Code 01 04,  Description: Category Code - Address Book 04 HVR was not found in User Defined Code for system 01 , type 04  . \n{quote}

and

{quote}OroAddUpdCustomer3:\\n(1) Code-Control: 018A-87, Title: Error: not found in User Defined Code,  Description: CMR not found in User Defined Code 01 04 \\n(2) Code-Control: 018A-120, Title: Error: not found in User Defined Code,  Description: CMR not found in User Defined Code 01 TI \\n(3) Code-Control: 018A-87, Title: Error: CMR not found in User Defined Code 01 04,  Description: Category Code - Address Book 04 CMR was not found in User Defined Code for system 01 , type 04  . \\n{quote}

As I understand, the problem is that JDE does not like values in field “JDE Customer Type“:

* CRM (in [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/85001|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/85001])
* HRV (in [https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/85002|https://oro-uat5.diversitech.com/admin/customer/view/85002])

I guess that these values may exist only in JDE PROD, but better to check with their team. In Oro, this field is “dt_hist_global_customer_type“ and has scalar string type, which means that it can receive any text input. But on the form, we show it as a dropdown that contains only existing distinct values from this field across all records in the DB: 

!image-20231116-220816.png|width=706,height=791!
